review.title: Nice hotel, close to fishermans wharf
review.reviewText:
Clean, tidy and all you need in the room. Hotel staff were really helpful to needs, breakfast was a nice bonus to the start of the day.

Bed mattress was a little soft for our liking.

review.title: Perfection - would stay again!
review.reviewText:
We stayed here Labor Day weekend and wanted something close to the Wharf / Chrissy Field. 
This hotel satisfied both. We paid for the "Bay View Room" and while it was a view of the Bay, you had to stand at the window and crane your neck to see the bridge. This was in room 1107. If you want full bridge view, try requesting rooms 1115 through 1111. Those might have a more direct view. We didn't have a car, so relied on walking and the buses, both were super convenient. Having a car in the city is NOT convenient. 
I was not blown away by the breakfast. We only ate one breakfast. The offerings are of waffles, sausage patties, hot and cold cereals, egg pucks, bagels, hard boiled eggs, mini-yogurts, fruit, etc. I've had better at other Comfort Inns. If you're looking to save money on a meal, it will probably be okay for you. Our room had a fridge, but no microwave.
I never felt unsafe walking to/from the hotel at night - it is in a really nice part of town. Lombard Street is literally right up the street from the entrance of the hotel.

Overall, I was really impressed with the location and ease of getting from the hotel to the marina district. 
If you're looking to be in Union Square, or Haight just know it will take you a good 45 minutes by bus to get to anywhere that is not the wharf. 
I recommend this hotel and would stay here again!
review.positiveRemarks: Location! Also, the most comfortable bed and pillows OF MY LIFE.
review.negativeRemarks: The water pressure in the shower was not the greatest and the temperature would fluctuate from ice cold to scalding hot.
review.locationRemarks:
It is within an easy walk to Ghirardelli, Pier 39, even Chrissy Field and Golden Gate look out points. 
Easy access to buses on Van Ness + Chestnut

review.title: We had the most beautiful view of the GG Bridge!!!
review.reviewText:
Thank you -- excellent vacation!

We surely enjoyed every aspect of the hotel amenities:  view, breakfast, location, great front-end staff.
review.positiveRemarks: The view, the amazing full breakfast and the location!
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Golden Gate Bridge, Fisherman's Wharf, Lombard Street (crooked street), Cable Cars....amazing hiking and biking!

review.title: San Fran mid range
review.reviewText:
Good location away from crowds, but walkable to Fisherman's Wharf and with  views of the bridge and Alcatraz.

Rate reasonable for what you can get in San Fran.
Breakfast can be busy.

Rooms large, clean and up to date.

We had a great time, location was just right. I would have liked to have an option to have our roomed cleaned daily. (Some hotels give you an option in exchange for some kind of voucher, due to water conservation)
review.negativeRemarks: Beds could be more comfortable

review.title: Nice location to the wharf
review.reviewText: We spent 3 days in the city. Great visit. Anywhere you stay in San Francisco is expensive. I didn't love to pay 26.00 a night for parking but grateful it was a secure place. The hotel looks older from the outside, but the rooms were great. Very soft beds and pillows. Beautiful view from the 10th floor. Only a couple complaints. Very low water pressure for showers and flushing toilets. Poor bathroom lighting. There were 11 floors. We were on #10. But it sounded like we were sleeping on the street. So much noise from outside. They need to upgrade the windows  to eliminate the outside noise. Besides those things, nice hotel. We'd stay again.
review.positiveRemarks: Location for walking around to he wharf. Beautiful view.
review.negativeRemarks: Outside noises. You could hear everything going on outside and we were on floor 10. Poor water pressure and bad lighting in the bathroom.
review.locationRemarks: Not a lot of eating places nearby. We had to drive to restaurants that were familiar to us. The wharf is great. Make sure to visit the Muir Woods.

review.title: Great view and close to Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Extremely hospitable and helpful staff, clean room although small, good location near the Wharf.
review.positiveRemarks: Helpful and friendly staff, clean room, city view
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf, cable cars, great location near the beach

review.title: Nice hotel, too far from piers to walk each day
review.reviewText: Very small partial view of the water, too far to walk each day to and from Pier 39 or Fishermans Wharf. Very very limited breakfast. Small rooms. No frig or micro. Extremely small, low overhead parking ( $26) - don't bring a truck. Discounted room was $350 with all taxes.
Good location - close to Fishermans Wharf. Friendly staff, continental breakfast.

review.title: good location but insufficient parking
review.reviewText: The Inn itself was fine-within walking distance of Fisherman's Wharf, Pier 39, etc. It was very quiet- our room was right next to the elevator and we never heard a thing, morning or night. Our room had a nice view of the Golden Gate Bridge. The staff was helpful with extra blankets the first night and with directions how to get around by foot or by transit system. Biggest complaint would be that they do not have enough parking for the number of rooms in the hotel. We got parking easily when we checked in on a Tues early afternoon, but by evening we heard others at desk saying there was no parking remaining. They were given back their parking fee, but left to own devices to find parking elsewhere. We never moved our vehicle throughout our stay because we worried we wouldn't get a spot when we returned.  We relied on walking and public transportation through daily passport (which cost more money per person on top of the $27 per night we were charged to house our car.  Breakfast was good, but very crowded, especially as got closer to weekend.  Not enough seating.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking availability!!! It was like being on Titanic without enough lifeboats for all the passengers!
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to Chinatown, North Beach/Little Italy, Lombard Street, Fishermans Wharf, all the Piers.

review.reviewText: Great location. Older building and the elevators are small and slow. We were on top floor, so at check in/check out they were real busy. Dont think u can change the elevators, but maybe??? We would probably stay there again.

review.title: Great view
review.reviewText: Great hotel only a a 10 minute walk to the water front very clean and comfortable beds after a big day walking

review.title: Bathroom area design flaws
review.reviewText:
Not nearly enough lighting at mirror. Sink too far away from the edge of the countertop. Faucet does not protrude out far enough to get your hands under the water without pushing them against the back of the sink. No exhaust fan in the toilet/shower room. 
No microwave oven in room. 
No outdoor smoking area provided so people were standing near the front entrance smoking.
review.positiveRemarks: Good view from our window on the 10th floor. Breakfast provided. Comfortable bed. Some of the front desk staff (Jared) were very helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: The stuff I mentioned earlier.
review.locationRemarks: Nearby to the Fisherman's Warf. Went to Muir Woods, Golden Gate Bridge, Alcatraz, Chinatown, Little Italy, and Fort Mason, Golden Gate Park.

review.title: Great location and clean rooms
review.reviewText: Great location. I was there for business and did a lot of walking downtown to all my appointments. It's walking distance to lots of restaurants including Eva's Coffee shop which is next door which has really good coffee. The rooms are very clean. I was a little nervous at first when I saw the elevators thinking that maybe this hotel was in need of an update but the room was very clean and nice.
review.negativeRemarks: The elevators are slow and small
review.locationRemarks: Eva's coffee next door has good coffee and muffins

review.title: Great location for major sights of San Francisco
review.reviewText:
Stayed here with grown up kids and received a beautiful bright room with view of the Golden Gate bridge.
Easy 10 minute walk down Van Ness to waterside and from there another 5 minutes along water to Fishermans wharf.
Walk straight out of hotel and up Lombard street two blocks to see the crokedest street.
Plenty of small shops for snacks/ drinks around the hotel.
Nice clean and welcoming hotel.
Parking as everyone says is a little challenging. Its under the hotel (enter via Lombard) and is fine if you are a skilled driver. Not so great if you are little nervous or can't judge distances as the turns are a bit tight. Otherwise its safe and well lit.
Negatives: The cattle market that is breakfast. Too few seats and too many people. No trays to take breakfast up to room so people struggle and spill in the elevator.

review.title: A good home base
review.reviewText: The room was nice, location convenient. Parking was less expensive than most places. One thing I would change is allowing room key access to stairwells, to go up, for those times when several tour busses of guests simultaneously check in and clog the elevators.

review.title: Nice hotel with location close enough to the warf
review.reviewText: Comfort Inn by the Bay was a good choice for location.  It was only 2 blocks from city bus stop, 2 blocks from Big Bus stop, right at the bottom of the back side of Lombard the Crooked Street, and less than a mile walk to the wharf.  The staff was extremely courteous and helpful.  Breakfast had a good mix of hot and cold options.

review.title: Not that close to the wharf
review.reviewText: The check in was easy. The room was nice, we were on the 11th floor and got the bay view so we were happy when we got into our rooms.  But the problem was you can practically hear everything outside like the noise of the cars, sirens etc. and we weren't able to sleep well even though the bed was super comfy.  The breakfast in the morning? Well, the sausage was hard, the egg wasn't good either.  I know it was free but considering for what we paid,it should be free. My family and I didn't like the walk to the wharf, I thought it will be closer than I expected.  Overall it was an OK hotel but won't be coming back.
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast, the noise level from outside.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's wharf

review.reviewText: Loved this hotel. Very clean and updated.  Walking distance to everywhere we wanted to go.

review.title: Close to Fishermans Wharf.
review.reviewText: Clean hotel with views of Golden Gate Bridge and San Francisco Bay. We walked to Pier 39 and took a bike ride over The Golden Gate Bridge. Would stay there again.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: The hotel is central to everything in San Francisco.  Great hotel: staff very friendly and accommodating, the continental breakfast in the morning was very diverse, room very kept and clean.

review.title: Low priced option
review.reviewText: Reasonable place to stay, staff was very helpful, breakfast was good.

Very small bathroom. Significant fluctuations in water pressure and temperature in shower (cold/scalding). Bed skirt was stained w/what appeared to be body fluids. Asked for it to be changed- looked like the just spit cleaned it. Need to do better job keeping fresh ice water available throughout day in lobby. Overall the staff was very friendly and responsive.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Walking distance to Fisherman's Warf and Pier 39. Good connections for public transit. Good (but busy) continental breakfast. Clean rooms and the neighborhood seemed safe compared to those areas outside of (surrounding) Union Square.
review.positiveRemarks: More modern than the hotels in Union Square.. Good continental breakfast. Reasonable price.
review.negativeRemarks: Had to make sure that door latched when leaving the room. Maintenance was going to check and adjust the self-closing mechanism..
review.locationRemarks: Multiple bus lines on Van Ness. Crooked section of Lombard Street is a few (upward) blocks away. Fisherman's Warf and Pier 39 are 10-20 min on foot.

photos.caption: Lombard street area from our Partial View  room, 10th floor
Golden Gate from our Partial View room, 10th floor

review.title: Nice hotel, but....
review.reviewText:
Let me start by saying this is a very nice hotel. Front desk staff was excellent and knowledgeable about the area, especially Sharon. the whole time we were there, and we would come back to the hotel at different times, we NEVER saw a manager.

Our room was larger than I expected, very clean (and stayed that way the whole time we were there), and for a 'partial view' we had a very nice view of the Golden Gate and Lombard Street. We were on the 10th floor. The toilet/shower area is very small and no exhaust fan. The Vanity area (separate from from the shower area) was spacious enough, with storage under the vanity, but so dark I couldn't do my make-up there and my husband had to shave in the full length mirror. I was surprised by the amount of street noise I could hear way up on the 10th floor...even someone calling for a taxi!

The location is great, one block away from the bus that takes you right to Fisherman's Wharf. It's about 3/4 of a mile from the Wharf so you could walk if you wanted. 

Our problems started on our 2nd morning there with the elevators. I was waiting for it with another couple (my husband had gone up a few minutes earlier) and was told one of the elevators was out. They got that one open and out came an old man with a ton of suitcases. Maintenance said we could go in the other one when it opened. We did. We pressed 8 and 10, it went to parking. Went back up about a floor and STOPPED. Now we were stuck. We were stuck for 15 minutes! The first elevator was
review.positiveRemarks: clean, good location, good view, front desk staff helpful and knowledgeable.
review.negativeRemarks: ELEVATOR...apparently, it breaks down often! Breakfast needs variety, vanity area in bathroom needs much better lights
review.locationRemarks: about 3/4 mile from Fisherman's Wharf, bus that takes you right there is 1 block away. Steep uphill climb to see the  crookedest street..

review.title: Awesome
review.reviewText: Great place to stay. I would stay again. Parking garage is small but overall a great place!
review.negativeRemarks: Parking charges
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman wharf

review.title: Good value for money compared to the rest of SF
review.reviewText: We chose the Comfort Inn as it was in a safe location and it was cheaper the majority of the hotels in SF. With Comfort Inn you know what you are going to get no matter what country your in. The breakfast was good plenty on offer, it did get crowded but you just had to wait a couple of minutes of that to get a table. The room itself was quite and great apart from the tiny bathroom with no fan except a vent. The HVAC system works great. The area was safe and close walking distance to tourist attractions or a quick bus trip downtown. All in all I would definitely recommend the Comfort Inn to anyone.

review.title: Pleasant hotel in convenient location
review.reviewText:
The room was clean, quiet and equipped with all the basics required for a comfortable stay. 
The hotel itself is very conveniently located, with lots of tourist attractions and places to eat nearby.

Would stay here again!
review.positiveRemarks: The staff were friendly and helpful, and the included breakfast had a tasty selection of food (including waffles!) and beverages available.
review.negativeRemarks: More staffing to clear the breakfast tables.
review.locationRemarks: Located within walking distance to Lombard Street, Fisherman's Wharf and Ghiradelli Square, as well as public transport.

review.title: Nice hotel on the corner of Lombard & Van Ness.
review.reviewText: Make sure to get a room above the 9th floor, due to traffic noise.  Excellent view of the ocean and the Golden Gate Bridge from my room on the 8th floor.  We booked 2 rooms next to each other, but there is no adjoining door.  Lot's of places to eat in walking distance.  The red 2 story bus is 2 blocks away from hotel (very convenient).  Great free breakfast, but no restaurant.  You can order "room service", which comes from restaurants near by, which they deliver to the hotel.  Super nice lady that cleans the rooms on my floor.
review.negativeRemarks: A door for our adjoining room, and a mini frig would be nice.
review.locationRemarks: Lots of places to eat, and grocery stores near by.  Walking distance to Ghirardelli Square and Fisherman's Warf.

review.title: Great Hotel Walking distance to all attractions
review.reviewText: Staff helpful and considerate. Breakfast great in the morning. Room very clean but could've used more linen on the bed. Great view of the bridge. Excellent location! Would stay here again.
Very Convenient, nice stay, good breakfast, nice View of GG bridge
Overall very nice stay. Bathroom is small and it would've been nice to have a small room fridge since there's no room service.

review.title: The view was great but the windows were dirty
review.reviewText: We were all impressed with this hotel. The view was great the staff were great and we were comfortable there
review.positiveRemarks: the View and the staff were very helpful
review.negativeRemarks: just the breakfast area was very dirty but that was due to a large number of very loud school kids that went through like a cyclone.
review.locationRemarks: close to everything and transport

review.title: Thought it was a nice neighborhood
review.reviewText: Rooms are very small and backside of hotel looks at wall of building next door. Notice in room  asked for upgrade to have views of Golden Gate Bridge. Worst of all though it seems like a nicer neighborhood than where we usually stay our car was broken into. We were bringing my daughter home from college and some of her belongings were stolen. We were advised to park in hotel parking next to hotel instead of gated parking as our SUV might be to big to make narrow turn to get under hotel. Might stay again but will park inside and ask for room with a view.

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: I found the hotel to be of a good standard. The Reception would have benefitted more staff as it seems there was only ever one person working at a time !! The breakfast was of a good standard, but the organization was a zoo. There was not enough tables or people to clear them.
review.positiveRemarks: The view from my room of the bay and golden gate bridge were wonderful
review.negativeRemarks: The breakfast room was very badly organized, not enough staff or tables for the amount of guests, but the food selection was very good.
review.locationRemarks: It was an easy walk to the attractions of Fisherman's Wharf  and a lot nicer location than downtown

review.title: Good hotel in good location
review.reviewText: I was visiting San Francisco for first time since 1965. I was pleased with location and service.
review.positiveRemarks: I loved the view of the bay and Golden Gate Bridge  from my room. The breakfasts were good; service excellent.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing I can think of.
review.locationRemarks: Location was close to city buses, Fisherman's Wharf and many other attractions.

review.title: Great location - view of GG bridge from room
review.reviewText: Pleasant stay - I would stay here again.  Very accommodating staff
review.positiveRemarks: Convenient location, friendly staff, underground parking (ok for small car but would be tight for larger autos)

review.reviewText: Great location great staff good breakfast well priced! Would stay again. One recommendation a fridge in rooms would be excellent!

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel is located three block from the famous Lombard Street.  The three blocks are very steep and a workout to climb but at the top is where you can catch the trolley.  Thought the hotel was closer to the wharf but it is a bit of a walk at least 15min each way.  The hotel is nice but bathrooms are very SMALL!  Bed was okay.  They have underground parking they charge for.  The garage is very tight and if you have a large SUV it can be a challenge to move around in it.  Hotel staff seemed helpful when asking them questions and provide customers a basic map of the city to show you where things are.  We enjoyed our stay at this hotel.  Location seemed safe.  Hotel is located on two busy streets but not a noisy hotel,
review.positiveRemarks: That it had a undercover gated garage for our car at a charge.  Free Breakfast.
review.negativeRemarks: For breakfast the eggs were always cooked over hard - can you do scramble one day? :)  Eggs never looked good. :)
review.locationRemarks: Location is not super close to the wharf but the trolley stop is three blocks away (up the steep hill) making getting around by transit pretty easy.

review.title: Great location and fantastic view.
review.reviewText: We loved the view and the staff were very friendly, helpful and accommodating. Great location. Thank you for making our stay memorable.

managementResponses.response: Thank you for spending your vacation with us! We certainly appreciate you being our guest.  Our Bay Side rooms are simply amazing! Make sure you book one next time to get the full San Francisco experience! You'll love it!!!!

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Great room, next time will book earlier to get a room with a view

managementResponses.response: Incredible review! Thank you so much! We are happy to know that we'll be your home away from home when you're in San Francisco.  We'll keep the staff friendly and the breakfast hot for your next trip to see us, again and again!

review.title: Awesome staff with friendly attitudes!
review.reviewText: Great, comfortable hotel with transportation right out the door. Walking distance to some attractions. Super breakfast buffet. Desk ladies were outstanding with directions and very helpful. Would suggest this place to friends and family. Would definitely stay here again and again!
review.locationRemarks: Transportation right outside the door! Easy to get to Fisherman's Wharf, Hop On bus, restaurants, coffee shops, even short walk to drug store.

review.reviewText: Located in a very convenient part of town. Friendly staff, easy to find and great room views
Took time to correct the bill. Wait long time to check in.

review.title: Good view but
review.reviewText: Good view but rooms needed some improvements. Hot water kept shutting off and air was noisy and hard to keep at comfortable level.  Bathroom was so small one person could not turn around in it.
review.locationRemarks: Fishermans Wharf

review.reviewText: Clean comfortable amenities for price point.  short walk to attractions.
The only concern was the hot water, we were on the tenth floor, so the water was luke warm and not hot, it also took time to get to that stage.

review.title: Great hotel very close to fishermans wharf
review.reviewText: Very friendly staff. Parking price was reasonable. Conveniently located to fishermans wharf and Lombard street

Walking distance to Fort Mason, Marina, and Cow Hollow. Lots of food places and shopping nearby. Friendly staff and clean. Nothing fancy but it's decent for a weekend getaway without breaking the bank.

review.title: Stunning Views From A Good Hotel
review.reviewText: Didn't have to wait too long at check in ... Staff knew what they are doing ..... Rooms do look a little tired, beds were very comfortable .... all in all this is a great hotel especially if you have a bay view room. Breakfast was a great way to set up the day (No bar or evening facilities except room service) .... 15 minutes easy walk to Fishermans Wharf ... A pleasant stay :)
review.negativeRemarks: Maybe an evening bar but to be honest not much needs improving

review.title: Good location/Price
review.reviewText: Great stay. Good location and price. The hotel was clean and the facilities were nice. Breakfast was simple but with pretty good variety. The only issue we had was our room faced the back of another building and looked right into someone's kitchen.
review.negativeRemarks: Our window was facing the back of someone's house looking right into their kitchen.
review.locationRemarks: Close to Golden Gate, Marina, ec

review.title: Nice hotel, good breakfast, bathroom not clean
review.reviewText: I would stay here again nice area close to fishermans wharf friendly staff I would recommend this hotel to friends and family

review.title: Good motel, overpriced but.
review.reviewText: It's hard in San Fran because hotels and motels are all expensive so that is a hard point to differentiate this one from. It's just a 5 minute walk from the water which is nice and quite close to Fishermans wharf. Complimentary brekkie which is always good somewhere. Our room had everything you need however my husband and I were  put in single beds which was a bit strange but we are pretty sure it would have cost more to be in a queen room so didn't question it. The beds were very large single however so quite comfortable.

review.title: Affordable hotel in great location
review.reviewText: We arrived late in the day and perhaps the staff was tired by then but they reception was terrible. No eye-contact or even a smile. Very cold reception. We only stayed one night and when we left in the morning we had a similar experience from a different receptionist. It's really too bad they don't like their job. The good thing is that the hotel is kept clean and it is in a great location.
review.negativeRemarks: The staff hospitality.

review.title: Disappointed
review.reviewText:
Whilst checking in, staff were to worried about what the were ordering for lunch. Left the hotel early one morning, returning very late that evening to find our door left open from cleaners, rang management and all they said was 'sorry'. Also placed on a floor with a travelling school group that were also quite disruptive at all hours of the night (not hotels fault but maybe a warning about children would have been nice). 
Much nicer places to stay in San Francisco!

review.title: Reasonable price and a great location
review.reviewText: We had a nice stay at this facility.  The staff was very helpful and pleasant.  In addition to good places to visit and eat close to the wharf we found the neighborhood up the hill one block to Polk and then right was full of great restaurants, bars, and nightlife generally.  This hotel was a great place to spend a long weekend in San Francisco with plenty of activities very close by.

review.title: Hotel staff was great....but...
review.reviewText:
The Comfort Inn by the Bay was an OK hotel. I'm sure at one time this hotel was considered to be pretty nice. The staff was great, very helpful, friendly (always greeted us as we can in from an outing or just came down from our room). They have breakfast each morning which helps save $$ (although it is the same breakfast each day...but a good variety).

My biggest complaint about our stay was that there was a group of students from Australia staying at the hotel. I wish we would have known upfront about the massive amount of teens. We had kids running up and down the hallway, yelling, banging on our door, calling our room anywhere from 10pm, to midnight, to 2am! We complained to the front desk, who were very sympathetic, and I know they talked with the chaperons, however, this didn't stop the ruckus in the middle of the night.

The other big issue, this hotel has 10-12 floors. We were on the 8th floor...only one elevator was working. Which meant at many times a wait of 5-10 minutes to get the elevator, and many times you had to wait 2 rounds to be able to fit on the elevator. Also, the restrooms on the main floor were "out of order"...so, it you had to use the restroom with eating breakfast, you had to wait 10 minutes for the elevator to take you up to your room...then another 5-10 to go back down. Of course you can take the stairs...if you want to hike up 8+ floors.

The location is great though. Easy walk to Fishermans Wharf, Pier 39, cable cars.
review.positiveRemarks: The location was great! Easy walk to many of the attractions we wanted to see. The staff was friendly, helpful, and knowledgeable about the area
review.negativeRemarks: The elevator wasn't working. The main floor restrooms were out of order. There were so many teens staying there. We would have stayed elsewhere.
review.locationRemarks: You can walk to Fishermans Wharf, Ghiradelli Square, Pier 39, Cable cars. Many restaurants, art galleries, shops. It's really a great location.

review.title: Nice hotel, close to main places
review.reviewText: Good breakfast, clean rooms, very comfortable. Clase to main attractio a of SFO.
review.negativeRemarks: Elevador, because only one was working.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf, Ghirardelli Square. There is a bus stop right across the stree.good

review.title: Nice hotel but very small
review.reviewText: Loved my experience except one of the elevators was broken which made getting up and down very difficult. It was also annoying that I had to park, go up to get the permit, and then go back down. But overall worth the price!

review.title: 20 minute walk to the wharf
review.reviewText:
Room was standard 
Staff were courteous 
$6.00 uber pool rides to almost everywhere 
Breakfast was good, over by 9.30 though 
Good walking location

review.title: COMFORT INN - VAN NESS AND LOMBARD  - SF
review.reviewText:
GOOD - CLOSE TO ALL THE INTERESTING POINTS TO VISIT IN SF WITHIN WALKING DISTANCE TO SOME OF THE MAJOR TOURISTS ATTRACTIONS IN DOWNTOWN SF
PARKING AREA A LITTLE CRAMPED
review.negativeRemarks: PARKING AREA
review.locationRemarks: STATED ABOVE ALREADY

review.title: A bit out of the way
review.reviewText: The hotel was fine, despite renovations taking place the noise didn't affect me. It is however slightly out of the way and the use of public transport is essential (unless you take taxi's everywhere.) Breakfast was more than acceptable and there was plenty no matter what time I went down. The staff where helpful and pleasant.
review.positiveRemarks: The views from the 11th floor are brilliant. It rained one day and we stopped in the room, it was big enough to be comfortable while watching the tv.
review.negativeRemarks: maybe for extra light snacks in the afternoon, but failing that nothing.
review.locationRemarks: Easy to walk down to bay area and then catch trolley bus using your day/weekly pass that you buy from the shops, you can use on local bus also.

review.reviewText: clean and easy walking distance to the sites and close to good food places.

review.title: Good hotel close to Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: I stayed at the Comfort Inn by the Bay in San Francisco for 4 nights. I found the staff to be very friendly, helpful and professional. The hotel itself is currently undergoing some renovations but I did not find this to be an issue. I had a room with a city view which was clean and the bed was comfortable as well. I loved the location and would definitely stay at this hotel again.

review.title: Comfy, clean, walking distance to city attractions
review.reviewText: The Hotel was clean, beds were comfy, we could see the Golden Gate Bridhe from the room window, breakfast was included. Very good value. Nearby Fisherman's Wharf, the Pier for Alcatraz, Ghiradelli, we went walking everywhere. The staff was attentive.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean, beds were comfy, near attractions and public transportation.
review.negativeRemarks: Add a little variety on the warm breakfast.

review.title: Some quirks but was ok
review.reviewText: Great view from the 11th floor!  Hotel had some construction going on but it wasn't bothersome. Room was nice, water pressure for the shower was fantastic. You could walk to a cable car if you desire.
review.positiveRemarks: Good locations to North Beach and the Marina
review.negativeRemarks: Parking was interesting. Very tight quarters. You don't want to have a big car if you parking here.
review.locationRemarks: Its San Francisco. What more can you say :-)
review.userLocation: former CA native now in CO

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Enjoyed our stay here it's a good location and the staff are very helpful

review.title: Not my cup of tea
review.reviewText:
The hotel was promoted as newly renovated but I'm not sure where those renovations were or what they were. The room was very dated. I couldn't bring myself to put my clothes in the wardrobe as it had that old wood/mothball smell about it. I wanted to check out the minute I arrived but got used to the room and the bed was very comfortable... although I suspect what I thought was either an allergy or dry skin may in fact have been bed bugs.
While the hotel is quite centrally located it's not in either of the 2 hot spots so there was a lot of back and forth. public transport is near by and we did use it a lot.
The hotels in San Francisco are very expensive so I expected more. I was shocked at what I got for my money.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Nice location, the room was fine. The view was very nice, and would have been even better if the windows were clean.

review.title: Central Hotel
review.reviewText: We both like walking and we found the location of the hotel very good. We also had friends staying there as well and they don't walk but they found that a lot of buses passed the hotel so it was easy for them to get about also. All of us are in our seventies. We did not have a view but that was not a bad thing - it was very quiet our friends room was on the corner right on Van Ness and they found it noisier.

review.title: Enjoy the Bay!
review.reviewText: Great location, close to all the venues you want to visit when in San Fran
review.negativeRemarks: A little bit worn and aged - could use a bit of sprucing up
review.locationRemarks: Near Presidio (Fort Mason) Lombard Street, Fisherman's Wharf, Nob Hill, and many other "San Francisco" experiences.

review.title: Nice hotel, close to restaurants and attractions
review.reviewText: Walking distance to restaurants, sites and on public transportation lines for sites further out. Received free room upgrade with view of Golden Gate Bridge and Bay.  Great stay for the price.

review.title: Not bad.
review.reviewText: Very friendly and helpful hotel staff. The room was large and had many upgrades but the ceiling above the air conditioner was black from having the air blow at it constantly, pretty disgusting. Nice breakfast area with plenty of choices of what to eat. Parking below hotel was quite cramped I had to back up and go forward several times to get around one corner. It is also $26 a night extra. There is a room safe in each room also.
review.positiveRemarks: It is on the corner of Lombard and Van Ness close to the bay. Not to many places to eat nearby though. The lobby has a list of places to eat.
review.negativeRemarks: Paint or clean the ceiling in rooms? The carpeting was coming apart also.
review.locationRemarks: Close to Fishermans Wharf.

review.title: Awesome local hotel
review.reviewText: Very well located hotel with walking and driving distance to the best attractions. Clean and comfortable. The only bad thing is  the 30 daily parking fee. But then again understandably the is no parking in San Francisco.

review.title: Wonderful location.
review.reviewText: We took the Big B (open sight seeing bus with audio) hop on and off to tour the city.  It was an excellent way to see and to learn about the city.  Recommend riding the cable car.

review.title: Hotel is wonderful!
review.reviewText: The hotel is very clean and comfortable. It's in a good location about a 20 min walk to fishermans wharf and pier 39.  It's about 15 min. Walk to the crooked street on Lombard. Beds and pillows were comfortable. Complimentary breakfast was served every morning and is delicious. They served waffles, eggs, sausage, fruit, yogurt, bagels, Danishes, bagels, coffee, and juice. The hotel offers complimentary baggage storage and complimentary computer usage so you can print boarding passes.  I will definitely recommend this hotel!
only stayed one nite, hotel location not close to any place to get a late night snack, rooms were ok staff helpful
review.positiveRemarks: close to wharf, nice breakfast area plenty of room
review.negativeRemarks: area is limited to improvement
review.locationRemarks: the wharf is close by not within walking distance but not far

review.title: Nice, great location to walk to everything.
review.reviewText: SFO is a brilliant place for all, great things to see and easy access from this hotel.  A definite 4 day break.
review.positiveRemarks:
Excellent room on floor 11, great location, easy access, parking a little pricey, breakfast was fine.
Main thing is the location, brilliant.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking costs a little pricey
review.locationRemarks: The bridge, Fisherman Wharf, the city - all easy access from this hotel and use the Hopper Bus.

review.title: Nice hotel  awesome view of the bay and bridge
review.reviewText: First time is San Fran, enjoyed our stay and will return

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: Was happy with the hotel. Doing vacation stuff. Hotel was good for sleep and mainly close by things . Breakfast was good to get you started in the morning. But the last day that I was there the eggs were cold.
review.positiveRemarks: Location and good place to sleep and clean up.

review.title: Nice clean quite room
review.reviewText: The room was clean,quite and very well maintained.

review.title: Decent hotel, nothing fancy.
review.reviewText: The best thing about this hotel is the price for the location. It's a slightly dated, middle of the road hotel, mostly European tourists and families. There are too few elevators for the number of people in the hotel, and the mattresses on the beds need replacement, but it is otherwise perfectly fine. I stayed with my two teenaged boys, and it is a perfect family hotel. Few amenities, the service is okay but not stellar. It was clean, and our room had an excellent view. I would stay here again.
review.negativeRemarks: Elevator service and mattresses.
review.locationRemarks: Marina area...close to everything.

review.title: Convenient
review.reviewText: We had a problem they could only find one room for me and when I tell them about it the lady at the front desk was very bad all she kept saying so I only see one you have to call Expedia and they have to verify after she call she wasn't helpful she kept saying it only says one room to which I said it shows on my reservation two and they told yes I reserve two why can't you give my room she said no because it wasn't on her computer and then to make things worse she said I'm not giving you a room on the same floor and you're not getting a refrigerator and kept saying you're not staying in the same floor very unprofessional not even the courtesy to offer nothing fre for the trouble they still charge me 52 for the parking never staying there again
review.negativeRemarks: Service

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: nice staff, very accommodating.  Hotel was reasonably clean and neat. Some leftover trash in trash can in room, lack of hot water on the 11th floor (shower) left me a little disappointed though.
review.negativeRemarks: no hot water for our shower. very lukewarm.  Need to improve that.
review.locationRemarks: everything is close by or easily gotten to by hop-on/hop-off or Uber.

review.title: If you after Comfort dont stay here!
review.reviewText: My partner and I stayed here for 5 nights. The front desk staff were rude, unhelpful and just pain grumpy. Not the kind of service you expect for the money you pay to stay here. The room wifi is extremely poor to point of being almost non existent, it does work in the Lobby though. The room was ok, the city view was of the building next door only. Bed was hard as a rock and the pillows were paper thin. Breakfast was limited options and you have to fight to get a table to sit at. BEWARE of this hotel as my credit card had charges put on it after we checked out when we were told there was nothing left to pay. Trying to get in contact with this hotel is almost impossible to get a resolution. I will never stay here again, and will be telling all my family and friends not to stay here either.
review.negativeRemarks: Front desk staff need an attitude adjustment and the hotel needs to return phone calls and emails.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Situated in good location, but rather pricey for a comfort inn. Would have been fine but for the large roach in the bathroom that we found. Reported to the front desk and the response was "we dont get bugs on the 11th floor." Inadequate response - they should have given us something instead of ignoring the customer. Good breakfast buffet.

review.title: Walkable distance to Warf area.
review.reviewText: Staff were very nice and quite helpful.  Only 2 staff at the desk so very busy for their 4 PM check in time. Breakfasts were OK for hotel style complimentary breakfast.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, friendly staff, facility was clean and quiet.
review.locationRemarks: 20 min walk to warf area (downhill), 40 minute walk to Chinatown, steep walk up hill to scenic Lombard street.

review.title: Great location with fab view of Golden Gate bridge
review.reviewText: We had stayed at this hotel 17 years ago and liked the location, so booked again this time.  The hotel has a brilliant location, 2 blocks from Lombard Street (wiggly bit) and an easy walk to Ghiradelli Square and Fishermans Wharf.  The view of Golden Gate Bridge was fantastic from our room too.  The negatives would be that the staff on the desk are not very helpful and upon check in were bordering on being rude, as in the middle of talking they walked away and began another conversation with someone else!  The ice machine and drinks dispenser didn't work on our floor for the whole 4 days but our biggest gripe is with the wifi- it was useless, you'd get 5 mins if lucky!  We complained several times, but were told to call their internet provider ourselves!  Despite this we had a great time.

review.title: Middle of town; close to Muni Stops
review.reviewText: Same room; view of city was mostly of buildings next door; view wasn't important since we only were at hotel to take a shower and sleep
review.positiveRemarks: It was close to the areas we wanted to visit
review.negativeRemarks: Blankets for the room
review.locationRemarks: Within walking distance to some areas; bus stop only a block away

review.title: Ok hotel in ok location
review.reviewText: Was there for 2 nights. Parking was almost impossible as we have a SUV .  They couldn't give us 2 keys as they were running out. Room was on the street side and was noisy from traffic.
review.positiveRemarks: Rooms were clean and beds were comfortable
review.negativeRemarks: Parking is the main reason I would never return to this location.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a great location to walk to everything downtown and by the piers.  The view is awesome as you can get a great view of the Golden Gate Bridge.  The breakfast is super busy so dealing with that was interesting.  It was a good stay.

stayed twice in 20 day trip to USA. about 15 min walk to the wharf, or bus 47 to the wharf, seniors 75c, adults $2.25, make sure you have the correct change for the bus, Chase bank/ATM across the road, room had view of GGB, nice, 1st time stay, window was very dirty, 2nd stay window ok- higher floor, quiet hotel, Sharon  - front desk, very helpful, came out to assist us at the kerb on second visit (we didnt have cell network coverage to call super shuttle) when Super Shuttle conman driver tried to charge us $102 for 2 persons from airport (was quoted $34 - he mixed us up with the party of 5 in the van) and threatened and pretended to call the cops (let him - aggressive mongrel!) . breakfast includes cereal,fruit, waffles, toast/english muffins, pastries, juice, coffee/tea/hot choc, scrambled egg patties, sausage, cold boiled eggs, yoghurt. overall wold stay again, area felt safe there
review.positiveRemarks: close to Bus 47 to town, breakfast good selection available
review.negativeRemarks: first time toilet cistern kept running in first stay, maintenance fixed this, but issue seemed to return. beds ok, have bad back could be softer
review.locationRemarks: near Lombard St- 8 turn street, laundrette nearby

review.title: Within walking distance to the Pier
review.reviewText: First time travelers to San Francisco.  We chose this location because it was close to most "tourist" attractions.  The room we booked was a "bay view" which was beautiful!!  Very comfortable accommodations and great breakfast.  The staff was also courteous and helpful.
review.locationRemarks: Within walking distance to several Piers, restaurants, etc.

review.reviewText: Overall good hotel for the money we spent. The staff was very helpful. Breakfast was free, although that wasn't listed in the original booking info.

review.title: Amazing Location
review.reviewText:
Last year I stayed out in South San Francisco to save money, but decided to spend a little more to stay in the city. It was totally worth it. Comfort Inn by the Bay is in an awesome location! It was walking distance to so many things that we wanted to do and explore. I was hoping for a view of the Golden Gate Bridge like I have seen in the photo's of other travelers, however, it was still a nice view of some of the city. 

We walked to most things during our stay, however if we needed to go a little bit father we used Lyft.
review.positiveRemarks:
LOCATION! 
Friendly staff, clean rooms, house keeping always did an excellent job and always replenished our towels every day.
review.negativeRemarks: Extend the time allotted for breakfast.
review.locationRemarks: Lombard St, Eva's Coffee (right next door), Black Magic (bar directly across the street) Fisherman's Wharf, Ghiradelli Square, bars on Polk St.

review.reviewText:
The bed was very comfortable, the room had a bit of a retro feeling that I liked, although the bathroom was a little small.
Lobby and elevators seemed a bit outdated and a refresh would be nice, but overall this hotel is clean, staff was very nice and helpful, and you get free Wifi and breakfast, so it's a good value in a great area of the city!

review.title: Good hotel, great location, pricey, but it is SF
review.reviewText: Hotel was good and was a great choice for us. Parking at around $30 per day is a little steep and garage is very compact with tight turns...backup camera was almost a necessity. WiFi was extremely weak and frustrating. Staff was nice, free breakfast wasn't fancy but was ok. Tight quarters in bath, beds (2 queens) were comfy. Nice peek view from 4th floor of Golden Gate Bridge. Little pricey, but this is SF, and location was very good.
review.negativeRemarks: WiFi, also, ice machine on 4th floor was malfunctioning
review.locationRemarks: Accessible to Presidio, Fisherman's Wharf, No. Beach..... Location on Lombard and Van Ness which is one of the main arteries to traverse city.

review.title: Nice hotel. Nice location.
review.reviewText: Was very nervous choosing a hotel in San Francisco where prices seemed expensive and I did not know the city well. Was pleased with this hotel in the end.  Was about 20 minutes walk downhill (and uphill, but reasonable slope, not too steep on the way back) from Fisherman's Wharf area and about 10 minutes walk to a safeway supermarket. The  Muni public transport system was easy to work out and stops were within easy walking distance of hotel.  We had a room on the top floor and great views of the Golden Gate Bridge and Bay. Traffic noise was reasonable despite being on corner of Van Ness and Lombard Streets and it felt reasonably safe to walk around hotel in the daylight hours. Staff were helpful in storing luggage and providing maps and directions. Bathroom was a bit of a tight squeeze and decor not new, but the room and beds and pillows we found comfortable and the room became our home away from home for 5 days.  Breakfast is provided and totally adequate for our needs (as someone who prefers a bowl or porridge or cereal and perhaps some fruit, yoghurt or toast!).  It was nice to have a microwave provided for making porridge oats yourself and we had fun making our own waffles.  When we asked we were permitted to use the microwave in dining room to reheat some leftover takeaway which was appreciate although I am not sure if this is the norm. The hotel provided access to lots of tourist information and takeaway restaurant information and even discounts at local restaurants.
review.positiveRemarks: Location.  Breakfast provision. Views of Golden Gate Bridge.  Staff were friendly and helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: Bathrooms could be updated as quite small and difficult to move in. Microwave in room. Better tv guide.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf within walking distance.  Loads to explore there! Good base for public transport.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a good location for walking around near fisherman's wharf. We only spent a weekend here and the room was clean and adequate but nothing fancy. The breakfast buffet was convenient but the choices were very limited. Did not spend any time at the hotel ,therefore, I am making my recommendation as a a clean place to sleep and shower in a good location.

review.title: 15min walk to the pier
review.reviewText: Great staff. Clean rooms. Walking distance from the pier and free breakfast in the morning. Overall great place. Definitely my go to hotel every time I visit sf.
Friendly and helpful staff, really clean. Great location !

review.title: Clean and comfortable
review.reviewText:
I like it very much it's clean and comfortable
I came with my wife and baby we enjoyed it
Excellent service and clean room! I highly recommend it

review.title: The Basic Hotel with very comfortable beds
review.reviewText:
I wanted a hotel that was close to the city and easy to drive in and out from.  Perfect.   The rooms are not overly fancy - but the rooms are clean and very comfortable with excellent beds.   It is about a $12 cab ride to Union Square and you can walk to the harbor.   It is a great location.   I had a room at the back of the hotel.  No fancy views but I can bet I had no traffic noise.   Having a view you look at for only short periods is not worth the expense if you can leave windows open during the night.   Parking is easy - but designed for when cars were smaller... so be careful but don't let that put you off using it.  Unlimited entry and exit thought out the day.. entrance is on Van Ness just before the intersection.   The staff as OK - they are not in any rush and fill there lives with made up policies... The Room Safe is one.  "don't use it - leave the key in and we won't charge" - then it is on my bill - "oh they should have told you at check-in that you won't use so we stop the auto charge at check in"  make up your mind!   Either way it takes over 5 minutes for them to reverse all the charges and taxes.   Just silly things like that that can get really annoying.
Would I stay again?  Yes
review.positiveRemarks: The beds - loved my sleeps.  Ask for a taxi and one was there in minutes.
review.negativeRemarks: Well the safe coudl be more awake and dynamic and excited about working - or being in hospitality.
review.locationRemarks: Easy easy access to Golden Gate and the North and with Sat Nav easy to get across town south.  Mel's diner 30 mins walk away

review.title: Perfect location for the Wharf, Union Square.
review.reviewText: The #47 bus is a fast trip to the Wharf.  Nice staff, clean rooms and safe parking. Prices comparable for the city.  Had some issues extending stay for a night, the manager came in the next day and resolved this in a few minutes.  Breakfast was fast and easy, made the day easy for whatever. Will stay again
review.negativeRemarks: Not much,
review.locationRemarks: All of downtown was accessible

review.title: Pleasing stay at not so expensive hotel.
review.reviewText: Excellent location, ideal for Fishermans Wharf and Lombard Street, also for Hop on Hop off bus, right outside.  Lovely spacious room and excellent facilities.   Buffet style breakfast - Excellent.

review.title: Ok stay
review.reviewText: The location is pretty good. We didn't drive but there is route 30,47,49 nearby, which makes fishermen's wharf easily reachable. The staff help us checked in is pretty good, but another lady in the front desk is not that pleasing. btw, the wifi is pretty good. Overall is good.

review.title: comfortable hotel
review.reviewText: The staff was friendly and helpful.  The breakfast was similar to Mcdonald's.  The parking was expensive and tight to manage.  The AC did not seem to work.
review.negativeRemarks: Better AC and better parking
review.locationRemarks: Great ice cream parlor - Swensons.  San Francisco has a lot to offer no matter where you land.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Good value for the price. Beautiful view from a higher floor. Walk to Fishermen's Wharf. Comfortable room except for old heater.
review.negativeRemarks: Old heater. Would not turn off automatically to maintain temperature.

review.title: Nice hotel, central location
review.reviewText: Nice hotel for a reasonable price.  Very comfortable beds and pillows.  Small bathroom. Free breakfast average, but diner one block away. Upgrade for a bay view is worth it!

review.title: Disappointing
review.reviewText: View of Golden gate bridge was obscured by filthy Windows. Sheer curtain was torn halfway through. Desk clerk was of no help when we had an issue with room. Still waiting for a call crack from housekeeping manager after 2 phone calls to see if they found an item that was possibly left behind.

review.title: Comfortable
review.reviewText: The Hotel is clean, comfortable, quiet and has a lovely breakfast in the am!  Not quite close enough to Fisherman's Wharf to walk.  We only stayed one night before our cruise and it was just fine.
review.positiveRemarks: Slept like a log - breakfast was good.

review.title: Ok, room.
review.reviewText: Our room had experienced some leaks near the window, and the bottom of the curtains at the window had mold on their edges, constantly being blown up into the room. We all had sore throats the next day. Otherwise the room and bathroom were clean.
review.locationRemarks: Take the Alcatraz tour to the island, not just around it.

review.title: Horrific customer service!!
review.reviewText: The housekeeping woman should be fired! I have never been so disrespected !! My husband left my box with my new iPhone 6 accessories. I was told to call housekeeping, it would be shipped to me. Woman answered "housekeeping." I clearly began to explain. 3 times she interupted me. Said she could not understand me. I speak very clearly. I was not rude. My tone was even. 3rd time she told me first of all you didn't even tell me good morning. She was yelling at me to start over and start by telling her good morning! She should be telling me that. At that point I lost it. Told her I do not need to tell her, she should be telling me. I hung up. Called back. Front desk asked if I wanted the housekeeping manager. Yes. Apparently same woman is the manager. Unbelievable! Rude again. I said I wanted to file a complaint.She Refused to answer my question if she was the one I had just spoke with.I asked 3 x's.She Just kept saying what do you want. Hung up. Call escalated to Gm Mike. I told him how I was treated and I needed my box shipped. He said so how can I help you! Seriously. Told me housekeeping handles that! Told him I am not getting empathy or resolve from him. Changed his tune. Placed the order himself. I will never stay at any of your hotels again! I worked as a Csr for 16 years for a prominent bank. This was unacceptable!!!

review.title: Super Comfortable and fantastic location
review.reviewText: Super comfortable great area of town...The staff was very helpful especially Jean...I look forward to enjoying San Francisco and Im so glad I found a nice comfortable reasonably hotel....Very nice complimentary breakfast also every day....Great Stay!!! Will return again...
review.positiveRemarks: Locations and the beds were super comfortable
review.negativeRemarks: great for the price
review.locationRemarks: Very close to Russian hill, fishermans Wharf and the Marina district...Walked, biked, uber and bussed, no need to rent a car...

review.title: My Review
review.reviewText: Second stay with the comfort Inn, both times stayed 5 nights. Very happy to recommend as provides everything that is needed at a very competitive price.
review.positiveRemarks: Very friendly, knowledgible staff, very clean and well catered. Fantastic breakfast.
review.negativeRemarks: Only regret would be the ice machines, very noisy if your room is near one. Maybe could have there use timed, will definately wake you up.
review.locationRemarks: Plenty of sites within walking distance. Fishermans Wharf can be walked in 15 minutes, Hop on Hop off bus stop, just down the road.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: This hotel was perfectly located for what we wanted to do in San Francisco.  We used  public transportation the entire trip and it was wonderful having the bus stop right by the hotel.  We were traveling with 6 kids and were able to get adjoining rooms.  This made our stay at the hotel very enjoyable.  Breakfast was good with decent options and the kids loved making their own waffles.  On issues for improvement.....the taxes were not included in the parking price so it was more than stated and if you use the safe in your room you will be charged. Otherwise we had a great time and would definitely come back.
review.negativeRemarks: Include the taxes for parking in the price. Don't charge to use the safe in the room.

review.title: Perfect location!
review.reviewText: Comfort Inn is perfectly located for everything you would want to do in the city! The staff was perfect. They attended to every need! Great economical trip to San Feancisco!

review.title: Close to Fishermans Wharf
review.reviewText: Good location. Comfortable rooms. Excellent staff. Good breakfast food
review.locationRemarks: A short cab ride to all the major areas

review.title: Great hotel except Bad wifi
review.reviewText:
The front staff were really nice and warm. The room was clean and the bed was really comfortable. We stayed in a room with the Golden Gate Bridge view for the expedia discounted price and that was a bonus.
Everything was great for the price except the wifi connection. We just gave up using internet.

review.title: Stayed on the 11th floor overlooking the Golden Ga
review.reviewText: Overall experience was great about 20 blocks from the fisherman's wharf Pier 39 we walked it with no problem

review.title: Good stay
review.reviewText:
Good looks location.  Walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf. 
Clean and decent neighborhood.  Comfortable
Clean and comfortable, breakfast was excellent, great view of the bay

review.title: clean hotel
review.reviewText: Besides being awaken by housekeeper everything was great !

review.title: Nice hotel, fantastic view of the Golden Gate Brid
review.reviewText: We really enjoyed Comfort Inn by the Bay. The view from our room of the Golden Gate Bridge was amazing. Our room was always clean and it had plenty of space for us. The breakfast buffet was a very nice benefit which saved us the expense of eating out elsewhere for one meal per day. There were eggs, sausage, cereal, yogurt, bagels, fruit, and a waffle making machine. Also, the parking was expensive, but cheaper than most other San Francisco hotels ($26+tax instead of $38-$40 charged by most hotels). For us, we really enjoyed having a rental car because we drove lots of places - to Sausalito, Muir Woods, Napa Valley, Carmel and Big Sur, and Yosemite National Park - as well as to restaurants in the city.
review.positiveRemarks:
View from the room of the Golden Gate Bridge
Breakfast buffet
Cheaper parking than most hotels ($26/day+tax)
Good location
Clean
review.negativeRemarks: The WiFi Internet connection was slow and unreliable
review.locationRemarks: We don't mind walking and were able to walk to Fisherman's Wharf, the Embarcadero, and even to Union Square (about 2 miles).

review.title: View of Golden Gate Bridge
review.reviewText: Had my address and credit card number wrong on bill

review.title: Nice hotel close to the wharf
review.reviewText: Comfortable room with a very good view of the golden gate bridge. We had a room with two queen beds. Beds and pillows were comfortable. The internet in the room was a bit spotty, had to reset several times.  Cleaning staff was excellent. Hotel provided a basic breakfast of eggs, sausage, cereal, fruit, yogurt and self serve waffles. The hotel is at the intersection of Van Ness and Lombard. It is within walking distance of Pier 41. My only beef was the charges for the safe, although it was nominal (about $2 per day) it's more the principal as I have never been charged for that before.  The ice machine was close and there was a vending machine for drinks.
review.positiveRemarks: The beds were comfortable and the room large enough.  The view was great.
review.negativeRemarks: Not charging for the safe and improve the internet signal.
review.locationRemarks: It was within walking distance of Fisherman's Wharf and several restaurants.

review.title: Walking distance to Ghirardelli Square & Pier 39
review.reviewText: The hotel was walking distance to Ghirardelli Square, Russian Hill, Lombard St, cable car stop, etc. The hotel was clean and a free breakfast buffet is included. Because the hotel is right on Van Ness (Hwy 101), there was traffic noise that could be heard in the room but it wasn't excessively loud. Room was spacious and beds were comfortable. They provide both soft and firm pillows on each bed. Staff was helpful and friendly. TV had larger selection of channels than a more expensive hotel we'd stayed in earlier in the week in the Union Square area. There is a parking garage but parking is approximately $30 a night. Cab ride to the airport was easy from this hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Location of the hotel was great for exploring the piers. A $9 - $10 cab ride to Union Square. Guest room was spacious, had partial view of bay, clean
review.negativeRemarks: There was a little musty smell in the hall way and some mildew around the window in the room. Otherwise, the room was clean and comfortable.
review.locationRemarks: Walked to Ghirardelli Square then maritime museum & on to Pier 39 with shopping, restaurants, sea lion center, access to bay cruises, segway tours

review.title: Good location but everything is terribly old
review.reviewText: Need urgent renovation. One elevator only was running.
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms , elevator , breakfast
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman place

review.reviewText: My husband and I stayed two nights and was pleasantly surprised how clean the facility and how friendly the staff was.  I would stay there again.

review.title: Good location, nice bay view, can see Golden Gate.
review.reviewText: Everything was great, location is close to everything and very convenient.
review.positiveRemarks: Ray at Front Desk very helpful.  Breakfast is great.
review.negativeRemarks: Would have been better if there's at least a gift shop where we can buy sandwich or candies, juice, water etc.
review.locationRemarks: there is a brand new restaurant block away, it's called Dim Sum dine in or out.  Food is really good and the price is right.  Their siopao is so good.

review.title: Great location. Great view. Great value.
review.reviewText: Very walkable to the Wharff. Surprised to find surrounding streets were also full of good shops, bars and restaurants. Bus runs right on Van Ness to Wharff or up to the Bart. Room was nice and updated. Comfortable bed. 1970's AC and heat works ok so hard to complain. Fridge in room was a nice surprise. Staff very helpful with tips etc. Nice view of the Bridge and even a bit of Alcatraz. Very quiet. Definitely would recommend as a cheaper option if you don't mind a 10 minute walk to the Wharff.

Convenient 
Good parking
Breakfast ok but ran out of waffles

review.title: Make other plans for breakfast
review.reviewText: Checked in, went to the room and it hadn't been cleaned yet.  Returned to the desk and got another room.  Went to that one and the maid was sitting in the chair reading.   Went ahead and kept that room.  View was nice.  Front desk clerk was nice.  Breakfast was a disaster. No waffles...was told it was because the truck didn't bring the syrup.  You'd think someone could run to the store for a bottle or two.  The breakfast room although well planned with enough seating was dirty and messy.  When complaining to the manager, he apologized with the excuse there was a change in management.  At $300 a night there must be better options!

review.title: No amenities ur only paying for location
review.reviewText: No refrig for insulin.   Continual breakfast ends at 930am.   Printer was broken for airline boarding pass.    We are on vacation n felt we could not relax.  Only a place to rest your head

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText:
The staff were fabulous. Always with a smile especially Jean,Sharron and Alex. Breakfast was very nice and emplo
yees were great. Our rooms were lovely and kept clean by our maid. All in all we could have not had a better experience. Kudos to everyone at Comfort Inn By The Bay!!!!!

review.title: September in San Fran
review.reviewText: The hotel is located close to some attractions. Girraldeli chocolate house, terminal station for the trolley  cars, close to stops for the sightseeing  buses and walking distance to the Fishermans wharf. Staff is friendly, free hot breakfast, optional parking garage, safe location.
review.negativeRemarks: insulation, can hear conversation from next room
review.locationRemarks: A lot.

review.title: Close to Alcatraz
review.reviewText: We were down to go see Alcatraz and this was the best deal we found. Nice enough hotel. Breakfast was ok. No pool which was disappointing. The parking charge was high but I guess everywhere in San Fran would be. The restaurants across the street were great. The sub shop was good and the Italian place was amazing!!!
Great location.  Nice view from our window....close to bus.

review.title: Not bad for the price
review.reviewText: This hotel is a pay for what you get hotel. There was some sort of conference going on near fisherman's wharf that had hiked the prices of all the close by hotels. We were only in town for one night coming back from a visit to Napa. We decided to stay here to save the money. It was not a bad walk at all down to fisherman's wharf and the bar restaurant seen. The hotel wasn't real nice, but it was fairly clean and most important I felt safe. I would stay here again under the same circumstances. The staff at the front desk were very helpful and friendly.
review.negativeRemarks: Seemed old and a little dirty in the common areas. Rooms were clean and comfy.
review.locationRemarks: If you don't mind a little walking the hotel is close to fisherman's wharf.

review.reviewText: Excellent location, within walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf and Lombard St.

review.title: Decent hotel walking distance to Fishermans Wharf
review.reviewText: Pricey but excellent location. Rooms were ok, nothing special. Breakfast was pretty plain but adequate.

review.title: Close to Fisherman's wharf
review.reviewText: Nice place for the price, plus it has underground parking. It's very tight though, so a small car is a plus. Good access point for your average tourist.

review.title: Great location!!!
review.reviewText: Great location!!! Close to Fisherman's Wharf, Pier 39, and Ghiradelles Square!!

review.title: walking distance to wharf and good bus route
review.reviewText: used local buses and for $25 for 3 days great way getting about. hotel good. breakfast room very busy but ok

review.title: OK for the price.
review.reviewText: Average hotel with a good location in the Marina area of San Francisco. Easy walk to Marina Green, Union Street, Fisherman's Wharf,shopping and restaurants. Hotel staffing is minimalistic and creates delays with checking in/out and answering questions.  The complimantary breakfast is total chaos when the hotel is full.  Not enough seating for breakfast guests and the food stations are quickly emptied, causing guests to wait for quite a while for more food to come out.
review.negativeRemarks: The number of hotel staff and SUV parking. The outdoor parking lot fills up and there isn't enough parking for the entire hotel.
review.locationRemarks: Good location - lots to do nearby.

review.title: Good location!
review.reviewText: Rooms are clean and comfortable. Great for the price, specially at SF. Breakfast is basic but good. Would recommend.

review.title: Overly Impressed, and coming back every year!
review.reviewText: Our family tradition for the last 4 years has been Fireworks off the pier..this year we decided to book a room and enjoy the city instead of heading back in all the traffic that same night. Although our check in wasn't until the 5th..The friendly staff allowed us an early check in even after a sold out night the day before! Our room was so clean the comforters glowed white, the bath room was a tight squeeze but it was worth it once we laid our head on the pillows!Coffee maker in the room for my wife's convenience! and the Breakfast in the morning made my kids faces light up~especially the waffle makers! Loved every minute of it and already booked our room for next year!
review.negativeRemarks: ...nothing!
review.locationRemarks: 2 blocks from the "Crooked Street" my kids loved! and a nice walk to Fisherman's warf! gas station and CVS right up the block! And Parking!

review.reviewText: SF is tough because hotels are overpriced for not much. This hotel is fine if you don't need to drive/park. The garage is not free, and it's also the worst garage layout I've ever parked in. Otherwise, the room is okay... I guess.

review.title: Good hotel but expensive
review.reviewText: Ours was $250 for a two queen. A bit expensive but it is sf. Parking was $26 a night and they let us park our 12 passenger van  in front since it was too big.

review.title: Good location to Fishermans Wharf
review.reviewText: Stayed 4 nights, efficient check in/out. Comfortable and clean and a great location for Marina and Fishermans Wharf

review.title: San Fran get away
review.reviewText: Check in was easy, stored our bags for later.  Convenient walk to the Wharf (only a few blocks) BUT very hilly back up to hotel.  Not much near by if walking.  No restaurant or bar on site.  Breakfast is ok if you are not picky. Poor coffee.  Room very clean and comfy.  Shuttle back to airport for wrong day but think that was shuttle not hotel.  They negotiated a taxi and shuttle paid difference.
review.locationRemarks: Wharf a few blocks and on bus lines

review.title: Nice hotel at a great price.
review.reviewText: This hotel was very clean and comfortable. It's only 6 blocks from Ghiradelli square, which is very convenient for sightseeing. But trying to get back to the hotel at night is challenging unless you take a cab. The closest transportation is the Cable car stop three blocks away. The cable cars tend to be overcrowded and the wait to use them is long. Then you have to walk 3 blocks to the hiotel. That doesn't sound like much but it it down a VERY. steep hill and not everyone can walk this. But I would recommend this hotel based on its cleanliness and price. It's a bargain compared to other hotels in San Francisco.

review.title: Ten minutes to Fishermans Wharf
review.reviewText:
Close proximity to Fishermans Wharf, about a 10-15 minute walk. Even better is the hotel's proximity to Union Street (a great street for shopping and food - especially when you are sick of paying $25 a plate on the pier). The area of the hotel is good, not too 'sketchy'.
Staff were great, nice to have breakfast included, and the rooms were your average Comfort Inn rooms - clean, and comfortable.

review.title: Clean Hotel in Good Location
review.reviewText: Located on the corner of Van Ness and Lombard, the Comfort Inn is easy access to many sites on any tourists SF to do list. Not super fancy, but clean with very nice staff. Breakfast menu not extensive, but filling and nice to have one meal that we (traveling with husband and 2 small kids) didn't have to eat out. The parking was a bit of an adventure, as the turns were a bit tight in the underground garage, but we eventually made it in and out no problem. Would definitely recommend to others.

review.title: Close to Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText:
Desk staff was adequate, not particularly helpful but not rude.
Location was why we chose this hotel and it didnt disappoint. Very walkable!

review.title: Quality hotel for the price and location
review.reviewText: My wife, son and I stayed here with not knowing what to expect. We were suprised to have a nice clean room, decent distance (about 1 mile) to the main points of interest, a great view of the harbor, and all for a good price. Down side: expensive for parking, and not many food places within walking distance. Overall, I would go back to the comfort inn again. It was a good deal for the price.

review.title: Comfortable hotel and would return
review.reviewText: Good location.....great view......comfortable and a great breakfast.....would def return.
review.locationRemarks: great spot

review.title: Comfort Inn by the Bay
review.reviewText: Adequate accomodations, nothing stellar. Rooms are a bit outdated, and cleanliness is questionable. Busy part of the city, close and walkable to many tourist locations. Included breakfast is nice, but food not good enough to avoid going elsewhere for breakfast, but if you are on a budget, this breakfast and hotel will do.
review.negativeRemarks: Update bathroom and furnishings. WIFI very slow, almost unusable even for simple tasks such as checking email.
review.locationRemarks: Busy location, difficult to park a large automobile. Short walk to Fort Mason, Ghirardelli Square, Marina District.

review.reviewText: Nice hotel on good location - close ti fisherman wharf and with good transport to downtown

review.title: Real good for two star hotel
review.reviewText:
PROS: Great location to fisherman warf, free wireless internet, free breakfast, clean room

CONS: Breakfast hot food and pastry not fresh (I am positive leftovers used next day), wireless internet really slow o drops connection

review.title: Nice room, decent beds, walking distance to wharf.
review.reviewText: Stayed for 3 nights: found the rooms and the beds comfortable. the bar fridge is convenient. Breakfast is not extravagant but suitable. Front desk staff are not too helpful and come across rather rude, but you really only need to get through checking in, because everything else about this hotel is decent for the reasonable price compared to other San Fran hotels.

review.title: Hotel is close to fishermans wharf
review.reviewText: Girls at front desk were very nice able to answer questions we had. Girls working at breakfast seemed disgruntled and unhappy to be working!

review.title: Parking NIGHTMARE
review.reviewText: Parking NIGHTMARE, I have never been in a worse parking structure in my life. This was obviously built for something other than cars. There is no way to even get into the two spaces they have set for people to use to get checked in. I had to back up and pull forward about 5 times just to get in the spot. Granted the rental car co. put me in an SUV I did not want but had I been in my own car it would have needed at least three reversals to get into the spot. Two way traffic through out, yet only wide enough for one car. I ended up scraping the side of the car on one of the post trying to clear a corner. As you would see by the walls and posts this is a VERY common occurrence. They told me they were fully booked, yet were able to come up with two different rooms when there were problems. Oh by the way the parking was $29.00 per night! At that rate they should have parked for you. This is one hotel I will never return to. Not the chain, I have had good luck with them. But in San Francisco, NO THANK YOU, not even if it were free.

review.title: Great staff at the front desk!
review.reviewText: Nice breakfast! Everything was good. No complaints!!
review.positiveRemarks: Helpful front desk staff! Called a shuttle for us to get to the airport which was a lot cheaper than a taxi would have been!
review.locationRemarks: Close enough to walk to the Pier!

review.title: Good location, but a few issues.
review.reviewText:
The hotel is at the location of Lombard and Ness, about 15 mins from Fisherman's Wharf. If coming in from the airport by BART, please note the nearest station is about 40 to 60 mins walk across some quite strenuous hills.
Breakfast is included in the rate, but is modest but adequate. My wife found the bed a bit uncomfortable.If the lifts are not in use or busy there are no stairs.
Pressure of shower is just ok.(

review.title: good hotel
review.reviewText: A good hotel,clean and tidy good staff and is in a very good position and close to good bus routes.
review.positiveRemarks: as above and was a bonus to have breakfast included.
review.locationRemarks: Close to the Lombard crooked road and short trip to the Fishermans wharf and on rout for the No 47 bus that goes to the wharf and Market St

review.title: Nice Surprise!
review.reviewText: Didn't know what we were getting in to with our reservation and were pleasantly surprised! Were blown away when we opened our room curtains and saw SF Bay and the Golden Gate staring back at us. Very friendly and accommodating staff. If you are looking for the Ritz, go elsewhere.If you want a clean, convenient and surprisingly fresh accommodations, this is the place to book a room.
review.negativeRemarks: Maybe an update on furnishings and an extra guest computer.
review.locationRemarks: Bus route close. Safe area from what we could see.

review.title: Walking Distance to Fisherman Warf
review.reviewText:
PROS: Price, Location, Clean, Free Breakfast Buffet
CONS: Underground Parking, Parking Fee, NO Elevator from Parking Lot to Lobby = carrying your suitcases up 2 flights of stairs.

review.title: Central location
review.reviewText: Good 2-1/2 star hotel at corner of Van Ness and Lombard, great view from our room. I was shocked at the $26 per day parking fee they charge. I wish I could have given a 2-1/2 rating for "room comfort"--the bed was a bit lumpy, but it was clean and we'd stay there again (maybe try to find parking on the street).
review.positiveRemarks: Central location, good view of the city
review.negativeRemarks: Daily parking fees MUST be cut in half
