review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's wharf very close, 3-4 steep blocks to "the crookedest street. in the world". In fact, most of S. F.'s tourist sites a short drive away

review.title: Perfect hotel for location
review.reviewText: We looked all over for a hotel that was reasonably priced and in a good location in San Francisco. This hotel was walking distance to Fisherman's Warf, Alcatraz Landing, Cable Cars, and Lombard Street. We even had a view of the Golden Gate Bridge. We left our car at the hotel the whole time, we did have to pay a parking fee, but it was underground and safe. If we would have paid for parking all over town it would have been costly. The room was clean and worked for us, a family of 4. Not huge and fancy, but I wasn't expecting that. Breakfast was good, standard free hotel breakfast, but crowded. Get there earlier for a bit of a quieter breakfast experience. So all in all it worked for us, we aren't rich, so the lower rate close to all those areas was perfect for us.
review.positiveRemarks: Price, parking (even with a fee) and location to local sightseeing spots
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to Fishermans Warf, Pier 39, Ghirardelli Square, Cable Cars, Lombard Street, Alcatraz Landing.

review.title: Parking Nightmare
review.reviewText:
Awful. The parking is underground and there is one sign that says "more parking." The "more" parking is a dead end with 5 full slots at most and worst of all it's a dead end. You have to back out. I had to call my friend to come down and help me get out and get into a parking space. I called up to the front desk and was told she would come down and help me. She never showed.

As if that wasn't bad enough, they charge $26.00 for "parking." And the front desk couldn't explain the additional $27.00 charge. She said it was a "bank requirement" and that it was also for parking. When I asked why in the world the bank would impose a fee she could not answer the question.
review.negativeRemarks: Just about everything.
review.locationRemarks: Near the Wharf. Enough said.

review.title: Spring break in San Francisco
review.reviewText:
We stayed 3 nights at the Comfort Inn in a 9th floor room with the view. Very nice view of the Golden Gate bridge.
Breakfast was good. Get there early though as the tables fill up. The room was clean.The bathroom was kind of small as I think others have mentioned. The beds were too soft for me. We had a flat screen TV and a refrigerator in the room. A good value since it included breakfast. There was not a lot around the hotel area but you could walk to Fisherman's Wharf in 10-15 minutes.
review.positiveRemarks: View from the room. Free breakfast.
review.negativeRemarks: Firmer beds/newer mattresses.
review.locationRemarks: Not much near the hotel. 10-15 minute walk to Fisherman's Wharf/Pier 39 area for shopping/dining.

review.title: Decent hotel
review.reviewText: It was okay. Called manager to speak with him about something important never called back but got everything taken care of by a staff member when I arrived.

review.title: Nice hotel that is reasonably priced
review.reviewText: The room was really nice with a great view of the bridge, very comfortable beds and pillows. The breakfast was pretty good with plenty of options. We enjoyed our stay there and it was an easy walk to Fisherman's Wharf. Would stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: The view of the bridge and the beds were awesome!
review.negativeRemarks: The breakfast area could be better staffed, the lady was doing her best but she needed help. The coffee was not good either.
review.locationRemarks: An easy walk to Fisherman's Wharf, Ghirardelli Square and even the Crookedest Street.

review.title: Very pleased.
review.reviewText: Comfortable room. Great view of the Golden Gate Bridge and bay(we were on the top floor). Short walking distance to the water. Nice staff. Wifi worked great!

review.title: Nice location to access various sights/activities.
review.reviewText: Stayed four nights to attend business workshops. Lucky to have hit a great weather spot. Delicious food everywhere. Lots to do and see.
review.positiveRemarks: Location and parking convenience. Room more than adequate, although small.
review.negativeRemarks: Add a compact fridge.
review.locationRemarks: Close to North Beach, Fisherman's wharf, golden gate, presidio, direct line to downtown Mission area. Safe for walking around, water junkets in bay.

review.title: Front counter needs to know more information
review.reviewText: Front Counter staff needs to know what is going on in San Francisco. Also should have 2 clerks on front desk. Too busy for 1 person. Rooms should have microwave and small fridge. A little dated for today's travellers.
review.positiveRemarks: Breakfast good, good location. Great views of city out window.
review.negativeRemarks: More front counter staff that are knowledgeable about what is going on in San Francisco. Updated rooms.
review.locationRemarks: Location great and lot's of stuff to do near by.

review.title: Good value location
review.reviewText: Hotel felt safe and was clean. Room was out dated and bed was marginally comfortable. Good value for the location.
review.negativeRemarks: Updated beds
review.locationRemarks: Warf and Ghirardelli Square are close enough to walk.

review.title: Decent Hotel for the City
review.reviewText: Just one night out with friends. Couldn't check in early but they let us leave our car there so we didn't have to pay for parking somewhere else.
review.positiveRemarks: Within walking distance to Marina District & Fort Mason
review.negativeRemarks: Shower head was stuck on one mode. Couldn't change it. Pillows were below average for a hotel. Should have brought my own!

review.title: Nice hotel close to Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: The location was convenient to all the areas we wanted to see. We were able to walk everywhere we wanted to go. Breakfast was good except would have preferred the boiled eggs hot since you are asked not to heat them up in the microwave.

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: For the price it's a great hotel. The staff was super nice and helpful and the rooms were clean and comfortable. The continental breakfast has a great selection. It's only a 10 minute walk to fisherman's wharf or there is a bus stop a block away that will take you 2 blocks away from fisherman's wharf. Next time I go to SF I will be staying there again

review.title: Stay a Comfort Inn- San Francisco
review.reviewText: Very welcoming and helpful staff and great breakfast which was included in price. A great location that was walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf. Close to bus services too.

review.title: A jar of honey with some dirt on the surface
review.reviewText: I accepted to reserve a room in this hotel based on many conditions among which is the critical and extremely important condition of a free WiFi, this can only be named cheating because the WiFi was terrible for the five days of my stay. My work and business is all on the internet and this problem had caused a serious inconvenience for me. I have to say though that the rooms were excellent in the hotel but what I am going to do with the rooms if I can't stay in the hotel internet-less. The worst of all was the response of the front-desk employees, I believe most of them know that the internet is useless and I witnessed some customers complaining about it, but they kept saying "no it works". The hotel is excellent, clean and comfortable but I simply couldn't stay there during the day, I kept coming late at night, just to sleep. It is like a jar of honey, with dirt on the surface, how am I going to eat it?!
review.negativeRemarks: WiFi WiFi WiFi WiFi WiFi WiFi WiFi
review.locationRemarks: I was attending a conference in SFO, so I didn't go to many places around, but the hotel is near to many facilities and it is 15 minutes from downtown

review.title: So near Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: We loved the location-we stayed prior to an Hawaiian cruise and this hotel just added to such an amazing vacation! The entire staff the we came in contact with was excellent and so friendly!
review.locationRemarks: The Wharf,shopping, and dining

review.title: Nice hotel, high on the hill.
review.reviewText:
Hard to get food after 11 PM

Great free breakfast
review.negativeRemarks: Eating places after 11 PM
review.locationRemarks: If you plan your trip right, you can walk down town (down hill) anywhere and when you want to return, take a cable car up and walk across or taxi.

review.title: Good Stay
review.reviewText: It was a nice room, no view, but that was fine. I am diabetic and would have liked a refrigerator for my insulin. I strongly do not agree that when you are a paying guest at an establishment you should also pay $29.60 for parking also. This should be included in the price of the room.
review.positiveRemarks: It was clean, quiet and situated in the part of San Francisco we needed to be in.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking, guests should not have to pay for parking if they are renting the room I feel this should be included in the price of renting.
review.locationRemarks: We were only 7 minutes from Pier 3 where we were going and was very conveniently located to anything at Fisherman's Wharf area.

review.title: nice hotel within walking distance to the peir
review.locationRemarks: Within walking distance to Ghiradelli square and the peirs. Also next to main bus line. 3 blocks from the famous Lombard street.

review.title: Wont come back
review.reviewText: Reception seemed understaffed. Every time I asked for directions, phone would ring and they would have to ignore me and answer it. Only recommendations for restaurants were tai and Chinese. No nearby seafood restaurants in San Francisco!! Also, the closest wells fargo ATM was a 20 minute walk. So general location is not that great. Room was clean except for behind bed. There was so much dust and lint! Advertises free wifi but it was useless in the room. In the lobby, its just ok. TV had very little to watch - some sports and lots of news channels. No movies. Received just 1 of those slender bars of soap for five night stay. Ironing board was extremely rusty and made screeching noise every time I unfolded it. I previously stayed at a hostel that was cheaper and more accommodating.
review.negativeRemarks: More attentive staff. NEEDS MUCH BETTER WIFI.

review.title: View
review.reviewText: Pleasant experience, helpful staff breakfast was good and very close to everything.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: The hotel is at a great location. the price is good and the breakfast is nice

review.title: Comfortable hotel - close to Fishermans Wharf
review.reviewText: After arriving from New York, it was a wonderful experience to find a comfortable hotel, with helpful staff and views of the Golden Gate to die for! We were on the 8th floor and had a great stay, comfy beds, wireless internet that actually worked and great breakfasts every morning.
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel was close enough to be within walking distance of everything at Fishermans Wharf but quiet enough to get a good sleep on very comfy beds.
review.negativeRemarks: Not a lot
review.locationRemarks: Very close to all activities-Fishermans wharf, boat tours, bus tours, restaurants and all shopping. Get the 'hop on/hop off' bus tkts to get around.

review.title: Average Hotel
review.reviewText:
good price for average hotel
main thing is the parking which is expensive, you definitely need a car in san fran for travel
staff not very helpful when ask for parking advice like where can we get free parking close to hotel or a cheaper parking for the night?
Other than that, this place is good to stay for the price.
review.negativeRemarks: Expensive parking, need to walk the stair from parking before you get to elevator Average breakfast Average staff advice

review.reviewText: Hotel was a nice location, clean, friendly and a terrific value for San Fracisco. Winter rates were very reasonable.
review.negativeRemarks: As with other comments I had read, the breakfast was poorly stocked/staffed. Missing plates, silverware, food items were always missing. Slow WiFi.

review.title: Wonderful Hotel
review.reviewText: Staff was great. Rooms were clean. The breakfast was awesome. Parking under the hotel was a little challenging, not built for large SUV's.

review.title: Not able to connect to their Wi-fi for a week
review.reviewText: I could join the hotel's wif-fi network, but I could not get further than their login page. I reported the problem at the reception desk every morning, but until the end of my stay, things remain the same and nothing got sorted. The reception said they would try and reboot, and told me I should call their network provider, but I don't have the time to sort out problems. One of the reasons why I chose this hotel was for the free wifi from my room, so I was disappointed.
review.positiveRemarks: Room with en-suite is decent. I liked the coffee in the bathroom (funny place, but works fine).
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast organization is all over the place... the choice is boring (for instance, only one strawberry jam, etc.., pastries not so great). No stairs.
review.locationRemarks: Several bus stops, easy access

review.positiveRemarks: Great location, nice breakfast, helpful staff

review.title: Hotel was close to shops and resturants
review.reviewText: Experience was awesome...hotel staff was friendly and helpful

review.title: Proximity to the beach, Russian hill and Pier 39
review.reviewText:
Decent hotel. Good location, on the busy street, though rooms are quiet. Within a walking distance from Ghirardelli square and other piers.
Rooms are decent size (we had a two queen room) and fairly clean. Breakfast is not spectacular, but has enough to get you going in the morning; it serves the purpose - no need to rush to find a spot to have a breakfast.
review.positiveRemarks: Location! Price is adequate for the quality of service. Staff is pleasant and helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast could have been better with more choices. Lifts are fairly busy and is hard to get them early in the morning.
review.locationRemarks: San Francisco Fisherman's wharf is very close by: within 5-10 minutes walk. It is a main touristic attraction with many piers around, including 39th.

review.title: Excellent price-quality experience
review.reviewText: Centrally located within walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf and a short cab ride to the city center.

review.title: Repeat customer. Great central location.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean, Good Location. Close to great restaurants in North Beach. Yum Yum. Public Transportation.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking is horrible and overpriced. Dont bring a large SUV or pickup!

review.reviewText:
On arrival, the receptionist 'greeted' us most unpleasantly and completely spoilt our initial impression of the hotel.

We found room to be quiet and clean with comfortable beds and a well-stocked ensuite. Subsequent receptionists treated us politely and helpfully but seemed to have a poor knowledge of the surrounding area.
review.positiveRemarks: The cleanliness of the room and the cheerfulness/helpfulness of the breakfast staff.
review.negativeRemarks: If Reception could provide a broader selection of nearby restaurants. i.e were told of only one nearby when in reality there were several.
review.locationRemarks: Plenty of reasonably priced buses for travelling around.

review.title: Nice hotel great view on the 9th floor.
review.reviewText: We spent the weekend here with some friends and had a great time, the hotel was in walking distance to the water. We would stay here again. Only bad experiences were with the bus/shuttle drivers, very rude.

review.title: Close to marina
review.reviewText: I had read online that this hotel was given lots of bad reviews. I honestly couldn't believe a Comfort Inn could have that many bad reviews, now I really wish I would have listened to what people wrote. I tried to give the hotel the benefit of the doubt. Sadly, I too was disappointed

review.title: Good value considering location
review.reviewText: You get what you pay for, this hotel was pretty good value for money, rooms were ok, a LOT cheaper than similar rated hotels in union square. Close to fishermans wharf, close to bus routes to many places. No bar though, 1 cockroach / beetle thing (but that did have the good grace to only appear as I was checking out).

review.title: Nice location with a short walk
review.reviewText:
Wonderful continental breakfast.
Parking is a struggle, too narrow.
review.negativeRemarks: parking spaces
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's wharf
Near by attractions.

review.title: SF Comfort Inn
review.reviewText: If you just need an industrial stay in SF this is an ok place, one of the elevators didnt work properly as the doors would not open more than 6". Otherwise it was a fine stay, a bit noisy but ok.

We needed a room for the night near our daughter's new apartment, which was 2 blocks away. The hotel is clean, open, cheery, simply but cleanly appointed. Parking our Chevy Suburban was a small task - they have indoor gate-controlled parking, but we were told to use the side lot near the waste bins, as the car is large. We managed this OK. the rooms are simply but solidly furnished. Nothing too exotic, but more than acceptable for our needs. Bathroom was small, normal motel-ish, but everything worked, and water pressure and temp was good. There is a pretty big Continental breakfast in the a.m., with a large emphasis on carbs. There was fruit, eggs, sausage and yogurt as well. Was terrified that the traffic noise on the corner of Lombard and VAn Ness would kill us, but the rooms were very quiet. Happy to go back.
review.locationRemarks: Lombard and Van Ness is central to everything

review.title: Demand costs in SF
review.reviewText: $30 per day, extra charge for safe that is too small for avg laptop. Very difficult parking access. All this for 179 on avg week.

review.title: Very good hotel
review.reviewText: We spent four nights in the hotel staff very helpful staff ,well appointed room, brilliant location.
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast coffee.
review.locationRemarks: Near Fisherman's Wharf, with excellent restaurants nearby in Polk Street. Close to Fort Mason ,with lovely walk to Marina ,Chrissie Field & Bridge

review.title: we stayed 42 nights for the americas cup
review.reviewText:
it is overrated for price, but clean ,accommadating form staff anything out of ordinary hard to get.
the breakfast was boring food

review.title: A room with a view
review.reviewText: Great size room with awesome views of Golden Gate Bridge and the city. The beds were comfy and the room was clean. The hotel staff was very accommodating and friendly! Close to the Wharf and easy access to public transportation. The parking garage was hard to maneuver through. Be prepared for a little challenge if you park there.
review.positiveRemarks: Loved that it was so close to the Wharf, lots of restaurants and shopping. Easy to hop on the bus or grab a taxi for longer trips.
review.locationRemarks: The Wharf, shopping, restaurants, Ghirardelli Square, Golden Gate Bridge, Coit Tower, Lombard St, (crookedest street) and tons of other sites.

review.title: One night
review.reviewText: Just was looking for a place that was open. Was able to get a room and parking with easy check in

review.title: Wonderful Staff, easy walk to the Bay.
review.reviewText: It was a trip my friend and I have been trying to take for 30 years. We wanted a place that was close to the Wharf, but within our very tight budget. The staff was wonderful and very friendly and helpful. The room was clean and we had a nice view of the Golden Gate Bridge.
review.positiveRemarks: The location and the affordable price
review.negativeRemarks: Free parking :)

review.title: Great location!

Front desk staff were pleasant and very helpful with any questions that we had. The Lombard Cafe across the street was fantastic! We had the best dinner there!!! View of the Golden Gate Bridge was as promised - awesome!!! Location was fine - a bit far from the wharf, but on a direct bus line to AT&T Ball Park. All in all, we enjoyed our stay at the Comfort Inn By the Bay and would definitely stay there again.

review.title: noisy hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel needs a makeover. It's just older and needs some upkeep. A/c was very squeaky and room with bridge view is right next to the street and you can hear everything! Breakfast was good but too crowded, no place to sit and getting to the waffle makers was like being in the olympics. Parking was very tight but plenty of spaces and way cheaper than other hotels in area. Bus ran right outside hotel and walking to wharf was pretty quick.

review.title: Good location

The parking garage is an absolute abortion, with very little room to navigate safely and you're forced to park cars way too close together. The layout of the hotel is horrible. You can't take stairs to the lobby and elevators are slow. My ratings would have been significantly lower had the hotel not been a convenient 5 block walk to Ghiradelli Square and Lombard Street.
review.positiveRemarks: The location and the fact our room had a view of the bridge.
review.negativeRemarks: The elevator/stairs situation should be improved. I doubt with the location there is anything that can be done about the parking garage debacle.
review.locationRemarks: Most of the Wharf area attractions were walking distance from the hotel, provided you aren't lazy.

review.title: Clean , not too far from Fisherman's Wharf

review.title: Hotel stay
review.reviewText: A very nice hotel. Within walking distance to most of San Francisco main attractions. The room was a bit small, though. But overall it worked for two people. However, a few problems, the garage was a real issue as for how tight it was to park into. And the only view from the window was looking out onto other buildings. I guess that is called a city view. And lastly, the breakfast dinning area was to small to deal with all the guest at the time we stayed. There was even a confrontation with two other guest over a table to dine at.
review.positiveRemarks: Personal were very friendly. The room were clean and updated. And close to most of San Francisco's main attractions.
review.negativeRemarks: The garage, dinning area. Let customers know that they are getting a room looking onto other buildings.
review.locationRemarks: Within walking distance is Fishman's Wharf, the famous Lombard street. And there are trolley cars, buses to take to get to other scenic areas.

review.title: Handy Accommodation on Van Ness
review.reviewText:
Good location, short distance to Fisherman's Wharf, easy walk to restaurants on Polk St. Cleaning of room was fine and reception where very helpful when we needed photocopying, mailing and shuttle arrangements. Room was quiet but facing away from the view.

Compared to NZ you don't get a lot for your dollar. Hotel was very busy and had to wait twice in five mornings to get table to sit at. Food was adequate but rather basic.A refrigerator would have been useful but this would have been at the cost of another $10 per night.

Accommodation in San Francisco seemed expensive and this was a mid range hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Waiting for a table at breakfast
review.locationRemarks: Handy to Fisherman's Wharf

review.title: San Francisco

review.title: Very Poor experience
review.reviewText: Management at this hotel is just terrible. I cannot believe how poorly run this hotel is. It is sad that a decent building in a good location is run so poorly. My wife and I were very disappointed.

review.title: nice hotel in a convenient place
review.reviewText: Good staff and clean place. I enjoy my short stay at this hotel.

review.title: Loved our Stay
review.reviewText: We chose this hotel for our 4th of July stay. Their upper story windows are perfectly situated to view the fireworks from Sausalito, Richmond, and the grandest double displays from pier 39. The staff was kind and helpful. The rooms were clean and appointed with everything advertised. The linens and mattresses were soft and comfy. The bathrooms were very clean, always a plus. The TV channels were more than adequate. The location could hardly be better, on the corner of Lombard and Van Ness. There was no noise from either outside or inside. The tap water was very drinkable, not always possible when traveling. The ice and drink machines were conveniently located, as were local restaurants and markets. Parking was always available in an underground deck, but we did choose to leave our car parked at night when most lots tend to fill up. The parking deck was always clean and well lit. A varied complimentary breakfast is available just off the lobby. We liked this hotel so much that we came back when our plans changed during our trip. The a/c and heater worked perfectly without any odd odors. The only negative thing would be that the exterior windows really need to be cleaned. The many streaks, spatters, and spots made taking pictures difficult without the use of layers of effects. But for the views and location, it was still worth it. We will be back. Hopefully, the windows will be cleaned by then.

review.title: Good Value, Close to Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Check-in parking a little tough. Both spots taken. Good value for the money. Rooms were clean and comfortable. Hotel Staff very helpful. Walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf
review.positiveRemarks: Good Value for the price. Looking for a place to stay close to Fisherman's Wharf. Room was clean and hotel staff was very nice and helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: Water temperature in shower fluctuated from warm to cold
review.locationRemarks: Within walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf

review.title: A good place to stay
review.reviewText: Great location for accessing tours. Great choice of food at the complimentary breakfast. Staff were great. A good stay. Just wish they had a washing maching/dryer.
review.positiveRemarks: Quality of the breakfast and location.
review.negativeRemarks: There was no laundry facilities - washer and dryer.
review.locationRemarks: Great location to be picked up for bus tours.

review.title: Customer service? Not here!!
review.reviewText:
We stayed here for six days at the end of an extended holiday visiting the national parks in Western USA. Though relatively expensive (OK - It's San Francisco) it was clean, comfortable and within walking distance of the wharf precinct. However we were very disappointed in the attitude and help provided by the reception staff. When asked the simplest of tourist advice (e.g. where we would find the SF Visitor Info centre) we were given poor advice. When we couldn't connect to their WiFi (the only place on the trip where this happened) we were told it was our Iphone and treated with apathy. They were reluctant to provide us with a second room key even though we were there for a number of days, they advised us only at checkout that there was a surcharge for use of the room safe (which was included in the tariff of all other hotels we had used) and finally, upon our return home we found that they had, without explanation or invoice, charged an unauthorised amount to our credit card. I subsequently emailed the hotel for an explanation and the amount has since been re-credited; however there has as yet been no explanation or apology.

We would not recommend this hotel to others.
review.positiveRemarks: We had a Bridge View room so could see across to the bay.
review.negativeRemarks: Dealing with the reception staff.
review.locationRemarks: It's on Lombard and Van Ness intersection so suffers from traffic noise but has great access to the city's public transport network.

review.title: We loved our stay at the Comfort Inn by the Bay.
review.reviewText: It was close to Fisherman's Wharf, Pier 39, the cable cars and Lombard Street. We had a great view of the Golden Gate Bridge and could watch the boats sail in the bay from the window in our room. Breakfast was nice and it made it possible for us to get out and see the sights in a timely manner. We arrived at the hotel at 10:30 a.m. and check in time is at 4:00 p.m. so we couldn't get a room right away, but the staff kept our luggage for us so we could do sightseeing until then. Overall, we loved our stay in San Francisco and the Comfort Inn by the Bay.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, breakfast, view from the room and the staff.
review.locationRemarks: The location was great. Within walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf, Pier 39, the cable cars and Lombard Street - crooked street.

review.title: Would come here again

However, I would definitely come here again for the great price and location, etc!! Nice breakfast spread.
review.negativeRemarks: see above

review.title: 10 minute walk to Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Overall, this hotel had good accommodations for our quick one night stay in San Francisco. If we were staying any longer we would spend a little more and try to get a hotel between Fisherman's Wharf and Pier 39. Parking is on-site in a secure underground lot; however, you have to park early in the day to garner a spot. Otherwise, you have to try street parking (non-existent) or walk 7 blocks to the nearest off-site parking garage. Staff are very friendly and helpful. We had a view of the Golden Gate Bridge on the 4th floor, but street traffic on adjacent Van Ness Ave./Lombard St. is very noisy. Maybe staying on a higher floor would be better? Comfortable beds, clean rooms.
review.locationRemarks: It's a 10 min. walk to Fisherman's Wharf. Wonderful Italian restaurant called Capinnina on Union St. about 6 blocks away. It's little-make reservation

review.title: Great location and Breakfast!
review.reviewText: Working in customer service myself, I didnt think the staff was friendly or helpful. It is in a very good location and walking distance to alot of places. The room was kind of small but it served its purpose. Bed was very comfortable although its hard to believe its a queen size bed being that I have a queen bed at home and the bed didnt seem as roomy. Room was very clean. Bathroom was spotless. I love that the hot water never ran out. Parking to me wasnt as bad as in other reviews. I mean it is a tight parking lot & it is $26 per night but there are hotels that charge more. And you can park as early as you want as long as your staying that night and leave as late as 4pm even after you have checked out. Breakfast to me was great. Lots of options. Eggs, toast, muffins, sausage, waffles, coffee, juice, yogurt, oatmeal, cold cereal. I think that was the best part. And if you're on a budget, the breakfast definitely makes up for having to pay for parking. Overall I would definitely stay here again.

review.title: Great hotel

The complimentary breakfast was more than what we expected. They had waffles, muffins, sausage, eggs, yogurt, several cereals, fresh fruit, toast and all the trimmings along with hot tea, coffee and hot chocolate. The room was comfortable and no complaints except could use a few more plugs for all the electronics people carry with them now. I suggest taking along a multiplug or power strip. Other than that we had a comfortable stay and was lacking in nothing. Just a short walk downhill to the marina district. Quiet location. Would use again.

review.title: Not bad at all!!
review.reviewText:
Staff were friendly, didn't really ask for too much help with anything, except directions.

Room was reasonably good for the price, however a small bar fridge would have been good.

Close to Fishermans Wharf and on the corner of 2 main roads so public transport was easy to access. Felt like a safe area, even though you could still see the odd homeless person. Reception kept an eye on the lobby during the day, then at night doors were locked with a security guard watching over and reception would unlock if you got in late.

San Francisco itself can be very cold at night because of the bay, but we were expecting that and were pleasantly surprised with the room (being on the eighth floor). Room had aircon/heating, and we knew we didn't pay for a room with a view but it was interesting to see across to rooms or the roof of other buildings, we were entertained.

review.title: Great location, free breakfast!!

The location is good, the breakfast is good, just served the same thing every day ie. waffles, sausage, egg patties, boiled eggs, yogurt, cereals, toast and pastries, and a little fruit.They serve until 9:30, but you better get your food by 9:20 because they start taking everything down early. The beds and pillows were comfortable. We always had plenty of towels. The bathroom is small, but the sink and mirror are out of the bathroom so that helped. The hotel is clean, not spotless. The front desk staff were very helpful when we needed information. We rented a car, so paid 26.00 a night to park in their garage. There is a very good place to have laundry done 3 doors down from the hotel. They will deliver to the front desk if you don't make it back to pick it up before they close. We had a great view of the Golden Gate Bridge. We would stay here again.

When I complained to him about the misleading location he told me that Fishermans wharf is a big place and that they are only 7 blocks away.
Parking is very tight, I paid 27.00 to park outside by the garbage.

review.title: Comfortable and close to Bay - as said on the sign
review.reviewText:
We enjoyed our stay at the Comfort Inn . The staff were welcoming when we arrived late. They were helpful with directions on visits and looked after us well, arranging a shuttle to the airport at a fair price [$14.00 each], looking after our luggage after booking out. When the fog lifted we had a good view of the bridge and the breakfast was more than adequate. Our room was roomy, quiet and the beds were comfortable.
We have two suggestions for improvement. In most hotels of this standard there is an option to log on for those who don't bring a laptop, which is often free. We were told this was not an option and so could not book our flight on-line and ended up seated apart for 10 hours. No local internet shops were seen.
Although the hotel was clean, all the white plates we saw were grubby looking and do need replacing. They were clean, or so it appeared, but totally covered with grey scratches on them that made it impossible to verify this. This was a quality own goal that could be remedied easily. Hopefully they were in their last week of service.
On balance the hotel was a good choice with excellent bus and cable car[1/2 mile] access, and was within walking distance of the Pier 39 area. Locally Union St shops offer a trendy option, and downtown is about 30 mins away by bus, as are the Golden Gate Park and Legion of Honour galleries. Shuttle takes about 1 1/2 hours in rush hour to the airport allowing for several pick ups - quite a good tour but allow enough time!
review.negativeRemarks: Grubby plates at breakfast, and we think we are pretty relaxed about details....
review.locationRemarks: Good access to most of the city in 30 mins

review.title: OK hotel, nice location
review.reviewText: stayed three nights at this hotel, the bedding could have been better, the room was a little dated.
review.positiveRemarks: within walking distance from fishermans wharf & the view of golden gate bridge from the beadroom!
review.negativeRemarks: bedding could have been better
review.locationRemarks: nice location, felt safe walking around the area at night.

review.title: Did not live up to Comfort Inn standards at all.
review.reviewText: Rude/unhelpful front desk staff. Hotel overall by no means matches the price paid; better off paying more for a quality hotel in Union Square. Bed and pillows were rock hard and very uncomfortable. Towels were threadbare. Parking in hotel is horrible. Breakfast was ok except steer clear of prepared hot food (eggs and sausage were gross).
review.negativeRemarks: Staff at front desk.

review.title: Needs work on general cleanliness.
review.reviewText: This Comfort Inn is clearly in need of an overhaul.

review.title: Great Hotel wonderful location.
review.reviewText: This was my first visit to San Francisco and the hotel is in an excellent location. We had a view of the Golden Gate Bridge and we were a short walk away from all the tourist attractions that I wanted to see. (Fisherman's Wharf, Pier 39, Ghiradelli Square, ferry rides, trolley car drop off and pick up) . The staff was friendly and efficient, breakfast was free. It was an excellent place to stay if you are on a budget and plan on doing a lot of sightseeing. We basically came back to the room to sleep and we left early in the morning so it was fine with me. We also could walk to China town.
review.negativeRemarks: Tight parking place for rental car, however we only rented a car for one day.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent Location

review.title: Stay for vacation in San Fran
review.reviewText:
I was not expecting too much from a occasional stay. the hotel is close to Lombard road, and fisherman's wharf, commuting to Golden gate is also convenient.

However, the wall is paper thing, I can hear next door talking, which is not good.
review.negativeRemarks: wall is paper thing, two separate rooms are separated by a door!!
review.locationRemarks: location is good. close to many attractions.

review.title: Two thumbs up
review.reviewText:
The continental breakfast is by far the best deal when staying at this hotel. There are eggs, sausage, english muffins, cereal, waffles, fruit, oatmeal, toast - pretty much everything you need to have a big breakfast and fill you up for most of the day.

The views from our hotel on the 7th floor were also fabulous. Loved waking up every day and looking out at the bay and the Golden Gate Bridge. Only a few blocks from Fisherman's Wharf too. Only bad thing is there aren't a lot of restaurants nearby - closest ones are in the Wharf, which is a complete rip off when it comes to eating anything.

I will definitely stay here again. Nice and quite area only a short walk away from the crookedest street in the world.
review.positiveRemarks: The free breakfast and the view
review.negativeRemarks: The service at the front desk is brutally slow, but they are friendly
review.locationRemarks: Great location. Only a few blocks from Fisherman's Wharf and a short walk from the crookedest street in the world. Nice being so close to the water.

review.title: Hotel ok, but leave out breakfast!
review.reviewText:
OK Hotel, I missed movies and simple things like a luggage scale. Breakfast is very! simple, way to less space for everyone, overall, for the price we paid for the rooms, I think breakfast should be much better. There are nice places to have breakfast not far from the hotel.

Staff, no matter who was there, were superb, helpful and very friendly!!
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast
review.locationRemarks: Location very close to attractions.

review.title: Outstanding experience in downtown San Francisco
review.reviewText: Excellent experience. The hotel is somewhat aged, though the service and cleanliness was perfect. The complimentary breakfast gave me several choices of food, which I really liked. Highly recommend it!

review.title: A great place to stay in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Great, spacious room for four, very clean too. Had a fabulous view of the Golden Gate Bridge from our window on the 3rd floor. Breakfast was very good and the location can't be beat, right on Van Ness and Lombard street.

review.locationRemarks: Excellent location: Van Ness / Lombard street; looks so-so from the outside but surprisingly nice room, especially for the price we paid via Expedia.

review.title: Good location and very reasonable for San Franciso
review.reviewText:
We had a good stay in the Comfort Inn by the Bay. Only a short walk down to the waterfront and down to Fisherman's Wharf.

Staff friendly and helpful. Rooms are a good size, especially for the city.
Our family of four (incl two preteen children) didnt feel too cramped.

Breakfast was amazing for being included in price of the hotel!

Our room did have a view of the Golden Gate Bridge - unfortunately it was shrouded in mist the whole time.

I would definately recommend.
review.positiveRemarks:
Breakfast
Walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf
review.negativeRemarks: Rattley lifts

review.title: Ok for 1 night

review.negativeRemarks: The bed

review.title: "Comfort" Inn by the Bay.....
review.reviewText:
The hotel staff was downright rude. I've stayed in countless hotels and the individuals I spoke with during check-in and check-out were by far the worst hotel front desk staff I've ever encountered. When I asked simple questions about the hotel they responded with irritation and were acting as if they were really busy when I was the only person in the lobby.

The woman that checked me in didn't mention any additional fees or a deposit that would be added to my card during the check in process. I had paid for my room online through Expedia so I thought that any other expenses would be minimal. Not only did they add a few random fees and taxes that looked odd on my final bill but they put a $100 deposit hold fee on my card as well. I've never had a hotel put this much of a deposit on my card without any mention of it during the reservation process or being told about it at check-in. Luckily I had additional funds in my checking account but if you are traveling on a budget this could really impact your stay in the city.

The stairwells smelled awful and without exaggeration could be compared to a mix of something between raw sewage and a really dirty locker room (you have to take the stairs from the parking garage to the lobby because there is no elevator on those levels). The actual front desk counter was very dirty and when I rested my arm on it to sign several pieces of paper at check in I found some sticky residue that got all over me.

review.title: Good for the money
review.reviewText: It was a nice, clean room. We stayed in a queen room for 2 people. It was a bit on the small side but clean. The bathroom was small also, and the shower pressure was very weak and the water changed temperatures frequently. We did not upgrade to a room with a view and our view was not the best (overlooking a roof of the neighboring building). I would pay extra to get a better view!
review.negativeRemarks: View, size of room
review.locationRemarks: Good location, close to Wharf. Neighborhood felt safe and very central location

review.title: good choice
review.reviewText: We were in San Francisco on a mini vacation and didn't want to drive around the city. We picked this hotel because of its location but we were pleasantly surprised by how nice the hotel was. The beds were very comfortable and pillows were as well. We had a beautiful view of the golden gate bridge. The room was very quiet. The carpet was a little dirty though, but overall it was a very nice place. Breakfast was great too. We will stay there again for sure. We walked to the shops along the pier, a little far but was a nice day. Recommend it , couldn't have found a nicer place for the price.
review.positiveRemarks: location, price, beautiful room and view
review.negativeRemarks: the dirty carpet
review.locationRemarks: perfect

review.title: hotel
review.reviewText: outside windows dirty, but overall a good hotel...... maybe a bit overpriced

review.title: Great price, friendly staff and great location
review.reviewText:
The hotel was just what we were looking for. Very reasonable
Price. Car parking extra at $26 for 24hrs but considering
Most other hotels charge about $40. Booked this last minute and
Still got a great room looking out to the golden gate
Bridge. Would recommend and use again

review.title: Blah, Blah, Blah!!
review.reviewText: Very odd hotel, seemed like nobody wanted to be there, not a good neighborhood either. wouldn't recommend it for sure. especially for kids.

review.title: A nice place.

review.title: Family Let Down
review.reviewText:
I was misled by the location of the Hotel. It was more that a few blocks from the Wharf. One of the clerks was very friendly the the elderly one was bordering on rude. I was expecting a pretty room and felt it to be a big let down. Cheap bed spreads, and filthy cheap carpet. I was so disappointed because I had told the family we were going to a really nice hotel..
The breakfast was good.
review.negativeRemarks: Room

review.title: Good location

review.negativeRemarks: Parking fee

review.title: Good View and Location
review.reviewText: It was in a good location and the room was big. The view was one of the best parts, worth the upgrade.
review.negativeRemarks: The parking garage was very tight. The breakfast layout was awkward; made it hard to just get in and get a cup of coffee.
review.locationRemarks: It was close walking to Ghiradelli Square, Fisherman's Warf and Lomabard Street's "crookedest" section.

review.title: Great SF vacations start here.
review.reviewText: Free hot breakfast in the morning (eggs, sausage, waffles etc.) There is never a line at the check-in counter, they're so efficient. Wake-up calls right on time and nice room service and cleaning crews as well. The location is great. Right there on Lombard street where the red "hop-on-hop-off tour bus stops. From the hotel you can walk to Fisherman's Wharf, Pier 39, Ghiradelli, many great restaurants, even a movie theatre. Rooms have a view of the Golden Gate Bridge. We had no complaints and it made our trip very smooth. Thanks.

review.title: Great Stay
review.reviewText: we loved this hotel.convenient location to all Major Attractions and easy access to all Public transportation.We felt safe enough to walk the neighbourhood at night. The Reception Staff were always willing to pass on advice,friendly and helpful.Even though the Hotel is at the intersection of two major thoroughfares the noise level was minimal.The view from the rooms over the Bay was fantastic.Great Breakfast and very popular get in early!
review.negativeRemarks: no pool or gym
review.locationRemarks: ideally located for all Major Attractions

review.title: Family Vacation
review.reviewText: The staff was great and very friendly. The parking was tight, but their is no parking anywhere else in the city either so park at the hotel. The hotel was close enough to Fishermans Warf to walk.
review.locationRemarks: Location was great and very easy to get into.

review.title: Next Time I'll Find Somwhere Else To Stay
review.reviewText:
The staff that checked us in had major attitude problems (night). However the staff that checked us out were excellent (morning).

Parking was horrible. Granted I have a full size truck. However after about twenty 7 point turns I was able to get my truck parked and removed from the underground parking structure. It was one of those deals where you parked and left it, period! Seeing as how this caused us to walk everywhere in SF, it would have been better to drop off the luggage then go park somewhere off in the distance and walk back.

I've stayed at lots of hotels and eaten tons of continental breakfast's however this place was by far the worst. If you stay here then exit the hotel out the front door and walk north (down). A block away is a cafe that serves food 10 times better and for $5-$10 you get filled up.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking Garage

review.title: Could have been better
review.reviewText:
I have stayed in worse hotels, but if I return to San Francisco in future I will try staying somewhere else. The hotel staff were nice, but not very helpful in advising on places to eat or using public transport. The breakfast they provide is also very average.

I am lucky I happened to read the note put on the front of the safe saying that unless you request it not to be put on the bill, they will assume you have used the safe and charge you for it ($35 a day from memory). I felt that was dishonest. It would be better if they kept the key at the front desk, and only billed you for the safe if you ask for the key.
review.negativeRemarks: The heater in my room didn't work properly, and they are sneaky and try to charge you for using the safe even if you don't use it.

review.title: Helpful staff, excellent location
review.reviewText:
Not the cleanest and most comfortable hotel but the location is excellent, and the staff are really helpful.

My room was right at the end of the corridor next to the ice machine and vending machine, and the ice machine kept making so much noise all the time, not to mention the big bang when people buying drinks from the vending machine.

Apart from that I had good sleep and I found the area safe ( I am a lone female traveller).
review.negativeRemarks: a hole from cigarette end on the blanket

review.title: not bad
review.reviewText: well sited hotel just a walk from fishermens wharf and other attractions,the only downside is having to pay to park your car.

review.title: Pleasant one-night stay
review.reviewText: The only down-side was that the internet connection worked only about half of the time.
review.negativeRemarks: Internet access

review.title: Awesome, here are some ideas
review.reviewText:
I loved the hotel. It was a blast. I just wan to offer some ideas. THESE ARE NOT CRITICISMS. I think the hotel would benefit from having some sort of pool or hot tub experience. Also, the hotel no long offers direct room service but the room service menus are still in the rooms. Finally. It is always nice to have a few available computers in or near the lobby for guest use.
Thanks again
Great place

review.title: WiFi

Had a horrid view of an apartment building and room could use an inspection of carpet and why couldn't the burnt out light bulb be replaced? Sorry just not my idea of a place to recommend! The desk help however was very pleasant & helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking

review.title: Pretty good experience!
review.reviewText: The hotel was a great price, the walk to the wharf was not too bad and the breakfast made it all worth while. It is an older hotel, but clean! I would definitely stay again!
review.negativeRemarks: Old

review.title: Condition of room suprising for a Comfort Inn
review.reviewText: I regularly stay in Comfort Inn's when traveling because of the great breakfasts which are convenient and certainly help with budgeting. I have stayed in CI's in Salt Lake City, Denver, Burlington, NJ., Beckley, VA., Cleveland and Atlanta and more. I have never been as surprised by the condition of the room as I was here. The chairs in the room had tears in the seats and were worn beyond any condition that I would expect to see in a college students first apartment. Although, I would stay here again simply because of the location and budgeting with breakfast. I also would make aware of the location on the corner of two main roads causing it to be very loud on workday mornings. Weekends were ok.
review.positiveRemarks: Breakfast was great, staff was friendly!
review.negativeRemarks: Condition of furniture was poor and no fridge or microwave was disappointing.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is located in the city where it is loud. The location is on the corner of two main roads, so it is loud.

review.title: Great view!
review.reviewText: Excellent view of the Golden Gate; good reception and breakfast. Great location for walking to the harbour and Lombard street and a cable car connection.
review.positiveRemarks: The view of the Golden Gate Bridge
review.locationRemarks: Close to Lombard Street

review.title: Comfort inn by the bay San Fransisco
review.reviewText: The location is fantastic, adding to the ease of travelling around San Fransisco. The room was comfortable and quiet, and staff were helpful and friendly.
review.positiveRemarks: The location is great and accommodation reasonably priced
review.locationRemarks: Well-located, handy to the crookedest street (Lombard Street), the famous wharf area and all the restaurants, and public transport.

review.title: Family friendly Hotel
review.reviewText: The staff were friendly and helpful! Out room was noisy but for the price we couldn't have done better!! Would stay here again!

review.title: A good hotel
review.reviewText:
I thought the hotel has a good location.
It is easy to get on the bus to the fisherman wharf.
However, the interior for the room is just OK.
You paid what you expect to get.

review.title: An affordable choice in SFO
review.reviewText:
Older hotel but my room was exceptionally clean and well maintained. Staff were very helpful. My room was in the back which meant no view but incredibly quiet for such an urban location, I really appreciated that.
Location is close to Fishermans Wharf but is a hilly 40 minute walk to downtown.

review.title: Great job Expedia!
review.reviewText: Mostly very helpful, friendly staff. Generous breakfast in a pleasant environment. Helpful staff provided good recommendations to nearby restaurants, etc. Room was comfortable and clean. Very nice value for the price.

review.title: Very nice place
review.reviewText: Very nice place, especially for the price. Very clean. Breakfast is the same every morning, but it's good to have it.

review.title: Good hotel for the price, and we found it very conveniently located
review.reviewText: We got a good deal on the room. Luckily we didn't have a vehicle with us, as the parking fee seemed steep (maybe this is standard for San Fran). Breakfast was fine, and we found it very easy to get around the city from the hotel, using both local and tour buses (stopping right outside the hotel) and with an easy walk down to Fishermans wharf. I would go back here if I came back to San Francisco.

review.title: Great Location - Free Wi-Fi
review.reviewText: Great Value for the price, fast and easy - free wi-fi. great location for dining out.

review.title: Great San Francisco hotel!!
review.reviewText: We (2 adults and 2 children) enjoyed our stay at this hotel very much. The room was clean and comfortable and the beds were wonderful. Especially enjoyed the great "comp" breakfast they have for their customers. Food was just delicious and there were a lot of things to choose from...such as waffles, eggs, sausage, oat meal, coffee, juice, and many, many more items. We enjoyed this stay at the Comfort Inn by the Bay very much and we would do it again!!
review.locationRemarks: We enjoyed all of it...especially the wharf area.

review.title: It should be called "Comfort Inn NEAR the Bay" not BY the Bay
review.reviewText:
Our view of a putrid orange wall was not stimulating. Less stimulating was the additional $40 PER NIGHT that the motel wanted. They have huge posters in their elevators taunting those who have depressing views and urging an "upgrade" (see the desk.....)

The ice machine on our floor was not working so I had to trek from the second to the fifth floor. To his credit a maintenance man on the fifth floor noticed I had come off the elevator and asked from which floor I came. Then he did immediately take care of it.

I would not stay there again.
review.locationRemarks: The Wharf area is acceptable, as there are many other motels without a view that would have been available for less. They also do not suggest they are by the bay.

review.title: Will come back for sure.
review.reviewText: Best Contiential Breakfast ever had in any hotel we have ever stayed. We were very impressed.

review.title: it was good
review.reviewText:
We had a good stay at the hotel again and would recommend. It is close to the Lombard street and other attractions.
The only thing was breakfast. No meat for breakfast only one day we had eggs. So dont except a big buffet.

review.title: Great location and friendly service
review.reviewText: The hotel was fine for the price. The location was fantastic, only about a mile or so to the marina and 3 miles from the golden gate bridge. Great restaurants, bars, and shops a few blocks away on Union St. The staff was very helpful and gave great restaurant recommendations and called a cab for me to the airport early in the morning. I would definitely stay here again.

review.title: Great hotel for the price, nice location
review.reviewText:
the hotel was very clean, and the room was spacious and very nice. Although it did not have a very nice view, since those charge extra. Location is great you can be in fishermen's wharf in 15 minutes walking and the surrounding neighborhood is pretty safe. One block away you can take a bus both to downtown and the Wharf, so it was very convenient for my business. My only disappointment was the check in because I got there early and had to wait until exactly 4:00 PM to check in, which was very uncomfortable for me.
Aside from that everything was pretty nice.
review.locationRemarks: Pier 39, great place to know and have dinner.

review.title: Convenient Hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel was within walking distance (3/4 mile) of the wharf and the crooked street on Lombard. Room was clean and breafast adequate. Parking was under the hotel and not as expensive as closer to the wharf.

review.title: In need of a make over!
review.reviewText: We liked the location of this hotel, as it is one block from where our son lives. However, hotel is long over due for a remodel! Hotel has old furnisihings, old windows & very old air conditioners that don't work.

review.title: Give it a try...
review.reviewText:
We have visited San Francisco twice and have stayed at the same hotel Comfort Inn By The Bay..
The hotel is adequate for what you want and need clean tidy ,and now you can even have breakfast( which is included by the way not so, with other hotels in San Francisco) in your room if you wanted..
Ok so there's little around the surrounding area however it's about 15 mins walk to Fishermans Wharf where you can visit the seals at Pier 39, take a trip to Alcatraz, take a cruise under the Golden Gate bridge and many other attractions..
15 mins walk uphill from the hotel you have the famous Crooked Street and fantastic views of the city, see the cable cars slowly climbing the hills..
Best advice get a Muni Pass about $27 from the cable car turn around at fishermans wharf you can ride any public transport for 7 days weel worth it..
Check out the local bus routes , free map at the hotel...
Have a great time we did, you won't regret it...

review.title: Less than not Impressed. run down
review.reviewText:
The managers were great, doing their best with a overpriced hotel that needs a major overhaul. We had a squeely floor above us & that guest took pleasure in pacing. The young soccer team & chear team come to town slamming the pool gate till late. After 2 nights we left wrecked & are now in Santa Barbara.
What a diferance.
Santa Cruz is is not recomended & is failing.

review.title: good experience with a nice view
review.reviewText:
We paid extra to have a room with a view of the bay, and whenever the fog lifted (after noon most of the time) we had a lovely view of the bay with the golden gate bridge. We were on the third floor only and that was sufficient for a nice view. Our room was spacious and comfortable, and surprisingly quiet for such a major intersection.

Careful: parking is $26 per day.

Our only other gripe was with the free breakfast. As in many other places we found there was little fruit (bananas and apples only), and few protein choices. Breads included thin commercial bread, bagels, muffins (very good) but little in the way of whole grains. All through California we were amazed at the few choices of fruits, considering that the state is such a huge exporter of same. I must admit we are demanding as far as food goes and had the same criticism of many of the places where we stayed. Otherwise it was a nice place to stay, in an interesting neighborhood without the inconvenience and noise of downtown.

review.title: will stay there again
review.reviewText: the only problem we had was a week wi fi sig and could not get on line to skype our kids at home

review.title: Great experience
review.reviewText: I'll go back to this hotel next time :))

review.title: good value
review.reviewText: good, no frills hotel. Rooms were larger than I expected, nothing fancy but comfortable. Breakfast room was a bit crowded all morning but the cook your own waffles were very good, other breakfast menu items were okay. About a 5 block walk to Fisherman's Wharf and another 5-6 blocks to Pier 39. For the price, it would be hard to beat this property.

review.title: Good Value - Convienient - this is my 2nd stay there
review.reviewText: Free breakfast - decent, not great but enough to get yoru day going. Easy walk to Fishermans Warf. From there, you can get anywhere !! We even walked to China town... a few large up hill streets, but great sightseeing !!

review.title: This hotel is awesome!
review.reviewText:
This hotel is located in a prime spot. Only a few minutes walk from Fisherman's Wharf. MUNI bus stop is right outside that run along Van Ness, which will take you straight up to Market St. Only 3 blocks west on Lombard, you can catch the bus to get to the Golden Gate Bridge.

Our room was super comfy and very clean. We requested an additional bed, and it was brought up immediately.

The breakfast was amazing. All the fixin's you need:
Toast
cereal
fruit
scrambled eggs
sausage
make-your-own waffle bar
coffee, tea, juices.
And it's all free!!!

I loved the complementary wi-fi. Very handy as I had my laptop with me. Plus we had a spectacular view of the bridge Golden Gate Bridge. The beds are really comfy too.

They have both underground and above ground parking (for larger vehicles).

Excellent rates, excellent service. I highly recommend this hotel. I've stayed here twice and both times, the experience was just perfect.

review.title: San Francisco was great and so was the hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel was great. The parking garage was crazy but we survived.

review.title: Great value
review.reviewText: Great location, a short walk to Fisherman's Wharf and buses to downtown just around the corner, very accessible. Friendly, helpful staff. The rate also includes breakfast which is what makes it such great value. Even though it says continental breakfast you actually get a massive range including eggs, sausages, waffles, pastries etc. I'd definitely recommend this hotel.

review.title: Perfect location
review.reviewText: We stayed for a week. Overall satisfied with the location and good breakfast. We were quite disappointed with the elevator. There was only on elevator working during our stay. We had to take the stairway exit to go down.

review.title: Does the Job
review.reviewText: Best deal for the area. Prime location near major hot spots in SF. Not fancy accommodations. But it's good enough. And for the price, it's an excellent value.

review.title: Will stay here again
review.reviewText: Room was just like advertised. Choose a premium upper floor room and the veiw is awesome!

review.title: Kinda weird, not the best, not worth the money
review.reviewText: way overpriced for the room, but it was a bed to stay on a short notice, next time i will be doing my homework. the front desk didnt know the phrase 'security deposit' and when i asked her what she was talking about when she was telling me she was going to charge me an extra $59 but not and i asked her too explain it took me a few minutes to explain it was just a security deposit. it was a really creepy hotel for a seeminly good part of town, but we werent there very long so i guess it was okay. but i wouldhighly suggest doing your homework first and looking around and pricing because it was not worth what we paid.

review.title: Good deal
review.reviewText: nice neighborhood, be prepared for walking uphill. Bus on the corner is good option for transit. Nice hotel employees, good breakfast.

review.title: 5 wonderful days in San Fran!
review.reviewText:
Great position, could walk to Fishermans Wharf in 8-10 min leisurely walking pace. Fantastic view of The Bay and The Goldeh Gate Bridge. Couldn't ask 4 a better view.Room very comfortable and roomy. Shower wasn't the best but if thats all the problem was I didn't care. Staff friendly and helpful.Breakfast included was very welcoming every morning and the coffee wasn't bad at all!!
I would stay there again and recommend it to other travellers. Great position!!

review.title: It's a good hoter
review.reviewText: It's a nice place to visit. The hotel is comfortable

review.title: Everyone so friendly!!
review.reviewText: It was a very nice hotel to stay in. Great ciontinental breakfast. Very cl;ose to bus stops and only 6 blocks from fishermans warf.

review.title: OK for the money
review.reviewText: Good location on bus line and near to cable car.

review.title: Excellent Location
review.reviewText: Excellent location, close to main atractions

review.title: Good
review.reviewText: Very nice location, modern style and averything is OK.

review.title: Would recommend
review.reviewText:
The room was nice, clean, and comfortable. The location was great: five - seven minutes walk to Ghirardelli Square and around fifteen-twenty minutes to Pier 39. I would only say breakfast could have been better.

Overall, the stay was a pleasant experience and this hotel is a very good choice on a money/performance basis. My priorities were location and cleanliness - and both were met.

review.title: Can't wait to go back.
review.reviewText:
The view of the Golden Gate Bridge and the Bay are gorgeous;
I don't think any other hotel can beat this! Their rates are reasonable.
The room has always been immaculate. The staff is pleasant. Their breakfast leaves a lot to be desired but book a bay view room once and you
will never stay anywhere else! Their location to shops, restaurants, the CA.st. cable car, many bus lines, the wharf, city hall and symphony hall are great!

review.title: Room with a view... Even on the third floor!
review.reviewText:
When we were told our room was on the third floor, we thought for sure we wouldn't have a view. Just the opposite. We could see the entire Golden Gate Bridge while sitting in our chair.

The breakfast was better than I expected. They even had plain oatmeal for the calorie conscious. The coffee said "gourmet" and I admit I was skeptical, but it was nice and strong.

The location couldn't have been better. Walking distance to North Beach and the Marina. We even walked to and from the GG Bridge but we were exhausted by the time we reached the Marina again!! It must have been at least an 8 mile trek.

The room was clean every time we came back and everyone was very polite and helpful. Definitely going to stay there next time!

review.title: Good location, comfortable but with limited facilities
review.reviewText: Was informed that to have a refrigerator in the room I would be charged $15 per night. This is not stated on website as is the other charges is safe & parking. I required one for medical purposes and would have appreciated knowing this charge in advance, however the receptionist did offer to keep my medicationin hotel refrigerator. The rooms were average, comfortable beds, small bathroom but acceptable. The staff were friendly & helpful. Breakfast was nice. Walking distance to Fishermans Wharf and plenty of restaurants there. A good hotel with limited facilities but u get what u pay for with this hotel and anything else costs extra.

review.title: Good budget priced hotel
review.reviewText: Good location, near bus stops but within an easy walk of Fishermans Wharf, basic but sufficient breakfast, a clean tidy hotel in a good location at a reasonable price for the area.

review.title: Beware the extra charges
review.reviewText: The hotel was average, nothing to rave about. It was clean, comfortable, some damage to the bathroom (light switch was completely broken). I didn't appreciate the surprise charges.

review.title: Great Hoel we wil definetly go back
review.reviewText: The view from our room was the Golden Gate bridge, can't get much better than that

review.title: Great hotel - breakfast included!
review.reviewText: This hotel was perfect for what we needed - low cost, great location, and a breakfast. We couldn't have asked for anything more. The staff was great, friendly, and very helpful. We were in walking distance from Pier 39 and felt safe at all times. The breakfast was fantastic and really allowed us to enjoy the rest of they day and because it was included, we were able to spend a bit more on other meals and entertainment. Definitely a must stay!

review.title: good location
review.reviewText: The hotel service was good, except that our phone rang by mistake in the middle of the night and it disturbed our night sleeping...The location of this hotel is the best, close to the main a attractions of SF. The parking lot fee is absurd $26 per night + taxes. The waffles at breakfast was delicious!! We paid for a room with a view to the Golden Gate but the windows were locked and so dirty that we could not see the bridge :(

review.title: would stay again
review.reviewText:
rented 4 rooms for 2 nights. searched eveything on the internet for a good clean deal
near fishermans wharf and other popular areas. this was the best value and it was very very nice for the money. an excellent value. one room had a musty smell but we opened the window and aired it out for a while. all were clean and relatively new.
NO bedbugs or any sign of them. parking was extremly expensive as reviewed. $26 per night and then they added $3 tax which is more than 10 percent and blamed it on governor Arnold Swartzneigler. they have no shortage of parking in their underground garage as long as you can navigate in tight quarters. we had a van. glad we did not have a suburban. no roof racks. 2 inches to the top of the van.

review.title: Priced Right for a first visit to San Francisco
review.reviewText:
I Traveled on Business and choose the comfort Inn by the bay for a few reasons,
Price, Fee Waffles ( Breakfast), and that is stated it was a few blocks from the Fisherman's warf - Since I didn't have a car I thought I could walk to and from there to get dinner and go to the shops as mentioned on there website. Well the Fisherrman's Warf is a little further then what I thought, I think I remember the website saying 4 blocks... something like that, well it is not so bad getting there so that was all downhill.. maybe a 15 minute walk - but getting back up the hills was tiring for this 37 yr old. Oh The Crookest rd is like 2.5 blocks from the hotel on Lombard but unless your a fitness nut don't try to walk there, I did and my legs hurt for 3 days after because of the steep hill, haha. I do Recommend the Restaurant about a half black down from the hotel BoBo's Steakhouse, very nice staff and awesome steaks, from what I heard they are one of the top steakhouses in San Francisco. Overall the stay was nice for the price.. no problems. I think next time though I will stay even closer to the Warf !
PS~ Don't forget to try the sour dough Bread!! Can't wait to return one day!

review.title: SF Honeymoon
review.reviewText: We had the best time in San Francisco for our honeymoon. The Comfort Inn was on a main bus route where we were able to connect to the whole city. We will be staying there again when we return to SF.

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText:
The location of the Hotel was great!! We did not get the view that we specifically requested, but the room and service was great.
The breakfast area was not big enough for all of the people, but for a free breakfast was not bad. Lots of street noise from our room.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Easy access to puplic transportation. Within walking distance to Fishermans Wharf and Pier 39.

review.title: Great place to stay
review.reviewText: Pleasantly surprised with this hotel. The location was great, view was phenominal from the 9th floor. Front desk people were knowledgeable. The continental breakfast was one of the best I have ever seen with make your self waffles, fresh fruit, pastries, toast, english muffins, hardboiled eggs, tea, coffee, hot chocolate, apple and orange juice, and plenty of tables to sit at. It was a little noisy at night time even from the ninth floor, but i was prepared with ear plugs. Very easy to get around with this location. I have stayed in the finanacial district before and i would stay here again before the financial district. The bathroom was small, only because the bath and toilet is separate from the vanity. With multiple people it is nice because one person can still get ready at the mirror while another is showering. There are no computers to use but they do have WIFI which was easy to connect to and worked the whole time. The carpets were wet when we checked in, but in all fairness we did check in 3 hours early and it was nice to know that they shampoo the carpets!

review.title: It was a great stay
review.reviewText: Our stay at the Comfort Inn was very pleasant. The girl at the front desk was extremely helpful and full of information. The breakfast in the morning was great and more than we expected. the staff tried to keep it clean but there are alot of people in and out, he did a great jop as far as we are concerned. the waffles were yummy! This is just your regular hotel, not upscale. But it is clean and the bed was comfortable. We had a view of the Golden Gate Bridge and it was all good. Yes, I recommend this hotel. You are only blocks away from everything. We even walked to china town and union square. The weather was incredible and the food all over San Franscico was great. Have fun.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: At the rate we paid the Comfort Inn was much cleaner and offered more than hotels at twice the cost. Would stay again without a second thought.

review.title: Great Location; Not so great amenities
review.reviewText: This is a good hotel if you have other things to do than hang out at a hotel. Aside from breakfast every morning, there are virtually no amenities. The bathrooms are tiny, parking is a bear, and the elevators were slow. That said, the location is outstanding. We enjoyed all the great places we could walk to and the bus ride to downtown was an simple as could be. I would not recommend this hotel to a friend because everything about it says "cheap" and the rate I got was pretty close to swankier hotels downtown.

review.title: Great hotel, very well located, affordable and very quite
review.reviewText:
Before arriving I phoned the Manager Brian, to ask for an early check-in, and at arival my room was ready and 3 hours in advance.
The people at front desck is very friendly and collaborative and helpful, particularly Ivana.
The room was clean and nice and quite, the breakfast was suculent and gorgeaus.
The hotel is very well located from everything.
No matter was FLEET WEEK in San Francsico and the city was packed...the hotel was always quite and nice!!!!

review.title: Great location for the money
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay at the Comfort Inn by the Bay. It was a <10 min. walk to the Fisherman's Walk area and a less than < 10 min. walk to the infamous curvy section of Lombard street. Breakfast was better than average for a free hotel breakfast with fresh fruit, cereal, milk, pastries, and make your own waffles. We were also allowed to store our bags upon check out for a couple of extra hours of sightseeing. We almost didn't stay here for want of a "fancy" hotel experience, but couldn't bring ourselves to shell out the big bucks and we were pleasantly surprised and will stay here again if ever in the area without a second thought.

review.title: Great hotel for the money!
review.reviewText: Comfort Inn by the Bay was a high end 2 (or 3?) star hotel. Great amenities! Breakfast was very complete and well maintained, hotel staff friendly and helpful, and location was convenient. If we return to San Francisco, we will probably stay there again!

review.title: Not Impressed
review.reviewText: The location is great, but the room I got did not smell good at all.. it smelled like a wet dog. And the rest of the accomodations are alright. Aside from the smell, the room was good in size and cleanliness.

review.title: Convenient to bus lines.
review.reviewText: No frills but perfectly safisfactory, especially for a busy, urban hotal. Our room was compact, but clean and comfortable after long days of sight seeing. This Comfort Inn is not very far from the harbor, and a pleasant, downhill walk. To get to Pier 39 is about twice as far, but it's all very interesting to walk along the water, if you're on vacation and have the time. If you need to get somewhere farther (we crossed the city to Golden Gate Park, for example, to visit the Academy of Natural Sciences) the hotel is very convenient to major bus lines. Comfortable beds. Adequate breakfast.

review.title: Cheaper SF Parking
review.reviewText:
We picked this SF hotel mainly because parking was about half a night less than any other. Everything else was over $40! The lot was extremely small and hard to navigate, but there was underground, off street parking for almost half the rate.

On the first day the buffet was great: ample food, well maintained, good variety.
On our second visit, the buffet was a mess: no juice at all, milk pitchers and coffee urns empty, unbussed dirty table seating, spills and crumbs around the serving area, etc. This was 9:10 on a buffet that was open until 9:30. Instead of providing more, they just started removing the empty items. I never even got a cup of coffee.

review.title: Very Clean and nice.
review.reviewText: Front desk was very helpful and very friendly. My mom lost her key in the elevator right when we checked in and they replaced it at no extra charge. Our rooms were clean and very nice. Bathroom is a little small but its very clean and functional. Nice view from our windows. Very close to the wharf/pier 39. Walking down to the wharf is very easy and lovely views all the way there but if you stay there late at night..take the taxi back because the hill you walked down hill on is rough to go back up especially when you are extremely warn out from your day out. Parking in a under ground parking lot that is a little snug to get in and out and it cost about 26.99 plus tax to park there, which they charge you when you check out and they don't guarantee that a parking spot will we be available is you take you car in and out throughout the day ( which is not right ...since you paying over 30 bucks to park there. But we left our car parked there, walked and took a cab everywhere. No complaints. Would definitely stay here again.

review.title: Graduation Black Tie night of horrors
review.reviewText:
The hotel staff were very welcoming, and when deciding whether to stay a second night - we were advised that 1) it would be more expensive and 2) we would have to decide quickly as they had very few vacancies due to it being Graduation night in town. We nevertheless opted for the second night.
The hotel was listed as being in the Fisherman's Wharf area - and being International tourists - that was where we wanted to be. It was however a steep and considerable walk from Pier 39.
On our second night - due in no part to the hotel - there was a great disturbance outside our room - involving some that had obviously drunk too much at the graduation celebrations.
