This meant only a couple of hours sleep - and numerous calls to hotel security. In the morning we were promptly offered a discounted rate to compensate, and the police had the main offender in hand.
A good variety of breakfast was supplied - cereal, fruit, boiled eggs, waffles, toast and muffins.

review.title: so close to Fishermans Wharf
review.reviewText: hotel staff were very nice , the neighborhood was beutiful and within walking distance of fishermans wharf had so much fun ,we LOVE San Francisco....

review.title: Not saying anything is the same as lying...
review.reviewText: Make sure you are aware of any charges made to your room...when charging to your room make sure it is taken as a charge to the room & not a direct charge from card. This hotel took a hold for charging to the room & then proceeded to charge things directly to my card. Now almost 15 days later this hotel has not released my funds & caused me to overdraft due to these charges directly to my card instead of to the fees taken explicitly for that purpose!

review.title: Good value
review.reviewText:
A little further from Pier 39 than we would have preferred, but there's a bus stop a block up the street that took us straight there (or straight to Union Square. We actually ended up driving a good portion of the trip anyway.

Parking wasn't cheap, but it was a bit less than several of the other hotels I looked at, and I didn't expect cheap parking in SF anyway.

Overall, we paid less for this hotel than we would have paid for any of the other equivalent-rated ones I looked at, and got a decent place to stay that was fairly conveniently located.

review.title: "Comfort" Inn is just that: Comfortable!
review.reviewText: Getting around SF is easy with their great transportation. The hotel has bus stops really close by (walking distance with luggage), yet, it is quiet enough to get a comfortable night's sleep. The complimentary breakfast had a lot to choose from and the food was fresh. Great views from the hotel itself and walking distance to many of SF's tourist attractions. Very satisfied here!

review.title: I recommend
review.reviewText: Good hotel at a reasonable location. If you don`t mind to walk 10 blocks, this is the best rate cost/benefits in San Francisco.

review.title: Not impressed really
review.reviewText: The same like up

review.title: excellent stay
review.reviewText: Everyone was very curtious, couldnt ask for anything more

review.title: lovely
review.reviewText:
The staff were extremely helpful from the minute we arrived. bedrrom extremely comfortable. Would not say it is top of the range having previously been at las vegas Treasure Island prior to arrival but clean, comfy, friendly staff. Bathroom could do with some updating but was clean.
Breakfast included which was good value.
We stayed in the Golden gate bridge view room which was great.
Location was no problems, we did a few tours and were picked up from the front of the hotel. Local kiosk open 7 days a week till 10pm .
Would stay there agin. Was there with my parents and they too loveed it and would return again

review.title: Friendly staff and great location.
review.reviewText: The hotel is located within walking distance of several major buslines, the trollies, the Wharf, tourist attractions. The staff was incredibly friendly and willing to provide info, service and even extend breakfast 15 minutes for us. Would stay again.

review.title: Nice Location / views
review.reviewText: ok

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel was nice and service was good. The parking garage was VERY tight... you don't want to go in there with a large car or SUV if you can help it.

review.title: Good Hotel, Good Location
review.reviewText: Hotel was nice with friendly staff and within walking distance of most things by the bay. We had a good view of the Golden Gate Bridge when the fog was not covering it.

review.title: Great for the price, forget the breakfast
review.reviewText: Great location for Fishermans Wharf. The free breakfast tries to be to be too much and definitely disapoints. Helpful Staff.

review.title: overall good quality
review.reviewText: only downside was the breakfast soooooooooooooooooo crowded and same food every day much of it was cold.

review.title: Okay
review.reviewText: The rooms were nice, but the name of the hotel "by the bay" leads you to believe that it is closer to the wharf than it really is. We walked 7-10 blocks down Van Ness to get to the wharf. If you have an oversized vehicle to park DO NOT park in the underground garage. My husband scaped our truck trying to make it fit. They told us afterwards that they had an oversized lot! The hotel staff was friendly and helpful depending on who was working. Plently of room for my husband, myself, and two boys. The view of the Golden Gate Bridge was great.

review.title: Not much to look at but clean and comfy
review.reviewText: This hotel is not much to look at, I had a smoking room which was a little bit cheaper, but you do lose your view. When we woke up in a morning and looked out of the window we was staring at a brick wall. The non smoking rooms probbaly had the best views which is understandable. Even so this hotel is a little dated, but it is friendly comfy and clean. The breakfast is OK if you just like cereal and toast, but they do have waffle making machines and you can eat as much as you like. We spent many a morning hungover so we just went for coffee and juice (freshly squeezed). The staff are friendly and courteous and will help you with anything you need from ordering taxis to giving change for the vending machines, as on occasion it wouldn't take notes. It is a good distance from many places including Pier39. If you need somewhere which is comfy, clean, cheap and some where just to sleep this is a good place. It would be nice if they had a bar as well.

review.title: never go back to comfort inn
review.reviewText: im sorry that we stay there !!!! my frist time in san francisco i would of enjoy if i didnt have to deal with the people on the front desk we just not impress ( parking 26 dollar to that my hotel and im staying there )

review.title: Good Value for a good location
review.reviewText: Overall the hotel was a good deal. The location is within easy walking distance to Fisherman's wharf. The room was small but clean. The continental breakfast was more than adequate and the eating area was relatively large. If you want to be near Fisherman's Wharf, this hotel is a good deal.

review.title: Best Hotel in SF
review.reviewText: I stayed in this hotel for 6 nights and thoroughly enjoyed it! The room was very comfortable and very clean. The free internet was a total bonus. This hotel has one of the best included breakfasts I have ever had. It is a proper sit-down dining room with a large selection of food for breakfast, and it is all included! The location is supreme as it is close to the Fishermans Wharf, and being on a main street was easy to pick up the transit. Hotel staff was very courteous and helpful. They helped arrange day tours and airport transportation too. We spent the extra money to get a bay-view room. It was outstanding. We had an unobstructed view of the Golden Gate Bride. Wow! In short, I have nothing bad to say about this hotel. I highly recommend it.

review.title: Had a good time
review.reviewText: We really enjoyed our stay in San Francisco, the only problem being trying to find a place to park while we registered. We had to circle the block about three times, and even then, we ended up parking in a no parking zone, because there wasn't anywhere marked for registration parking.

review.title: Good location and Bay Bridge view
review.reviewText: Perfect location - at walking distance from the Bay and Fisherman's warf. Comfortable rooms and friendly staff. Complimentary breakfast was for a change NOT from plastic or paper plates but with real silverware and plates! Thank you for saving the environment. Parking space at premises was convenient.

review.title: Good hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel was fine, and the price good.

review.title: Great Value! Great Hotel! Great Location!
review.reviewText: This comfort inn was great! We had a slight problem with our room because the noise from the ice machine was a little bothersome, but they quickly fixed it by giving us another room in the span of 5 minutes! Service was great, clean and comfortable rooms, breakfast was filling and tasty, and the location of the hotel was perfect. Walking distance from the Piers and several buses bringing you to all corners of San Francisco!

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: only stayed 1 night. but hotel was clean and comfortable and a good price. walking distance front.

review.title: Parking is Hell
review.reviewText: The hotel was nice, however, parking was very bad. You must have an small car or sweat it out trying to park a large car or pickup

review.title: Not happy paying for parking
review.reviewText: Overall I thought that the hotel was just fine. I thought that paying for parking was a little ridiculous. For 3 days I ended up paying close to $100.00 for parking on top of a not so inexpensive inn.

review.title: Not Impressed
review.reviewText: We had read great reviews on this hotel which fell dramatically short. Front desk staff was hopelessly unfriendly. Breakfast staff was horrible. Sold room as bridge view. Third floor didn't allow for much view. DO NOT get smoking room..never smelled anything worse in my life.

review.title: Worth the Money
review.reviewText: The hotel is fine, but it is quite old. We were there for only a day, so it was no big deal. But, it is in a pretty good location. Worth the costs

review.title: Convenient location
review.reviewText: Close to all the things I wanted to see PLUS parking available so you could drive out of the city for day trips.

review.title: Free breakfast is great.
review.reviewText: Stayed here 3 days in April 09. good location, bus stop is outside the front door. Breakfast is great for free. Free internet in the room is also a great bonus. Staff are friendly. Only one issue while we were there. Staff offered to book our transfer to the airport. There were 4 of us so we repeatedly specified we needed a mini van. When the car arrived it was a town car!! The receptionist was adamant we had asked for a town car. Why would we ask for a car that would not accomodate us?

review.title: great location
review.reviewText: This hotel was just off the beaten path, and it was still close enough to main attractions. Stay in the bridge view room. There are busses that go right by. Breakfast was more than adequate.

review.title: Very good value
review.reviewText: The hotel is close to transport to downtown or Fisherman's Wharf. Staff were very pleasant and helpful.

review.title: Room with a view
review.reviewText: We had two adjoining rooms on the upper floors with (as promised) views of the Golden Gate Bridge and they were proper views available with the naked eye. Rooms were spacious and adequately comfortable for the price. Breakfast was a bit of a scrum as the hotel seems to be popular with San Francisco visitors who like us were keen for a reasonable start to a Sunday morning. Staff were very helpful - we left a laptop power cable in the room which we only realized once we were home - 90 miles away. A call to housekeeping ensured the power cable was posted to us the next morning. Would stay here again.

review.title: safe area for a hotel
review.reviewText: Rooms are a bit small but very clean. Breakfasts were ok but do-it-yourself waffles were very good. If they had eggs, fresh bacon, and possibly some fresher danish it would be a 5 star breakfast as far as I am concerned. Hotel is very centrally located to events and in a "safe" neighborhood. Very close to bus pick up areas.

review.title: Great review!
review.reviewText: I was very happy with everything about the hotel and its services. In fact, I was surprised that everything was so nice. I expected to encounter rude people here and there, especially after reading reviews from other hotels. But our total experience was positive, including the rate. I'd go back again if in San Francisco.

review.title: Great Hotel..Great Area...Great Price
review.reviewText: We arrived early for check-in. As we had driven from Toronto ON, the gentleman at the desk happily allowed us to check in early! The room was nice, comfortable and in a great area. I would definitely stay here again and recommend this hotel to all my friends and family alike.

review.title: you get more than you pay for
review.reviewText: I stay at dozens of hotels each year, and although I appreciate a little nicer hotel for business, this hotel was perfect to take my niece to San Francisco for her Spring break. Location great, hotel guest services great, rooms were comfortable, clean, and more than I expected. If you want 5 star, go to a 5 star. If you want an overachieving, comfortable hotel in a great location with a great staff at a great price, don't overlook this one. I did have a room to myself as did my niece, so that could make a difference to many that have multiples in rooms. It's up to you. I recommend.

review.title: Impressed with Service
review.reviewText: I was VERY impressed with the service. Their "continental breakfast" includes waffles, English muffins, cereal, etc, which is a lot more than other hotels I've stayed at. They were helpful in giving me directions when I needed to find my way back to the hotel from downtown and also printed out itineraries for us that we forgot to print before we came. I would DEFINITELY stay here again.

review.title: Great Stay at Comfort Inn by the Bay
review.reviewText: I had seen all the pictures and read all the reviews, but you still never really know until you see it in person. And was I ever impressed! The hotel staff was great. From the great dinner suggestion on our first night to the breakfast buffet staff to the gentleman who helped me confirm our shuttle and print-out our boarding passes, everyone was so friendly and helpful. It was our first time in California and your hotel contributed to what became a very memorable vacation. The free continental breakfast was a wonderful way to start a day full of sightseeing and shopping! The rooms were very comfortable and generous. And the location was perfect - within walking distance of just about everything we wanted to do and with a great view of the Golden Gate Bridge. I would highly recommend Comfort Inn by the Bay to anyone looking for a very clean, friendly, convenient, reasonably priced hotel in San Francisco!!

review.title: Comfort by the Bay is exactly what it is!!
review.reviewText: After a hectic day around San Francisco each day it was a delight to come back to the comfort of the hotel in the evening. My room had all the comforts of home and more from TV, computer connections to hairdryer, iron, telephone, radio and a fantastic view from where I was on the 10th floor. A comfy bed and regular cleaning and changing of towels to sheets every day. But the breakfast was the highlight of the day wow what a selection from muffins, cereals, egg, toast to juices, coffee, tea and loads of fresh fruit. Staff were always there to help. I even extended my stay for another night and would have stayed longer if they had had another room.

review.title: Don't Stay Here
review.reviewText: $27/Night to Park. $1 extra for more coffee. Surly, but proper, service. Inconvenient access, parking underground very tight and too expensive. Rooms too small and guess what? You pay extra for a 'view'. No convenient dining - several blocks away. Don't stay here.

review.title: Enjoyed our stay...would definitely stay here again!
review.reviewText: The staff at the front desk was extremly helpful in recommending the best way of getting somewhere. They provided maps and other tips. Continental breakfast was a nice bonus. It would have been nice to see some variation in the food served from day-to-day, though. Good neighborhood...felt safe walking throughout the area. Would definitely return! Thanks much.

review.title: this is nice hotle but they runinig after the $$
review.reviewText: parking ~26$ a day (inc disablty) we order 3 adult room and needed to as 15$ a day for roling bad

review.title: Great Value
review.reviewText: The hotel staff was very friendly. Great location and the hotel was very clean. The hotel was a very good value.

review.title: Good value and location
review.reviewText: Its the best deal I can get for its location, downtown area. Close to the GG bridge, GG park, chinatown, everything was extremely close. If you want a starting point in SF, this is a place to start. The bad part is the parking is extremely limited and place to park to check in is terrible. The room walls are rather thin, but was really comfortable. The front desk was really nice and helpful. I would go back for its value and location.

review.title: New Year's Eve holiday
review.reviewText: hotel was great close to fisherman's warf, comfy & easy to access, parking is a little difficult w/a large vehicle, breakfast was so-so too many kids in the way of "do it yourself" waffle maker

review.title: Pretty Good
review.reviewText: We had 3 rooms reserved for 2 nights here. We had arrived early around 10:30AM. The front desk as pretty accommodating and they gave us one room as the others were getting ready. The location is awesome - its about a mile to the Fisherman's Wharf and just about 4 blocks to the Crookedest Street area. There was public transport easily available, as this was on the crossing of Lombard & Van Ness which is a well covered route. The breakfast was also pretty decent. The staff was quite courteous. Do check out the nearby pubs. Overall a great place to park. Would definitely recommend this place.

review.title: Would Stay There Again, No Doubt
review.reviewText: I wasn't too jazzed about being so far away from the Wharf but this hotel turned out to be a great location and a reasonable rate. We walked everywhere and if we got tired, we took a cab and it wasn't too bad of a cab fare. The breakfast was great and convenient, too (coffee, juice, milk, waffles, cereal, toast, etc.). The only issue we had with the room was the windows - they were quite dirty. However, if that was the worst thing, we were way ahead of the game. Can hardly wait to book our next visit to San Francisco.

review.title: JUST OK
review.reviewText: Fairly good location,staff unhelpful and one extremely rude.the room was small,bathroom tiny,there was mold on the window frames ,curtains ripped and dirty,GO SOMEWHERE ELSE

review.title: Hotel was okay
review.reviewText: A nice breakfast was available each morning.

review.title: Had a Terrific Stay at the Comfort Inn by the Bay!
review.reviewText: Staff was extremely helpful and very pleasant, views are really great and the rooms are clean and spacious and the beds are comfortable, the location was perfect for us~ We had a great stay here and would stay here again and again :-)

review.title: Friendly and helpfull
review.reviewText: We were very happy with this budget hotel. The rooms were well equiped and comfortable, and spotlessly clean. The staff were all very friendly, and could not have been more helpfull. I would not hesitate to use this hotel again. My only adverse comment would be some stains on the carpet between the lobby and the dining area, which was the first thing you saw when entering the hotel, giving a poor first impression.

review.title: Wonderful place to stay
review.reviewText: This hotel was not only neat and clean with a great continental breakfast and friendly staff, but very convenient to bus lines and within walking distance to Fisherman's Warf. I would highly recommend it to anyone staying in San Francisco for pleasure.

review.title: Good Place to stay
review.reviewText: Hotel was O'k and met our needs.

review.title: Very comfortable
review.reviewText: Hotel was everything we required for our stop over for a couple of day. Breakfast was plentiful. Staff were most helpful and courteous. Would highly recommend.

review.title: functional for one night
review.reviewText: Stayed for one night on arriving in S.F. Found hotel to be busy and somewhat dated although service was satisfactory and room was adequate. Location is good for walking to the Fishermans wharf and Pier 34( approx 15 mins). Overall was satisfied but would not use as a base for a longer stay in S.F.

review.title: Great Location!
review.reviewText: Great location for making it easy to get around the city. Rooms were comfortable and cheap for Frisco.

review.title: Thnnks for making our stay so pleasant!
review.reviewText: Thank you to the hotel staff for all of their help in getting cabs to the airport, helping us line up tours, giving directions and helpful information! It was also great that our tour bus could pick us up at your hotel! Our room was nice and clean and we appreciated the continental breakfast! The view of the Golden Gate bridge from our window was amazing! We would recommend your hotel to others!

review.title: Comfortable with Comfort Inn
review.reviewText: It's an older hotel but exceptionally well maintained. Totally worth spending the extra few bucks for one of the bridge view rooms. Amazing view of the bay and the Golden Gate. Also, easy walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf.

review.title: Great San Francisco hotel
review.reviewText: It was a great hotel that was clean and staff were very friendly.

review.title: Very Impressed
review.reviewText: After a 25 hour flight from abroad, I appreciated a shower and nice clean bed. For a reasonably cheap hotel it was satisfactory and I would recommend it to anyone.

review.title: I was impressed.
review.reviewText: Overall I loved this hotel. It was very clean and in good shape. Friendly staff. I would stay there again!

review.title: Convenient Location
review.reviewText: This hotel is well located. Two blocks uphill for the cable car to Chinatown and Union Square. Across the road from a bus stop for a short ride to Fishermans Wharf, Piers 39 and 33. Not very much in the way of shopping surrounding the actual hotel but it is within a short bus ride away. Book early for this hotel was booked out the whole of our stay. The queue for breakfast was always long.

review.title: Ideal Location
review.reviewText: We were more than impressed with this hotel. Considering it is only a 2 star grading. Staff at the reception were excellent. Our room was very large with views to the bay and Golden Gate Bridge, bathroom on the small size. The Breakfast Room at the hotel was rather small for the amount of guests using this facility. Was not impressed when envelopes for tips was put on each table, first time this has happened to us on our travels.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a great location. Fisherman's Warf is within walking distance. The trolley stop near Lombard is also within walking distance making transportation fairly easy. The parking structure is rather small, so if you want to park there (at a cost) you'll have to drive around a bit and hope to find a spot. If you can't find a spot, you don't have to pay for parking. The free breakfast if basic and the dining room is small. I'd only recommend it if you want to eat something quick before heading out. It would be better, I think, to find breakfast elsewhere. This hotel is a basic, no frills hotel and the price is reasonable for the location.

review.title: Forget parking on premises
review.reviewText: If you think you have pre-reserved garage parking, you may be surprised on check-in when they tell you that parking availability is capacity-limited and they can't guarantee it. If you return late at night and there are no spots available in the hotel garage, they're willing to 'recommend' alternatives in the area. Nice.

review.title: overpriced
review.reviewText: way overpriced for what you got...had to pay for parking...first experience of that....room was very small

review.title: Excellent location for Sight Seeing
review.reviewText: We took our granddaughters and had adjoining rooms on the 4th, both with a great view of the Golden Gate bridge. The rooms were cleaned each day and - unless you prefer to recycle, they will supply clean towels. The free breakfast is a "zoo" however, so we walked down the street for a cheap - but quicker and quieter breakfast most days. The 4-5 block walk to Fisherman's Wharf is easy and from there you can catch a cable car, boat or bus to all of the great sites. *Be sure to order your Alcatraz tickets ahead on line because they are sold out about a week ahead. You can easily rent a car (Avis or Hertz)on Bay St. and take a day trip over the Golden Gate Bridge to Muir Woods & Stinson Beach - or across the Oakland Bay bridge to Berkeley (go to Zachary's for the world's best pizza!). Both trips are about 40 minutes each way. The hotel staff is most helpful They'll book a taxi to the airport, store your bags after you check out, also quick response to problems/issues with your room. For the money, it's a great place to stay!

review.title: Good Hotel
review.reviewText: A good hotel with plenty of space and within walking distance to many tourist interests. One of the only hotels that has queen size beds. This is a well used hotel. It is maintained, and staff are very friendly.

review.title: Good Hotel and Location Only Let Down by Breakfast
review.reviewText: Stayed in July and paid a bit extra for upper rooms with view of the Golden Gate Bridge. Overall very good. rooms clean and comfortable. Reasonable location with easy access to good bus services.Only downside as others have referred to is a breakfast room that is too small for the size of the hotel making it crowded with queues for most things and a struggle to find a table to sit at. Marked down for this fact alone overall.

review.title: Great view,comfortable room
review.reviewText: Great view, very nice room, comfortable beds,very friendly and helpful front desk,breakfast was a bust,came down 40 mim before it shut down and it was packed with people looking for the next open table while the staff of two where trying to clean the buffet tables off looking annoyed when anyone asked them for somthing enjoy the room but dont bother with breakfast

review.title: Average with good location
review.reviewText: Was a good place to stay with good location... about 4 block walk from Fishermans Warf.... parking was a bit tight in the parking deck

review.title: Sure will be going back
review.reviewText: Excellent would stay there again.

review.title: Good place to say
review.reviewText: Good location for walking to the wharf area and Lombard St.; at end of day, we took a taxi home; breakfast was good and helped save some money and I would recommend to get there early, like no later than 7 a.m.; my only complaint was desk staff could be a bit friendlier and helpful; their Internet was down and I needed my boarding passes printed and they wanted me to keep following up to see when the Internet came back up instead of "servicing me" as the customer

review.title: Reasonable Hotel But Expensive Parking
review.reviewText: We used this hotel before on our Honeymoon, and enjoyed it so we came back again. Friendly staff, rooms are not large but are clean & comfortable. Complimentary breakfast is very good, the usual coffee, juice, toast etc. Walking distance to Fishermans Wharf (about 20 minutes) bit steep on the walk back, but that's San Francisco! Parking is safe, but a bit of a squeeze into the spaces & at $25 per day more than a bit expensive.

review.title: Affordable and clean
review.reviewText: Staff was very friendly and the rooms were clean. Nothing special, just a place to sleep, which was exactly what we wanted.

review.title: Overall good experience
review.reviewText: Located at the busy intersection of Lombard and Van Ness, this hotel is a good central location for exploring the city. Walking distance to Ghirardelli Square (5 blocks) and the Marina district. 10-12 Blocks to Fisherman's wharf and Pier 39 - wear comfortable shoes or take a cab. Overall our 3 day stay was enjoyable with one exception - the continental breakfast area could not accomodate the guests due to several tour groups converging every morning around 8:15 AM with only one attendant to keep food stocked and bus the tables.

review.title: Very satisfied
review.reviewText: Stayed for 3 nights at the end of a Panama Canal cruise. Staff very friendly. Room clean and excellent view of the Golden Gate bridge. First day at breakfast at 8.30 was full of schoolchildren on a trip - no spare seats. Next day we went at 7.30 and avoided the crowds! Would definately stay there again.

review.title: Highly Recommended
review.reviewText: Our first time in San Francisco, this hotel could not have been better, rooms very comfy, clean etc, coffe maker with lovely roast coffee, large tv, good hairdryer, iron & board. Breakfast buffet was just as explained and plenty for us. Staff very helpful with recommending trips, and booking them for us. Showing us the best routes on maps etc, this hotel was recommended to us and we will always recommend it too. Great holiday !

review.title: great experience
review.reviewText: We really enjoyed this hotel. It was in a good location. Bus 1 block away and able to walk to many places. The breakfast was good, many choices for a continental breakfast.

review.title: Comfortable Stay
review.reviewText: Staff very helpful and informative, the room was clean and comfortable, free breakfast was good for a lite start to the day; a good hotel for the price and general location. There are limited meal choices nearby the hotel if you do not feel like treking out somewhere to a restaurant after a big day of site seeing, however we found that the In room food delivery service to be particularly good quality. Overall my experience was positive and was consistent with other expedia reviewers.

review.title: Look forward to our next stay.
review.reviewText: My wife and I recently spent 5 days in San Francisco and our hotel felt like a "home away from home". The staff was helpful and the rooms were clean and well maintained. Great location and close to just about everything. We will be coming back.

review.title: Would stay at Comfort Inn Again
review.reviewText: This hotel is conveniently located to city transit and to Fishermans Wharf and the world famous Lombard Street. Our family did alot of walking and remember, San Francisco is full of hills. The staff was very helpful and provided us with all of the information we needed to travel around the city. Our view of the Golden State Bridge was great. The complimentary breakfast was the same every morning. You have to have patience if you want waffles, however, the coffee, cereal, danishes, breads, were all fresh and easy to reach.

review.title: A Fine Place to Stay
review.reviewText: The staff was very helpful.

review.title: Good location with limited service
review.reviewText: We spent a week at this hotel. The breakfast is very limited. I thought we were getting scramble eggs and bacon but none can be found. Instead there were do-yourselves pancakes and breakfast cereals. When it's time for dinner, we could not find any restaurants within 2 blocks from this hotel. Also the first staff we met when we arrived was very friendly, but we never seen her again. Instead she was replaced by one annoying girl who kept repeating to what we said.... annoying indeed. Nevertheless, what I like is it's very close to Fisherman Wharf. You can walk for 10 minutes and you are there!! Also they have Wireless Internet connection in every room. Therefore also great for business people to stay there. Overall not a really bad experience... but we really like to stay in another hotel with better breakfast.

review.title: would definitely come back
review.reviewText: The hotel is a short walk to the main attractions in San Francisco. There are a few restaurants and bars on the same block. Hotel offers free breakfast if you wake up in time.

review.title: Nice - But not too close to Warf
review.reviewText: I enjoyed my stay here. The staff was VERY friendly and helpful. The rooms were clean and my special request were granted. The hotel, though walking distance to the Warf is at the very far far end - it really seemed to far to walk to most locations. Also, the fact that parking was additional was a bit of a negative, though it is a gated garage so I was very comfortable leaving my car there. I personally did not get to see or try any food from the breakfast, but my roomie did; she said it looked very yummy, but they closed it promptly at 9:30 (she only had time to grab a coffee). Overall I would recommend this hotel, it just wasn't as centrally located as I had hoped.

review.title: It was a nice stay
review.reviewText: I found this hotel to be perfect for my trip to SF. It had an excellent breakfast every morning. The room was very clean and well maintained. Without question, I will be back soon.

review.title: Good Location
review.reviewText: Good location. Near bus stops and several resaturants. Clean and comfortable.

review.title: great choice all around
review.reviewText: location was great, breakfast was wonderful! Our rooms were clean and the beds were comfortable. Everyone was helpful and friendly

review.title: would go back
review.reviewText: good location, within walking distance of fisherman's wharf, the staff were very accomodating and we were quite satisfied with everything

review.title: Good base for exploring the city
review.reviewText: We stayed for 5 nights in one of the "bridge view" rooms, 9th floor. The view really was good, and the higher room made it quieter. The free breakfast is OK as a fallback, but there are many excellent cafes and diners, including some with sidewalk tables, within a few blocks, so get out and explore Russian Hill on foot!

review.title: Reasonable and Comfortable
review.reviewText: This particular hotel is in a great location.You are in walking distance to the fisherman's wharf.You are also within miles of the Palace of Fine Arts,China Town, and Ashbury and Haight ST.Also across the street from a Fine Steak House called BoBo's;May I recommand the Filet Mignon and the Mussels.

review.title: absolutely wonderful!
review.reviewText: Comfort Inn by the Bay was everything that we needed and more. The staff were unbelievably helpful with any questions we had. The continental breakfast in the morning was fabulous, especially the waffles! Our room was very comfortable and clean, and the view was stunning. Also, the location of the hotel was perfect because it was a short walk to Fisherman's Wharf and Pier 39, but it was still far enough away that we weren't stuck in the crowds or noise every second of every day. I would without a doubt stay there again next time I am in San Francisco!

review.title: Good location with some drawbacks
review.reviewText: This hotel has a good location if you are planning to see Fisherman Wharf and Golden Gate bridge. That's all the good stuff. Continental breakfast is limited with do-yourself pancakes. Hotel guests always line up to get the pancakes. Front desk staff are varies in terms of services. Some are helpful and the rests are unpolite with foreigners. The last most important thing, the price we paid is about average for a comfort inn hotel. But service is almost the same with the one you found next to a highway.

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: Great location, close to everything

review.title: Great Experience
review.reviewText: Just an overall very pleasant time, with constant attention given to us by the staff ensuring our stay was meeting our expectations.

review.title: Great place to stay! Repeat customer!
review.reviewText: My 4th or 5th visit and will continue to stay here when in SF. Clean, comfortable, quiet, very reasonable for the city. Nice breakfast, but don't be late! Nice walk to Embarcadero, Ghiradelli Square, Pier 39. 2 blocks to famous Lombard Street. Pleasant and accommodating staff. Parking is pricey, but secure.

review.title: DONT STAY WHEN IT RAINS
review.reviewText: THIS HOTEL WAS IN A GREAT AREA AND THE STAFF WAS FRIENDLY. BUT THE WALL PAPER WAS PEELING DUE TO LEAKS WHEN IT RAINS. WE COMPLAINED AND AS USUAL "WE CANNOT DO ANYTHING ABOUT IT". YES THESE PLACES CAN DO SOMETHING ABOUT IT, THEY JUST DONT WANT TO. GET A ROOM ON THE SOUTH SIDE OF HOTEL NOT THE NORTH. OTHER THAN THAT IT WAS A VERY NICE PLACE TO STAY.

review.title: i like that hotel
review.reviewText: the hotel is great, but the parking fee is $26 per night.

review.title: Great location and reasonable pricing
review.reviewText: Heating/cooling system was way outdated, noisy and slow; no small refrigerator in the room for the price of the room and for the hot weather is unacceptable

review.title: Price is right ($98 + taxes) for the location & condition of hotel.
review.reviewText: If looking for a place to stay for sleeping & showering in Downtown SF then this is very good. Bad points - very, very tight parking garage but it is an old building. The free breakfast is a nice gesture but closing @ 9:30 on the weekends is much too early.

review.title: Great Hotel for the Money
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a great location to get anywhere. Walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf. Room was comfortable, staff was helpful with directions and use of municipal transportation. Breakfast was a good deal.

review.title: Like the hotel but not the staff performance
review.reviewText: This is the complaint I wrote to Choice Hotels: During our stay there was a fire in the room directly above ours (802 and we were in 702). We were not at the hotel at the time and were unaware of the problem. We returned to our room later to find it literally raining in our room. We should have received a phone call to let us know of the problem considering when we checked in we were asked for a phone number to contact us in case of an emergency...and I would say all of our belongings being rained on and then sitting in dirty water would constitute an emergency. I am extremely unhappy with the lack of communication and consideration. Obviously I would not expect this phone call to happen during the fire but sometime soon thereafter would have been appropriate. Had we known we would have returned to the hotel sooner and collected our things before they were completely soaked and filthy.

review.title: Nice location, but service was not too good.
review.reviewText: Unfriendly service and overcharged parking.

review.title: Will not be my destination next time in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Parking extremely tight Helpdesk personel rude, not knowledgeable of the neighborhood and not willing to help. The fire alarm went off on our floor. It was not a fire but a problem with a sprinkler. They took about 30 min to stop the alarm. The elevator is slow and not working properly. The door will crunch you if you try to stop it. Not my destination next time in San Francisco.

review.title: Parking is tight!
review.reviewText: The hotel is a good distance from the waterfront and wharf area, but walkable if the weather is warm and you have strong legs. Otherwise, a car is highly recommended, but parking is pricy at $26/day -- and the garage is SUPER TIGHT -- no large SUV's or trucks will fit easily here. Its an average hotel, good for a family on the cheap, though the breakfast bar was also jammed packed when we went through and had to wait a while for a waffle machine.

review.title: Good deal, good location
review.reviewText: Great location, if don't mind walking a little. Only a 25 minute walk to Alcatraz tour, 15 minutes to the Wharf, 15 minutes to Trader Joes (groceries), 25 minutes to the Exploratorium. Free breakfast a bonus. Staff very friendly and helpful. They offer a small map to help you navigate through the city. Only complaint is noise from traffic can be heard at night from room. Our room was not facing the road either.

review.title: certainly not the best comfort inn we have stayed in when in the usa.
review.reviewText: well away from amenities like starbucks and restaurants to eat in, extremely tight parking, some staff members lacked good customer skills

review.title: Value for money
review.reviewText: We booked this hotel based on reviews on hotels at the cheaper end of the scale and were not disappointed. Whilst not luxurious, it was clean, near to the Wharf whilst on transport routes to elsewhere, and the staff were very friendly and helpful. Had we been less jet-lagged we might have missed the lack of hotel bar - but the ice machine was free for providing your own.

review.title: for the money it was ok, but greeting at the desk was not impressive.
review.reviewText: The rooms were Ok, they were furnished fairly well and the bathrooms were clean also. The room temperature was ok and the lighting was ok. The were not as spacious as seen in there brocher,but Ok. Bed were very good to rest on and the bathrooms lack celling fans to exhaust the steam from it, but all in all it was a place for the price in San Francisco was Ok.

review.title: Good hotel in a good location
review.reviewText: We stayed at the Comfort Inn for 6 nights. It was very clean and comfortable, the breakfast was great, the location very good. Lombard Street was across the road and Fishermans Warf only a short walk. The public transport service was excellent and the old trams are a wonderful and inexpensive way to get around. If you were born to shop jump on a tram to Market Srteet where you'll be surrounded by fabulous shops! We would definately return to San Francisco and the Comfort Inn.

review.title: Very helpful staff!
review.reviewText: Room was average, but the front desk staff was better than any I have encountered. Friendly and knowledgable. A+

review.title: Would return readily
review.reviewText: Staff was friendly and kind. The breakfast was good and offered choices and kept meal costs down with the elimination of one meal spent out. Good location. Walking distance to everything. Good view of the Golden gate. Busy street however we were so tired by the end of the day the traffic didn't wake us.

review.title: Not luxury but certainly very comfortable
review.reviewText: Friendly staff. Breakfast included. Make your own waffles. We had a room on the 6th floor with a view to the Bridge and two queen size beds for just two of us. 10 minutes walk to Fisherman's Wharf and buses passing the door. No bar or restaurant but plenty places nearby.

review.title: Not Impressed
review.reviewText: After reading the reviews before scheduling my trip... I figured this hotel would be a nice place to stay! Overall not bad! Great customer service. Very kind people! Room was a bit dated and could use some extra cleaning. The view was there, not great! The parking is very tight! If you have a larger vehicle (like our SUV), be sure to be have a really driver with you. The parking structure was built in the 70's, and is really tight! Really, really, tight! Distance to the wharf and Pier 39 attractions - not really walking distance unless you leave the kids at home! ( and don't mind walking for an hour one way! ) Honestly, I would have rather stayed closer to the Piers or downtown and paid a bit more! Since the hotel parking was $26 per day and then outside parking fees when you drive around town!

review.title: good location and price
review.reviewText: very friendly, helpful staff. good continental breakfast. lots of things to do and see within walking distance.

review.title: Good location and Great Staff
review.reviewText: The hotel room size is actually quite large for SFO standards, however it's in need of serious updating. The hotel is easy to get to since it's right off the 101, so you don't have to drive into the city to find it. It's also really close to public transit and Fisherman's Warf. The staff was extremely helpful and accomodating, the best I've had at a chain hotel.

review.title: Comfort Inn by the bay
review.reviewText: This hotel had the most comfortable bed I've ever slept in. My husband felt the same way.

review.title: not too little, not too much....
review.reviewText: front desk staff very helpful and kind the only thing i didnt like; no fridge in the room, so i couldnt have any leftovers of the amazing food in San Francisco.

review.title: Satisfactory
review.reviewText: This hotel was clean, included a continental breakfast and the beds were very comfortable. It is in a convenient location. For the price, though, it wasn't as nice as expected.

review.title: Great Place To Stay
review.reviewText: Comfort Inn by the Bay, Was very reasonably price, and great location. Staff very friendly. Rooms were clean and comfortable. We suggest you get a room that views Golden Gate Bridge. Parking fee a little steep! at $26.00 a day. But overall we would stay again, and would definitely recommend to others.

review.title: Bay View
review.reviewText: The view included the Golden Gate Bridge-awesome.

review.title: Great affordable bay view
review.reviewText: Great hotel for the price- continental breakfast left much to be desired especially seating but it was free. Nice clean comfortable rooms with a great expansive window view of the bay and goldne gate bridge. Within walking distance of everything you need to see while in San Francisco!

review.title: Not bad
review.reviewText: This is a pretty typical Comfort Inn. It costs more than your average Comfort Inn without providing extra amenities...except that the location is an amenity. This is a good deal compared to what else is available in the area. It is walking distance to & from the bay & even Chinatown. I would stay here again.

review.title: Good value for 2 star
review.reviewText: A good hotel for budget travellers who just want somewhere to sleep.Busy road outside although we did not find any problem with the noise.Good location for Fishermans wharf and a couple of blocks from a cable car stop at Lombard and Hyde.

review.title: Nice view of the Golden Gate
review.reviewText: We were on the 6th floor and had a great view of the Golden Gate bridge. The room was nice and clean, although the bathroom was small and could have done with a bit more ventilation - the bath and shower curtain looked a bit mouldy/grubby. Breakfast buffet was nice with tea/coffee, bagels and cereal available. The location was great - just a short walk from the Wharf and all its restaurants and attractions. We would stay there again.

review.title: Great value for the price!
review.reviewText: This hotel exceeded my expectations of a value hotel. The location was not too far from Fisherman's Warf (about a 10-15 minute walk). The hotel was clean, comfortable and the staff was friendly and very helpful. The continental breakfast buffet had a good variety: waffles, bagels, english muffins, hard boiled eggs, cereal, oatmeal and fresh fruit. My only compliant would be for them to include bananas. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who is traveling to the city and is looking for affordable lodging.

review.title: let down by cups
review.reviewText: The hotel was very good, we had a good view of the bridge and the bay, it was within easy walking distance of Fisherman's Wharf and all attractions, BUT, although we had proper glasses for cold drinks, we had polystyrene beakers for hot, this we feel was a let down in the standard, otherwise it was absolutely great.

review.title: Everything I was looking for
review.reviewText: I spent a 3-day getaway in San Francisco, Just me and my 2 year old. (I'm 6 months pregnant.) I was looking for a reasonably priced, really clean hotel that was located within reasonable walking distance of lots of things to do and see, and this was it! It's a short walk to Fisherman's Wharf and the bus stop is right across the street. The make-your-own waffles at breakfast were great, too. I'd definitely stay here again.

review.title: I will use them again,
review.reviewText: the staff was helpful, and freindly Mrs Sarah, was a very nice lady asset to your company.

review.title: Looking to return next year!
review.reviewText: Personnel were very helpful & polite. Room very clean & had a wonderful view! Walking distance to Pier. Taxi service was quick.

review.title: Location, Price, Location
review.reviewText: Typical hotel decor, nothing fancy but very clean. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Get to the breakfast early or it becomes quite busy. Great location, short 10 minute walk to the Wharf. Close to bus stops. Would definitely stay here again, can't beat the price and location. Hotel should inform (put sign up at front desk) guests of clean air days when the transit system is free.

review.title: Convenient location
review.reviewText: The hotel was clean and walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf area. The complimentary continental breakfast in the hotel was very convenient, but to beat the rush get there before 8:30am.

review.title: OK Hotel
review.reviewText: The rooms were small but comfortable. If you want to take advantage of the complementary breakfast you have to fight for a table; it is very busy. Good location for the price and public transportation was very close and easy to use.

review.title: Advertised Services Lacking
review.reviewText: This hotel is located fairly near Fort Mason Park, Ghiradelli Square and Fisherman's Wharf. It's also near a few MUNI bus lines that can access you to various points in the city. That said, certain levels of service were wanting. There wasn't any public internet access as listed in their services. The monitor has a dusty note scotch-taped to the screen. Breakfast supposedly ends at 9:30 a.m. but the staff is busy taking away food at 9 a.m. There is hardly enough seating and food too even if you arrive at 7:00 a.m. Also the fare offered had nothing healthy to choose from except if you count a mountain of hard-boiled eggs and stale apples. No bananas or yogurt? The hotel is adequate and no frills, which is fine but the breakfast situation really turned me off and we stayed there for 8 days, and it was always the same. Then to have a nerve to try to charge 2 dollars a day for use of the room-safe, when it wasn't used because we didn't see one put me off from honestly recommending this place.

review.title: Comfort Inn By The Bay - good place to stay
review.reviewText: We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights (6-10 august), after having booked it through expedia. Getting the car to the hotel was a bit of a challenge, as there is a 'no left turn' rule on the road running along its parking area. After getting there (a few right turns equal a left ;) ), check in was a breeze. Parking isn't cheap, at $26 + tax per night, but hey, at least the car's in a secure parking structure. You're not guaranteed a parking spot, but we had no trouble finding one. The room was very nice, with 2 beds, and a view of the bay. The Golden Gate bridge, while not exactly nearby, could be clearly seen from our room. Very nice. There's some traffice noise, but nothing disturbing. Breakfast was really nice, with DIY waffles, cereal (hot/cold), fruit, bagels, juice, coffee/tea, etc. Seating can be a problem, as there aren't enough places for everyone to sit. The hotel is located perfectly for just about any daily activity - walking distance from Fisherman's Wharf, close by a bus stop for going a bit farther away. Look into a multi-day MUNI passport - it'll save you some cash! Recommended hotel - we'd certainly go back again!

review.title: generally satisfied
review.reviewText: The hotel room was what we expected, with a decent continental breakfast. The hotel had a good location, within walking distance to north beach and fisherman's wharf. The hotel service was not very friendly though. I would recommend this hotel.

review.title: Good Comfortable Place
review.reviewText: Comfort Inn By the Bay was very reasonably priced. It was in a great location-only a few blocks away from Ghiradelli Square and Fisherman's Wharf. The hotel room was very clean and comfortable. Even the beds were very soft. Overall a great place to stay in San Francisco.

review.title: Fantastic hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel was one of the best that I have stayed at. Our family vacations two to four times per year, this hotel, staff, and service was impecable.sending chocolate covered strawberries for my daughter's birthday was going above and beyond. It was wonderful!

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: This was our first trip to SF and were not sure if we picked a good place to stay. It turns out the location of the hotel was perfect for what we wanted to do. One short block down Van Ness, we were able to catch the bus to Fisherman's Warf. Three blocks down Lombard, we could get the bus to the Golden Gate Bridge. Also running down Van Ness was the bus that took us straight to Union Square. Walking to Fisherman's Warf also was quite do-able.

review.title: Not so good
review.reviewText: parking at this hotel is the worst I have ever seen , It took 3 point turns to navigate all corners and turning around was nearly immpossible. Inside our room we have torn curtains to stare at. The one blessing would have to be the ststaff are very nice people

review.title: Good location for price
review.reviewText: Good view of bridge and short walk to Fisherman's wharf. Good value for price.

review.title: An affordable stay
review.reviewText: nice hotel good location but had mold problems in room.nice view of golden gate bridge. Hotel staff exceptional in helping with questions and reservations for tours.offered a decent breakfast

review.title: Will definately stay here again.
review.reviewText: This little gem is a 10 minute walk from fisherman's wharf, is comfortable, clean and safe. The people were very friendly, even accomodating us when our plans suddenly changed. Great views of the city too! One extra-it is across the street from a cute little bar that allows smoking-a huge plus if you would like to have a beer and a cig. (getting very hard to find in this day and age-frustrating for those who spend just as much money on vacation!). All in all, great place-we'll stay here again.

review.title: A bit farther from Fisherman's Wharf than expected
review.reviewText: Decent hotel and location, but not as close to Fisherman's Wharf as expected. Walking everywhere was what we like to do, but may be a bit far for some folks. Be sure to check out the restaurants and bars around Filmore and Chestnut streets!

review.title: As it says on the tin
review.reviewText: The Comfort Inn By the Bay did exactly what it said on the tin. The hotel was well placed for a short walk to Fishermans Warf and the surrounding areas. The room was comfortable and clean with friendly and helpful staff. I would highly recommend this hotel to someone on a budget.

review.title: Good location!
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay at Comfort Inn. The front desk was always very helpful and pleasant!! It was in walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf, and the kids enjoyed seeing the Goldengate Bridge from our room window.

review.title: Good for the Price
review.reviewText: Hotel was clean and well kept. Room was comfortable and clean. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was good Hotel is within walking distance to the wharf area. Overall experience was good.

review.title: A pretty decent place to stay
review.reviewText: This hotel will meet your expectations if they're not too high. The service was good, the room clean and the location was convenient. The free breakfast was decent (I loved the homemade waffle feature) Overall a good experience...five star? No But a good place to stay if you don't require a lot of bells and whistles...

review.title: bypass the continental breakfast
review.reviewText: the hotel is centrally located. you can walk to some of the hot spots or use the terrific public transportation. room was very clean and i slept like a baby in the very comfortable bed with actual fluffy pillows. the hotel's downfall is their hyped breakfast which is nothing to brag about at all.

review.title: Would definitely stay here again.
review.reviewText: This hotel was close to everything. We didn't have a vehicle and were able to walk to cable car, bus stop, Fishermans Wharf, Ghirardelli Square, Polk Street, and to restaurants with no problem. Staff were extremely friendly and helpful. We were on 8th Floor and had an excellent view of Bay and Golden Gate Bridge. Continental breakfast was pretty good but need to get to it either very early or near when it stops as it gets busy and there is no where to sit. Will definitely stay here again when visiting San Francisco.

review.title: great views good location
review.reviewText: Recommend high floor bay view..........Very helpful staff.........Limited but great breakfast.....Comfortable clean rooms great value for money

review.title: Very Nice Affordable Hotel
review.reviewText: The Comfort Inn by the Bay was a very clean and well run Hotel. I would highly reccomend this Hotel if you are looking for an affordable yet well positioned Hotel.

review.title: Good value for the money
review.reviewText: The hotel staff were friendly and helpful. The hotel is wonderfully situated. A short 10 minute walk to Fisherman's warf and Pier 39 and all they have to offer (cable caqrs, tours, restaurants, shopping etc.). MUNI bus stops are a block away in either direction making it very easy to get around. We would definitely stay there again.

review.title: i will be back to san francisco i fall in love with the city
review.reviewText: i would recomended this hotel to anyone, i will be back to the same hotel if i go back to san francisco, it was clean, the staff superfriendly, the breakfast was good , the location was excellent , the bed and pillow were good (everything about the hotel was fine.

review.title: Nice
review.reviewText: This hotel was just fine for our family. Free Internet and continental breakfast, and not too far from Fisherman's Warf and the crooked street.

review.title: Would certainly go back!
review.reviewText: Good location close to most tourist attractions. Clean comfortable room. Good continental breakfast provided but no other restaurant facilities. We were very satisfied.......but wish San Francisco were not so hilly!

review.title: Good Hotel for the Price
review.reviewText: Great location - convenient to Fisherman's Warf, Union Street Shops, Russian Hill, and only 2 blocks away from cable car stop. Rooms were very small, but clean.

review.title: I recommend this hotel
review.reviewText: My husband and I were very happy with our stay at this hotel. The front desk staff were very helpful, friendly, and knowledgable. They were especially helpful when we needed to know which buses to take for trips that were not in walking distance. Ghiradelli Square and Hyde Pier were quite close. Fisherman's Wharf was walkable for us as well, even with me being 6 months pregnant. We felt this hotel was in a nice location. The continental breakfast was also convenient. It offered basic choices to get your morning started...cereal, waffles, english muffins, muffins, fruit, etc.

review.title: Not impressed with the Comfort Inn by the Bay
review.reviewText: I was not impressed with the Comfort Inn by the Bay in San Francisco on my recent stay there. Two things come to mind: 1) every vending machine on every floor seemed to be broken and the staff was unconcerned about getting them fixed 2) the maids only seemed to want to clean my room when I was in it even though I spent hours of every day sightseeing. It was a problem about the vending machines since it was warm and I really missed being able to get a cold drink when I needed one. Regarding the maid service, one time I was kept waiting in the lobby for and hour and a half until they finished with my room! On my depature day, they wanted to clean my room at 9 am even though I had until noon to check out. I felt rushed into leaving for the airport early because they wanted to clean the room. Definitely not my favorite hotel stay.

review.title: Convenient location, your basic lodging at a fair price
review.reviewText: This hotel is conveniently located and has good access to all directions of interest in and around the bay area. Courtious and friendly staff, basic amenities and rooms but good for the price. Easy walking distance to the Warf and public transportation. A bit steep on their parking garage charges but was safe parking.

review.title: Would stay again
review.reviewText: Comfort Inn by the Bay was the nicest hotel I've stayed in. The room was small but the time spent in it was very minimal. They had a great continental breakfast, which for me was a full breakfast. I would diffinitely stay here again and recommend this hotel to others. Short walk to Fisherman's Wharf,Cable Cars and on bus line. Hotel personal very friendly and helpful.

review.title: Good spot for the price
review.reviewText: This hotel was a good value. Don't let the view fool you...if you get this over the internet at the good price you will not get the view advertised. Otherwise the breakfast was good and had a variety available. The beds were comfortable with a variety of pillows available. Hotel is at least 7 long blocks from the center of the wharf area.

review.title: Not bad for the Price
review.reviewText: This hotel was more than what i had expected. They were friendly and accomadating. The check in was quick and swift. If you came in early they would hold your luggage for you until check in time. so you could go exploring until then. The rooms were adaquate sizes and comfortable. The maids came in everyday to clean. The location was great. Fisherman's wharf was about 15 minutes walk away and the you have the bus stops right there. You do have to walk quite a distance tho for resturants, but its not that bad. The breakfast was fine...with waffles and bagels, cerals and hard boiled eggs. WHat more could you need. It was more than enough. I would definetly come back to this hotel. Oh and the views were nice if you got the upper floor levels.

review.title: Very Good Choice
review.reviewText: It was worth the money. Friendly, helpful staff. Within walking distance too the Wharf. I would stay here again.

review.title: Parking
review.reviewText: The only negative thing to say is that when we called to confirm our reservation we were not told how much parking would cost. The price was standard for the area but we would like to have been forwarned.

review.title: Good choice
review.reviewText: Room was clean, bathroom small. Staff was friendly and helpful. Breakfast was good. Close to attractions. Parking is pricey. I would stay here again.

review.title: Wonderful hotel, abyssmal parking.
review.reviewText: I thoroughly enjoyed my 3 night stay at this hotel. The beds were wonderful, pillows soft, rooms clean. The staff paid attention to the do not disturb sign when it was on the door. My only complaint concerns the parking. If you do not have a rental car, or your own means of transportation, this is an excellent hotel. If, however, you are attempting to utilize the 'catacomb parking' offered at this hotel you had best be a stunt driver, or have someone with you that can leave the vehicle and aid you with hand signals while parking. Between the cramped confines of the subterranean parking, and the earthquake columns that dot those levels, turning is nigh impossible in a mid-size car. I hesitate to wonder at how the one mini-van I saw during my 3 night stay got into a parking space, much less out of it and returned to the surface world.

review.title: Great Place To Stay
review.reviewText: Great location - walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf, Pier 39 and cable cars. Rooms are neat and clean; however, the bathrooms are quite small-but very clean. Public transportation is easily accessible, just cross the street! Hotel staff were very friendly and knowledgeable.

review.title: Wonderful stay
review.reviewText: Knowledgeable, helpful and friendly front desk staff. Very good continential breakfast. Clean rooms. Very enjoyable stay.

review.title: Good views and location -- but ...
review.reviewText: Great location at Lombard and Van Ness in San Francisco -- we had an eighth-floor room with a view of the bay and the Golden Gate Bridge, and we love Polk Street nearby. Near several vital bus lines as well, and not far from Fisherman's Wharf or North Beach. Only problem was noise -- especially from the adjoining room next door (one child decided to check the shared door -- at 12:30 a.m.) Front-desk staff very pleasant and helpful.

review.title: Great value
review.reviewText: Finally, a hotel that actually has strong wireless internet service in the rooms! Great value, good location, nice rooms. Only problem was a noisy group of kids who happened to be staying there on the same night....

review.title: Location, location, location
review.reviewText: This was a great bargain for the price, and a clean, comfortable stay. Having been pre-warned that rooms with a view of the Bay are noisy, and the quiet ones have no view, we asked for a quiet room and did our sight-seeing on our ventures around the area. We found the staff helpful, friendly and efficient, and the included breakfast provided a good choice of hot and cold offerings in an unusually large and attractive room. The location is the real prize with this hotel; most of the San Francisco sights we wanted to take in were within walking distance and there are plenty of excellent restaurants and nightlife spots in the area.

review.title: Will go back again
review.reviewText: This is my second stay at this hotel, I have stayed at other hotels in San Francisco that were 4 stars, but for the price and being by the wharf this can't be beat. It was very clean, the continental breakfast a plus, and with San Francisco's great mass transportation choices why drive? Walking distance of several Muni lines, that connect to get you all over the city. When checking in though, I gave my visa to clerk for billing after my stay in case of incidentals not my Expedia payment, she accidently charged the stay that was prepaid to my account, as soon as I found out and let the staff know, they took care of it immediately, called my visa customer service and had the charge taken off, with a great apology for the inconvenience. I was fully satisfied with my stay, will be back.

review.title: Overpriced
review.reviewText: With parking costs this hotel is not a value relative to others in the same area. And the parking is an inconvenience as well.

review.title: Friendly and Excellent Value
review.reviewText: Friendly staff, easy access to transporation, clean hotel, great price. Only problem we had was vending machines didn't work.

review.title: Not Impressed
review.reviewText: Bay view is nice, if you have binoculars. Street noise is atrocious and happens 24/7...could not sleep. Had an issue with the room and on-duty manager treated us poorly. Be careful when you read "within walking distance of the wharf"...if you don't mind walking about 15 blocks--up hill coming back. Use the Muni bus...much easier.

review.title: Great hotel, minutes from Pier 39
review.reviewText: Stayed on the Bay view side. Was fantastic..you could see Golden Gate Bridge.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: Very noisy, lots of street noise 24/7. Needs major redecorating, the room looks as it hasn't seen new draperies, bedspreads or wallpaper since the early 90's. Bathroom tub not very clean, had to call housekeeping several times. Very helpful front desk staff.

review.title: Good value
review.reviewText: The room was pretty clean and confortable, the breakfast was nice, and the its location was also reasonable. The people on the front desk was not that friendly though. In the end, a good option to stay in San Francisco.

review.title: Very Impressed
review.reviewText: I really thought this hotel was a good deal. The staff were excellent in helping us newcomers to the city. It was a good price and decent location to everything. Would recommed to anyone.

review.title: Impressed with the view from the 10th floor rooms overlooking the Golden Gate Bridge. Very Clean.
review.reviewText: The Hotel was fine the only issue might be parking if the hotel lot is full.

review.title: Buy New Pillows
review.reviewText: Great area to stay. Away from hustle and bustle, but close to bus stops. Hot waffles for breakfast every morning was my favorite. Staff very willing to help. They need to invest in pillows badly.

review.title: Comfort Inn by the Bay
review.reviewText: The room had 2 queen beds and a view. We weren't in the room long enough to enjoy any of the view, and it was a side view (a little deceiving). I wouldn't have added that the room had a 'view.' The bathroom was very, very, very small, a toilet and tub. It was a reasonable room for the 3 days we were there. Continental breakfast was nice. I would stay there again. It was close to the Wharf, right on a bus line and yet within walking distance. The service of the hotel staff was outstanding. They were all very professional and very friendly, helpful with directions and suggestions of what to do/where to go. Highly recommended.

review.title: Great location. Would stay again.
review.reviewText: Clean, good location, staff helpful, breakfast a plus. Be aware that if you park car in their garage it is an extra $25 a day.

review.title: would highly recommend!!!
review.reviewText: if you are looking for a clean hotel that is at a great location between many neighborhoods, this is a great place to stay! rooms are clean, beds are comfortable. Free breakfast in morning is wonderful, featuring everything from waffles to fruit and cereal. It is a quiet hotel and the buslines run right in front of the building. Staff was friendly and helpful.

review.title: Plan to return in future
review.reviewText: I recently stayed at the Comfort Inn By the Bay on vacation. My bay view room was more than I expected. Most mornings I had an excellent view of the Golden Gate Bridge and the Bay. Also, I was only a few blocks from Aquatic park, an excellent place to have coffee and view the bay and the parade of people along the promenade. When I return to San Francisco someday I will definitely give this hotel another look.

review.title: Awesome
review.reviewText: Really nice hotel! I'm a clean freak and everything was to my expectations. It was also within walking distance to Fisherman's Warf, Ghirardelli Square(about 4-5 blocks or so). BUT, the walk back to the hotel is up hill. It's also close to the section of Lombard St that is famous for its tight curves! Really cool place all around!

review.title: Great place to stay and save a few bucks
review.reviewText: If you don't mind walking a couple of blocks to the Wharf/Aquatic Park, this is a great place to stay. It's a bit further to Pier 39, but who cares if you're saving a few bucks.

review.title: Basic hotel with bad beds and pillows
review.reviewText: The hotel overall is ok, basic for what you pay taking in consideration breakfast and internet for free. The rooms and the bathroom are very small. The major problem was the bed and the pillows. Really..really bad. I have back problems and still trying to recuperate.

review.title: Kind of dumpy, but you get what you pay for.
review.reviewText: Kind of dumpy, but you get what you pay for. Looking for a cheap sleep.

review.title: San Francisco was nice to visit, but expensive.
review.reviewText: The reason I would not recomend this hotel is because you have to pay extra for parking in their underground parking lot. The Continental Breakfast was nothing to brag about. The first room they put us in was a small and a smoking room, I had asked for a non-smoking room. Once they moved us we had a better room with a view of the Golden Gate Bridge and the Bay.

review.title: Great Hotel.
review.reviewText: The comfort inn by the bay was an excellent decision. We didn't want to spend a ton of money on a hotel and were willing to sacrifice quality for location. We were expecting to have marginal service and an OK room, but were excited to find that the room was in excelent condition and very clean. It was perfect for a vacation in which we slept there and rested there, but were mostly out seeing the sites. I would recomend this hotel to families, and vacationers alike.

review.title: Good value, location, and overall comfort
review.reviewText: Attractions are within easy bus distance from the hotel, as the bus line is 1 block away. The property is well maintained, clean rooms and pleasant staff. I travelled with a child and felt safe in the hotel. The complimentary continental is a bonus as it saves a considerable amount of money in this city.

review.title: Great bargain in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Clean, convenient and with a great view of the Golden Gate Bridge. We would definately stay with them again.

review.title: Conveniently located
review.reviewText: At first we were slightly disappointed to the size of the room (we had one overlooking the bay), and the size of the bath room. But room was clean, nice decor, and beds very comfortable. There was no laundry facility in the building, but within walking distance. Other than the issues mentioned above, the rest was great! We loved the free breakfast in the morning, but the restaurant would get crowded fast, so plan to be there early. The fact that the hotel was located within a bus ride to the main attractions. Buses are cheap and very convenient. You can also get rental car discounted rates for staying in this hotel, just ask the front desk. I believe we paid about $32 per day. Can't beat that anywhere. Though we thought we could have gotten a better deal when we first arrived, once we saw other places around the area, we thought we were lucky to be able to get all that and with a bunus view of the bay.

review.title: Extremely friendly employees
review.reviewText: This is not a luxury hotel, but the rooms are clean, the view is great, and the hotel staff is extremely friendly and helpful.

review.title: Not a bad place to stay
review.reviewText: Close to everything. Nice continental complimentary breakfast. The parking fees are over the top and the rooms could use a little updating. But not a bad experience.

review.title: a good value hotel
review.reviewText: we only spent 1 day in San Fran and this hotel was adequate for our needs. walking distance to the wharf without staying in the middle of tourist mayhem. the room was nothing fancy, very basic, but well worth it for the budget cost. perfect for a short stay!

review.title: Multi-national atmosphere
review.reviewText: About 6 blocks from Fisherman's Wharf, this hotel has many tourist guests from outside the U.S. The included continental breakfast was a chance to hear French, Spanish, Russian and other languages, as well as British, Australian, and New Zealand accents. One block from nearest bus stop, 3 (steep!) blocks from "Crookedest Street". Fast elevators when not stopping frequently, but no interior stairs were evident. Our room was OK but the AC unit was not top-drawer and the shower water temp was a bit touchy.

review.title: great buget hotel. We'll go back for sure!
review.reviewText: We had great time staying here. The staff was frienldy and very helpful with directions and place to see. We whwere lucky enough to get a front office person who, at check in, was able to move us to a more suitable room. We so appreicated that! We love to walk, so the location was great. When we return to San Fran we will always consider this hotel!

review.title: Not worth the price.
review.reviewText: Walls were paper-thin. The couple arguing in the next room sounded like they were in our room, making it impossible to sleep. No refrigerator. Standing-room-only in the breakfast buffet. A rather long walk from the Embarcadero and Fisherman's Wharf. I expected more for three times the usual Comfort Inn rates.

review.title: Good value
review.reviewText: We used this hotel as a base to explore San Francisco. Location is fairly central and there is a good bus route into town. Staff were friendly and gave us some recommendations for dinner. Only downside was breakfast as you had to get down early for a seat!

review.title: Love that city
review.reviewText: Staff was very helpful and the rooms, very comfortable. the breakfasts were conveinient and we loved the service.

review.title: Convenient location. Would definately stay there again!
review.reviewText: This hotel was a good "bang for the buck". It was only 4-5 blocks from the hustle & bustle of Fisherman's Wharf...3 blocks (yes, uphill ones) from the crockest street and was very convenient to get to and from. We upgraded to the bay view room and it was nice to wake up to..depends if you are planning on spending much time in the room for benefit. Breakfast was ok, but not the best I've seen. Busy place for good reason...central location to get to tourist attractions and yet easy to navigate to and from as you go out of town. This is not an extravagant, overly-frilly hotel, but it certainly is clean, comfortable & conveniently located! Staff was genuine and willing to offer advice as needed.

review.title: Good value, good location
review.reviewText: It's tough to find a decent hotel in a decent San Francisco neighborhood at a good price. This one fits the bill--walking distance to the trolley, Fisherman's Wharf, and other attractions, rooms small but clean and well appointed, courteous staff,and parking at a reasonable price.

review.title: a pleasant surprise
review.reviewText: For the price, I couldn't have been more relieved when we arrived for our overnight stay. The room was very clean and comfortable. Smoking is allowed in some areas, so there is a smell of smoke in some common areas. The views were pretty and the location was easy for getting around town. Morning breakfast can be chaotic, so go early and be sure to make your own waffle....my family couldn't get over this fun treat. It was perfect for our brief stay. The garage is very hard to manuever around so don't rent a big car if you don't need to, but they did let us remain in there all day even after check out at no extra charge!

review.title: Good hotel but
review.reviewText: Hotel was nice but: 1)Parking atrocious as is usually the case in San Francisco. 2)I thought it would be closer to the wharf. Had a 20 minute walk to get the oceanfront. 3) I didn't read the fine print and was not guaranteed a nonsmoking room. The floor we were on was for smokers and room had slight smoke odor (My eyes burned all the time we were in room.

review.title: Very Impressed, but not with the piped in music
review.reviewText: My wife and I were very impressed with everything in the hotel, except the piped in music that was heard in the lobby and the dining area everyday,all day. The piped in music was all "classical old English" music, with it seems like nothing but violins playing. Not only did we not care for it, but many other people we spoke with felt the same. Something like soft rock, soft jazz, soft vocals would've sounded better, with maybe a variety of singers like Tony Bennett, Frank Sinatra, Hary Connick, Jr. Vicki Carr, The Carpenters, etc. This type of music would appeal to different tastes and would be soft and enjoyable.
