Not only my wife and I, but some others we talked with, thought the "old classical English" music that was playing constantly was enough to drive people "nuts".That is our only complaint; everything else about the hotel was excellent.

review.title: Good hotel for the price
review.reviewText: Was not too impressed with the view our original room offered, brought it to the attention of the manager and as the hotel was almost at capacity, all he could offer that was non-smoking was a room with only one bed 5 floors up. Ordered a roll-away which was OK for a small child. The toilet was not in working order, but maintenance was at our door within 5 minutes and problem was solved.

review.title: I would love to go back
review.reviewText: The people at the front desk in the hotel are very friendly . They help me in several issue.

review.title: Just make sure...
review.reviewText: The location of the hotel was great; close enough to Fisherman's Wharf, and restaurants on Van Ness. Breakfast was nice, too, unlike some hotels that only serve stale danishes and weak coffee. The staff was helpful. The only thing we didn't like was the LACK of view from our room. Out window opened up to a staircase. We asked the front desk if they could move to a better room, even if we had to pay more, but they couldn't/didn't. So if you're staying here, just make sure you don't get the rooms that overlook a staircase! Also, the rooms were a bit small, especially for us. We had our two boys with us.

review.title: good located
review.reviewText: the hotel is very comfortable and good located , the only thing that is expensive is the parking 28.95 per night (parking in san francisco is expensive everywhere) and there are not enough parkings for every room, but at least it has its own parking. staff was very friendly and breakfast was fine, good you can take it up to your room.

review.title: An economical place to stay
review.reviewText: Our rooms were small but clean, we were able to get side by side roooms as requested and they were truly non-smoking!! Staff was pleasant and courteous, breakfast was great - make sure to get there early or late as the room fills up fast. Beware of the parking garage it is a tight fit. Location is great, within walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf and on several good bus lines that take you to all the tourist spots. We had a pleasant stay.

review.title: average hotel
review.reviewText: average little hotel in SF... Walking distance to the beach, parking additional money... Will try another next time.

review.title: Staff was very helpful in directions, etc.
review.reviewText: This was a very convenient place to stay although we picked the city view we had a great view of the Golden Gate Bridge. The staff was very helpful in directions, etc. The breakfast was not that great and could improve and the parking garage was very tight and hard to get in and out other than that I would definitely stay again and will recommend to others, best deal for the dollar!

review.title: Would definitely stay again
review.reviewText: Very clean and comfortable (we had the deluxe queen room). Location was good, right on a bus line that takes you to Fisherman's Wharf. Hop a cable car from there to get to downtown attractions. We liked that it wasn't in the middle of everything, but it was still very easy to get around. Even though the hotel is on a very busy street, we did not have any problems with traffic noise. Breakfast was very nice with great choices. A word of caution...do not order from the In-Room Service menu. It was horrible, very expensive, and cold as ice by the time it was delivered. Go up Van Ness two blocks and have dinner at Little Joe's italian restaurant instead.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: There is no bay view at all.

review.title: Good Location for the price
review.reviewText: Rooms were a little small and no "extras" like pool or exercise room but good breakfast and the staff was very helpful.

review.title: Great hotel, great price
review.reviewText: Our family of four (two kids ages 6 and 2) went on a weekend getaway to the city. This hotel was great. We couldn't beat the price and the view of the Golden Gate was beautiful. The service was excellent. Everyone was very friendly. It is true that the parking garage is extremely tight. It's difficult to park, but not impossible...even with a minivan!! And you can hear traffic noise, but we all slept through it. If we were on a lower floor it may have been a problem. The location can't be beat. You can catch the bus right across the street and it takes you along Fisherman's Wharf, Ghiradelli Square, and Pier 39. You can also walk, but this was too convenient and cheap! All in all, we'll go back again. It's a great place to stay.

review.title: economy with comfort
review.reviewText: the hotel was close to many attractions, comfortable with a great price. No bells and whistles but the service was A+. The price for daily parking was outrages though...

review.title: Excellent hotel
review.reviewText: We have stayed at this hotel in the past and were not disappointed this time. The staff is friendly and the hotel is convenient to Fisherman's Wharf and other areas of interest. The only problem is the parking, which is a charge on top of your room and is very limited. But this is to be expected in a large city. We will diffently stay here again

review.title: Great stay for a great price!!
review.reviewText: My mother, son, and I just spent a week at the Comfort Inn By The Bay. The staff could not have been more helpful. The view was amazing, the breakfast filling, the beds, pillows/linens were very comfortable. We had a bay room with 2 queen beds and there was plenty of room (my 14 yo son is 6ft tall.) Either go early or late to breakfast, I simply made waffles and carted it all up to our room for breakfast with a view. Don't miss a trip to Muir Woods/Sausolito. Do take the cable car from Hyde St. on the wharf to China Town, $5 well spent. We'll be back.

review.title: Great View/Location
review.reviewText: Nice better than average hotel a couple of blocks from the Fisherman's Wharf. The parking garage was surreal and tiny, but be sure to get a bridge view room, well worth the extra few bucks. Two blocks from the Lombard Street hill as well.

review.title: Nice and in a great location
review.reviewText: The hotel's location makes it easy to travel in and out of the city. It is very nice and cheap compared to others.

review.title: Very Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel was really nice. The staff was really helpful and friendly. They had complimentary breakfast in the morning, which was really nice. And it wasn't too far of a walk from Fisherman's Wharf. Although they did charge us a fee for parking, I believe 25/day which we were not advise of. But other than that it was great.

review.title: Great For The Price
review.reviewText: We found the hotel to be clean, in a great location and the staff friendly and helpful. The continental breakfast was just that, but you could make yourself hot waffles...the fruit is limited -- apples and oranges...would have loved to see some bananas. The only downside is if you get a room with a view and are a light sleeper this is not the hotel for you. It is located on a extremely busy corner - Van Ness and Lombard and found you could hear the traffic all day and night. The windows in the rooms are only, which seemed to me to be only single pane, which would explain why the noise was extremely apparent even on the 8th floor. All in all, was very pleased with the hotel and would return.

review.title: NIce hotel close to the attractions.
review.reviewText: This place is nice and reasonably priced. The room was a bit on the smaller side but we didn't mind. Close to the cable cars and buses. Walking distance from the Fisherman's wharf. The room was comfortable and the staff was friendly and helpful. Good continental breakfast too.

review.title: Decent for the Price
review.reviewText: Overall, we were satisfied with the level of comfort and service, but I believe the Comfort Inn could be much better with not much more effort. The construction in the room was poor, e.g. the bathroom door did not shut all the way and the shower head was pulled away from the wall. And while underground parking is indeed a nice luxury (around $25/day), trying to maneuver in there is a game of roulette. There were many spots that necessitated a 3 or 5 point turn. In all, take it for what it is, a place to stay for not too much money, and you won't be disappointed.

review.title: Go early to breakfast
review.reviewText: My husband and I stayed in this hotel with our 2 children. We liked the location - straight up to Lombard's crooked street, easy walking to Fisherman's Wharf, and not far to bus lines. (But bring your walking shoes, it's hilly SF) Breakfast was crowded and the buffet lines didn't flow well. One morning we waited for a table, the other we took a tray to our room. We reserved a room with 2 queen beds but when we arrived they only had double-sized beds available. A little cramped but otherwise it was a comfortable and clean place to stay.

review.title: Great location for your money
review.reviewText: I was very impressed with this hotel. the staff is VERY nice and the rooms are VERY clean. the only problem was parking,i recommend leaving your car at the hotel when you get there and just take a cab to get around, or you can always walk. i will defenitly stay at this hotel again.

review.title: Fantastic location
review.reviewText: This hotel, at Van Ness and Lombard, is in walking distanse (or a short bus ride) from all downtown attractions. It also has a wonderful view of the Golden Gate Bridge on one side. In addition, breakfast was excellent, no less. The drawbacks: noisy on the Lombard (view) side, expensive night parking ($25).

review.title: very imressed!
review.reviewText: The views were great and so was the location. It was walking distance to a lot of popular locations and the staff was very helpful.

review.title: Location, location
review.reviewText: The location of this hotel was in walking distance of many popular destinations. The muni also was only a block away. Crookedest street was within 4 blocks of walking...uphill. The staff at the hotel were very polite and helpful in all ways, espcially with the routes for the muni. The room was small for a family of four, although we made it work. The beds were not very comfortable. The continential breakfast was a plus, although it would be nice if there were more healthy items other than hard-boiled eggs. The breakfast staff was also very polite and friendly. I would recommend this hotel to those who are looking for an inexpensive stay. It is an older hotel, however, the renovation done to it 5-6 years ago was benificial. I would stay here again. We went in the middle of April a great time weather-wise as well as not so busy tourist-time.

review.title: Everything but the bed was great
review.reviewText: The Comfort Inn by the Bay was a great hotel. It's within walking distance of Fisherman's Wharf and Pier 39. It's also steps from buss, trolley and cable car stops. It's also not on a hill! Everything was great at the hotel except the beds. They were a little uncomfortable, but for the price and location, that's a small price to pay.

review.title: Great View For The Price
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay with the beautiful view of the Golden Gate Bridge. The corner can be noisy because of the traffic, but did quiet down at night. The breakfast was very nice and we got plenty of exercise walking to all the attractions. We will stay there again.

review.title: good choice
review.reviewText: clean and comfortable- helpfull staff. I recommend getting the up-graded room with a view of the bay. It was worth the extra money. The hotel is also in a good location. I would stay there again.

review.title: Much nicer than we expected!
review.reviewText: The staff at The Comfort Inn by the Bay in San Francisco were kind, helpful and full of smiles! Our room was cleaned by a woman who must be married to Mr. Clean. The breakfast served each morning was fruit, bagels, waffles, etc. and there was always plenty to eat.

review.title: Great view but loud traffic noise
review.reviewText: The Comfort Inn by the Bay has a convenient location -- a short walk to tourist locations, including Lombard Street, Ghirardelli Square, Fisherman's Wharf, and cable car stops. And the bay-view rooms really do have a fabulous view. The hotel is clean if somewhat no-frills, and the service is good. It is, however, right on a major intersection, and the traffic noise (especially an extremely loud motorcycle at 4:00 AM) woke us up in the wee hours of the morning each day. Still, a great hotel for the price.

review.title: Good value and location
review.reviewText: We selected the Comfort Inn by the Bay for its price, but it has much to offer. First, the hotel is clean and some rooms have wonderful views. Second, the breakfast was a great way to start each day. Third, several popular destinations were in walking distance, or a short bus ride away.

review.title: Why would you stay any place else
review.reviewText: This was my second stay at comfort inn by the bay.The hotel has to be the best kept secret in San Francisco you could not be treated better by the staff,rooms are spotless location perfect,a great buffet breakfast each morning.After my first visit in Sept 05, which was great,I was hoping to have the same experience Apr 06,well they did it again.Thanks Comfort Inn for making my stay in San Francisco fantastic.

review.title: Would Go Back Again in a Flash!
review.reviewText: The romm was very comfortable, neat, and tidy. Even though the hotel is located on the corner of two main streets of San Francisco, it is very quiet. The free continental breakfast not only includes fruit, juice, coffee, and pastries, it aslo includes waffles and hard boiled eggs. The hotel is within walking distance of Ghiradelli Square and Fisherman's Wharf. The local neighborhood restaurants are charming and the food is delicious.

review.title: What you would expect from a Comfort Inn
review.reviewText: Our stay at Comfort Inn by the Bay was just what you would expect from a Comfort Inn. The desk staff was friendly, the room was clean - though by no means luxurious, and the complimentary continental breakfast was good. The room was a little small and the bed was not the most comfortable, but for the relatively inexpensive room rate, it was worth it. The hotel was nothing special, but was totally satisfactory.

review.title: Loved it.
review.reviewText: The room was small, but clean, the bed very comfortable. Free breakfast was a plus and we love free internet. We were also close to everything.

review.title: middle of the road....
review.reviewText: This hotel is located on the opposite end of Cannery Row from the Aquarium.. still within walking distance but a bit of a hike. The vaulted ceilings and gas fireplace made the rooms comfortable and roomy. Small balcony .. not much in the way of a view .. the coffee maker in our room didn't work.. arrrggg

review.title: Great value for a family trip
review.reviewText: All around, this hotel met expectations. The free breakfast was nice but if they are going to serve waffles they shouldn't skimp on the syrup Sugar free doesn't cut it.

review.title: great value..within walking distance to lots of stuff
review.reviewText: Good hotel for the money.. room was clean and comfortable .. nice views on the bay side.. OK breakfast included the parking garage below the hotel is a bit of a nightmere .. very tight..one ways with tight turns.. a challenge with a big vehicle

review.title: San Francisco Stay
review.reviewText: This is close to all we want to see. The room are afforable, clean, and what we asked for. I would recommend this hotel to family & friend.

review.title: Fabulous!! Clean, great service, convenient, & inexpensive...plus free breakfast
review.reviewText: Stay here! This Comfort Inn provides excellent service for such a reasonable price. It is very convenient to Fisherman's Wharf if you don't mind a little walking. The breakfast was so nice each morning. All the staff went out of their way to be polite at all times and everyone was so helpful with directions, airport shuttle, room rates, etc. I have stayed at other Comfort Inns, but this Comfort Inn is truly exceptional and deserves five stars!

review.title: Good Hotel For The Price
review.reviewText: Nice hotel for the price. The continental breakfast was wonderful - highly recommened. The reception people were very helpful with local suggestion. It is 6 blocks to Fisherman's Wharf & 3 of them are hills. Beware if you have a rental car - the cost for parking is $25 per night plus tax. The first room we were given had water leaking in all over the floor coming from the window because of the rain (it appears to have been a problem for a while). We contacted the front desk and they changed our room. Overall the hotel was nice and clean and I would recommend it.

review.title: Nice walk to the Wharf
review.reviewText: At the corner of busy Lombard and Van Ness, this property provided the accommodations we wanted for our interests. The staff is friendly and helpful, the continental breakfast is above average and in a nice setting, and the street noise, while audible, did not disturb us (except when a severe windstorm blew down a big tree outside our window onto a bmw and the street below!). Muni stops are close by, but the walk down to the Wharf area is relaxing and not that far. (even in the rain....always carry your umbrella when walking.) If you seek a smoking room, know that only the 3rd floor is available, so your "deluxe bay view room" must be kept in context with the floor you are on. The neighborhood felt safe, but as in any city, always be vigilant and aware of your surroundings.

review.title: Surprisingly excellent considering the low price!
review.reviewText: I'm not sure why this hotel is only 2.5 stars. I originally chose it because reviews all spoke of how convenient it was (very true), but the hotel was also a pleasure. Our room had ample space for 2 people and would have been fine with 4. We upgrade to the view room, and it was worth it. And most importantly - FREE CONTINENTAL BREAKFAST EVERY DAY, and a very good selection at that.

review.title: Ok but not great location
review.reviewText: The hotels position is ok however it says it is only a few blocks walk to cable car etc but these are some of the steepest hills in SF making it a real effert to get anywhere. For an extra few pounds a night you can get a hotel right in the heart of fishermans warf or union square. The breakfast was good but the room although appeard clean had toe nail clippings left on the floor and dirty around the edges.

review.title: Nice Hotel...Cosy and Comfortable
review.reviewText: We were in this hotel from Dec23rd to Dec25th 2005, and luckily we managed to get a Bay facing room. The hotel was pretty full and therefore we couldnt manage an early check-in, even though we reached at around 10:00am (usual check in time being 4 pm). The rooms were nice and clean, although we would have preferred a slightly larger room ... it did look a bit crammed with 2 Queen Beds. The hotel service was very efficient. Add to that a sumptuous complimentary breakfast and free wireless internet service.... this is a place where I will go back again. This is one of the very few hotels in the Bay area that offer a clear view of the Golden Gate Bridge (but try to get a room on the higher floor). Most other hotels in the same area are not high rises, and hence the view is obstructed.

review.title: Hidden Gem
review.reviewText: Ask for a Bay View room and you won't be disappointed. We were on the 3rd floor and had a spectacular view of the Golden Gate Bridge and the bay. We sat at the table in front of the window and gazed on in wonder. For the price, you can't beat this. We have most guests who come to visit us, stay here.

review.title: Noisy aircondition
review.reviewText: Hotel is very close to Laguradia Airport. The air conditions in the room and bath room are very noisy.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: We just stayed there over Thanksgiving for 3 nights and enjoyed our stay. Location was convenient, close to bus stops and Fisherman's Wharf. Nice view of the bay from our window. Continental breakfast was above average. I would go back if given the opportunity.

review.title: Very Impressed
review.reviewText: We had a great time. The staff was very helpful, the room was exactly as described. We would definately stay there again.

review.title: Value for Money!
review.reviewText: The Hotel was excellent value for the money. Very clean, nice size rooms. The view was more than I anticipated. The Continental Breakfast was more than adequate and as advertised, we had no trouble getting a table. Convienent location, easy transit trip to anywhere you wanted to go.

review.title: great place to sleep
review.reviewText: They were very helpful from the beginning, my friend from the east coast got there 4 hours before me and check in time and they let her have the room. It was clean, quiet. I thought breakfast was great, but I am not a huge breakfast eater. Very, very close to the Wharf, we walked everytime. Very great place to stay after a long day of sightseeing.

review.title: Great Place To Stay
review.reviewText: Great View, Great Staff, An Extremely Enjoyable Time!

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Fast, friendly service. secure parking. On busline.

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: Close to Fishermans Wharf, Good breakfeast.

review.title: Good value for the location
review.reviewText: I had been searching online for the best value for hotel stay, and after days of looking online, I decided to choose the Comfort Inn by the Bay. Honestly, for the location being a few blocks from the Wharf, the price is awesome! There's a bus stop up the block on Chestnut and Van Ness that will take you through all the major attractions (Wharf, Chinatown, Union Square/Downtown). But the hotel itself was great. The staff was attentive, the room was clean and comfortable. I would come back here again.

review.title: good hotel location
review.reviewText: very impressed with hotel and continental breakfast

review.title: Convenient location
review.reviewText: Despite arriving at our hotel to no running water due to work being done, our stay was overall satisfactory. The rooms were clean, and the location of the hotel was just a short walk from Fisherman's Wharf. The complimentary continental breakfast was a good start to the day without adding expense. For the cost and location of this hotel, I would certainly suggest it to friends and I would not hesitate to stay here again.

review.title: It will work
review.reviewText: Okay hotel. Clean, but parking was $20/day, and to get into the parking garage, you have to press the intercom, wait, wait, wait, tell them who you are and your room number, then wait, wait for the slowest gate in history. Breakfast was good and tasty. Comfy hotel, but nothing to write home about.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: This is an old hotel but well maintained. It could use some upgrading to make it really nice. They have a nice complimentary breakfast every morning and the wireless internet worked great. It's located on a major street with easy access to bus or walk to the warf. There are 2 small, excellent family run restaurants directly across the street

review.title: Near everything!
review.reviewText: We enjoyed a spectacular bay view room during our recent stay. This hotel is near everything. The complimentary continental breakfast is a nice touch. The staff was very courteous. I would definitely stay there again.

review.title: Great condition for price
review.reviewText: Probably the best deal I have had in a while for price compared to amenities. Convenient location, clean rooms and friendly staff. Contninental breakfast had more options than I expected as well.

review.title: good place to stay
review.reviewText: great location for public transportation and access to tourist sites; staff was terrific with help getting to those sites

review.title: Good Value
review.reviewText: Good value for hotel Enjoyed having wireless connection. Close to everything and bus lines.

review.title: good value by the Bay
review.reviewText: Great location, close to all of the major attractions in San Francisco. Rooms were kept very clean, very helpful staff, and nice breakfast every morning. Will definitely be back here.

review.title: Small rooms but exceptionally clean and good location
review.reviewText: This hotel was within walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf and just a good location. We were not at the hotel much since we were out sightseeing, but the room was exceptionally clean and the staff were very helpful with directions, etc. The continental breakfast left a lot to be desired - fruit was tiny apples and oranges - and choices were only bagles, toast, english muffins,cereal, etc., - but enough to get you started for the day. Overall, for the price, I was impressed.

review.title: Comfortable, quiet and affordable.
review.reviewText: The hotel is located just a few blocks from Fisherman's Wharf, an easy 15 walk or 5 minute bus ride. The room, and the hotel as a whole, was clean and quiet. Get a bayside view if you can afford a few extra bucks.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: The location was great; warm, friendly and knowlegable staff. Very clean.

review.title: Average hotel
review.reviewText: We probably would stay at this hotel again. The location is great, 10 minute walk to Fisherman's Wharf, right up the hill to Lombard's crookedest street. The breakfast buffett was ok, but had the same thing everyday.

review.title: Great Value for the Money
review.reviewText: This hotel is excellent for someone who doesn't need the luxuries. It is close to the Wharf area and is clean, safe, and appealing. We were plesantly surprised as was everyone else we talked to at the hotel. A great baragin for San Francisco.

review.title: clean, nice views, but lacking the 'friendly' atmosphere
review.reviewText: arrived at 9:30 a.m. - but were told we could not check in till after 4 p.m.! They did hold our luggage, but the man at the desk was quite curt - to the point of rudeness, and we had no opportunity to 'freshen up' after traveling from Utah. The room was nice enough, the view was terrific (bay view, cleaning staff did a great job daily. probably won't stay here again though.

review.title: Excellent Hotel Close to Ghiardelli Square
review.reviewText: The Comfort Inn by the Bay has postcard quality views over the Bay and freshly-decorated rooms which are comfortable and cheerful.  The hotel was reasonably quiet, taking into consideration that it sits at the intersection of Lombard and Van Ness, a very high volume intersection with lots of big truck traffic.  Our room had all the usual little amenities one expects of a nice hotel these days, such as a coffee maker, ironing board and iron and complementary toiletries.  The hotel is within easy walking distance of Ghirardelli Square.  Parking is under the hotel.  The lanes and spaces in the garage are some of the smallest I've ever dealt with, however.  We were driving a Honda CR-V, which has the wheelbase of a Civic.  That was difficult and required much maneuvering.  The hotel offers a very decent continental breakfast buffet, muffins, bagels, cereals, fruit, juice, coffee, in a dining area on the main floor with lots of room and views out to Lombard through a wall of windows.  Overall a really nice place to stay.

review.title: Nice, Great Value
review.reviewText:
Nothing fancy hotel, friendly staff the rooms are very clean, nice location very near of Fisherman's wharf and atractions, the breakfast is OK.
Hey!! the parking is a nightmare, is to tight very difficult to manuever inside of this garage. When finaly you park your car you may be think to move it again.

review.title: I would stay again
review.reviewText:
The Comfort Inn, was just that comfortable and very clean.
Staff was accomodating and friendly. Our room did not really have a view, we were on the 2nd floor facing apartments, but the comfort and cleanliness surpassed the need for the view.
Location was close enough to walk to Ghirardelli Square and beyond and safe enough to return back during evening hours via the bus.
I was very happy with my choice of this hotel.

review.title: Saved a Bundle
review.reviewText: Wife, Son and I stayed for 7 nights. Typical economy hotel/motel as far as rooms go(little small), but we didn't go to stay in our room. Clean, good location for us. Bought 7 Day Muni Passports(saved a lot vs rental car+gas+parking) to get around instead of renting car. This hotel is great because of buses running all day and evening that are right at your doorstep. Also, they have a great continental breakfast(FREE!!!) starting @ 6:30AM every morning;coffee,juices,cereal,fruit,bagels,toast,etc...... so we never had to go anywhere else for breakfast.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Have stayed at Comfort Inn many times as it is located within walking distance of Fisherman's Wharf and  Union/Filbert Area.  Many good restaurants within walking distance.  Nice little continental breakfast.  Rooms are reasonable, but parking is expensive  approx $22.50 per day.  We leave our car and walk everywhere.  Staff is efficient and helpful.

review.title: Satisfied
review.reviewText: Very friendly and helpful employees at front desk. Hotel location a few blocks away from the hub-bub of the wharf suited our family well. Rooms were very clean-if there was any gripe-lack of cable TV channels.

review.title: Good Choice
review.reviewText: Nothing fancy, but a good price that included parking.  Parking lot left much to be desired, don't bring a large car as it's a very tight squeeze.  Hotel room was good size and very clean.  Linens were so-so.

review.title: Great Stay
review.reviewText: Perfect place to stay while in San Francisco.  Convenient to many area attractions!!

review.title: A great last minute deal
review.reviewText: The hotel was clean and inviting, the staff friendly and the room clean and comfortable. It was a nice walk to Fisherman's Wharf (15 min) and the continental breaksfast was well stocked, of good quality and the staff were very friendly and made you feel welcome even when you arrived not long before closing. We were  very saisfied over all and would not hesitate to go back or refer the hotel to friends or family.

review.title: Very unimpressed
review.reviewText: Location is great, really close to the Wharf. However, if you are driving there is a $20 fee per day plus tax for parking and there is no way to park on the street for more than 2 hours. Continental breakfast was really dull. The Front Desk people were less than friendly. The room was ok, but the bathroom was not very functional (the toilet), plus the people who cleaned it apparently were loosing their hair, because we found many of those around. There is a rating card that you can fill out, but you are supposed to give it to the people at the Front Desk...What is the point?

review.title: Comfort Inn By The Bay
review.reviewText: Good location, within walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf.  Extensive public transport system (busses) pass right by the property. Nice views of the Bay.  Good value, great breakfast.

review.title: notes
review.reviewText: excellent location; nice continental breakfast, parking at hotel was $20 a day!

review.title: Comfort Inn By The Bay
review.reviewText: The garage is so tight that it was difficult for me to manuever my Audi S4.  I had to do a "5 point turn" to get out of registration. Good luck manuveuring if you drive an SUV or large car.  You must use steps to get from the parking area to the lobby and then take an elevator to the room.  This is difficult if you are trying to avoid the 5 point turn at the registration area when you check out (you will need to shlep your luggage down the steps).  This also makes the place unfriendly for disabled.  The maid left us a 1/2 empty bottle of shampoo.  I thought that was tacky.  They would be better off not even putting shampoo in the room.  The room was quieter than some hotels in San Francisco and we could see the Golden Gate Bridge off to the side.

review.title: Comfort Inn by the Bay is in a great location for the leisure traveler.
review.reviewText: Great value considering the high prices of hotels in San Francisco.  The continental breakfast was way more than expected and the hotel is near a public transportation line for getting around town. No need for the high priced taxi.

review.title: A great place to stay.
review.reviewText: Very welcoming and hospitable.  The Continental breakfast is a plus.  Well located and very clean.

review.title: Nice Hotel - Great Value
review.reviewText: Very clean - newly remodled and it was done exceptionally well - Good value - very nice place to stay - very clean
